loans.name: Ergashjon

texts.en:
A hardworking and dedicated businesswoman, Ergashjon S. has operated a business making national-style women's dresses and socks in the central market of Isfara for the past 13 years. Ergashjon is seamstress by profession. Being in this kind of business for along time, she is well known and her dresses are always in good demand at the market. Her husband (who is pictured in the photo) helps her with the business and usually sells dresses at the market, while Ergashjon is always busy fulfilling orders from her customers. Ergashjon has utilized microfinance loans from IMON Interantional to accomplish this development, repaying each with a perfect credit history. Ergashjon’s business is the sole source of income for her family. Currently, she is seeking a loan of 2000 Somoni (600 USD) to increase her clothing inventory, allowing her to increase her profits and provide a higher standard of living for her family.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and the most famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina (Avicenna). The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMONl's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing fabric for sewing national-style dresses

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa A. is a 64-year-old trader. She is married and a mother with ten children, but three have passed away. Currently four attend senior high school in the next town. She trades in onions, tomatoes, and peppers, etc. on a table-top in a village market at Nkawkaw where she lives. She treks to Kumasi to buy her stock of goods in bulk and retails them in the surrounding towns during their market days. She says through this business, she has endeavored to support three of her kids to finish junior high school. She requests loan to enable her buy increased stock of tomatoes, onions, and peppers to grow her business to boost profit. She hopes to increase her savings to support the children's education, to give them a future and hope.

Afia is convinced that with her 8 years trade experience, when the loan is givien to her, she will have more resources to expand her business growth. Afia belongs to a village bank called ‘Kristo nti’ which means 'Christ Sake'. She hopes to receive GH¢600 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: For the purchased of increased stock of vegetables like onions, tomatoes, and peppers, etc.

loans.name: Moshi

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 26 years old Moshi M. from Mbeya. She is married with two children, ages 4 and 10. Moshi has been running a grocery business since 2001. Her business is to purchase soft drinks and drinks like beer and whisky for reselling in her business.

She works at the business for 13 hours per day, 7 days per week, and is assisted by 4 employees. Moshi currently earns about $300 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $675 in order to purchase more drinks for her grocery. In the future, she plans to expand her business by increasing the number and variety of drinks in her business. Moshi thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks for her grocery  in bulk

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es: El señor Salvador labora para una empresa en el área de producción, su esposa lo apoyo ya que también ella trabaja para tener una vida mas cómoda y sin apuros. Ellos están solicitando este crédito para la colocación de protecciones en puertas y ventanas de su casa; ya que les acaban de hacer entrega de su casita y necesitan de mayor seguridad para ellos y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Salvador works for a production company. His wife supports him, as she also works to have a comfortable life without being put in tight spots. They are asking for a loan to install protection in the doors and windows of their house, as they have just received the house and they need more security for themselves and their children.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installment of protection for their house

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia M. is a trader. Cecilia’s husband is a carpenter and she has no children. She has no educational background. She sells gari at Elmina, which she has been doing since 2007. She uses cassava in preparing her gari.

She would use the money given her to expand her business. Cecilia would then use the profit she would gain from the business to cater for her family’s utility bills and other financial needs.

loans.use: She would use the money given her to expand her business.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah A. is a 38-year-old trader. She is divorced with four children. She has sold used clothes in a local market of Cape Coast, in the Central Region of Ghana, for ten years now. With the income from her business, Hannah is supporting two of her kids in senior high school, while the eldest is learning to drive. Her major business challenge over the years has been finding sufficient funds to enlarge the business, especially in this crucial time for the economy. She has lots of marketing experience, and is very confident that the loan would enable her to achieve remarkable progress for her business. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothes and kids' wear to serve her customers. She hopes to save enough to support her kids to the tertiary level of education. With the loan, she believes she can rent a store to conduct her business, rather than sitting by the road side. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Psalm 23.’

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes and kids' clothing

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth es socia del bancomunal Grandioso  Milagro.
Elizabeth es conviviente tiene 26 años, dos hijos de 6 años que va la escuela estatal y el otro estar por nacer.
Elizabeth termino la escuela y no estudio nada, se puso a trabajar en ventas, al tiempo salio embarazada y se fue a vivir con su esposo,  empezó vendiendo polos que su esposo le trae de la fabrica donde trabaja, pero ahora ella quiere confeccionar sabanas y ropa en general. 
Elizabet necesita un préstamo de  800  soles, para la compra de una maquina, y compra de tela para hacer sabanas.
Desde que esta en Finca, aprendió ahorrar, a ser responsable y a escuchar a las señoras que tiene mas experiencia en el negocio, a como incursionar en nuevos negocios. 
El sueño de Elizabeth es comprarse su casa por que vive en casa de sus suegros.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the Grandioso Milagro communal bank. She is 26 years old and lives with her husband. She has two children who are 6 years old and go to the state school, and another will be born soon. Elizabeth finished school and didn’t continue her education. She started working in sales. Eventually she got pregnant and went to live with her husband. She started selling polo shirts that her husband brings from the factory where he works. But now she wants to make sheets and clothing in general. Elizabeth needs a loan of 800 PEN to buy a sewing machine and fabric for making sheets. Since she has been with Finca, she has learned to save, to be responsible, to listen to the women that have more experience in the business, and to venture into new businesses. Elizabeth’s dream is buy a house because she lives in her in-law’s house.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Elizabeth needs a loan of 800 PEN to buy a sewing machine and fabric for making sheets.

loans.name: Kuburat

texts.en: Kuburat A. resides in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 35 years old and married with two children. She sells rechargeable phone cards. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell. Kuburat says a big thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell.

loans.name: Maruf

texts.en: B. Maruf is forty years old and married with four children. He is a fashion designer and he also sells sarongs.  He is requesting a loan of N60,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Biema

texts.en:
Having been engaged in farming with her husband for fifteen years, 35-year-old Biema Y. pursued a farm production business to provide for their basic needs and their only child’s education. She plans to own a hectare (2.5 acres) of rice field in the future, which makes her become more determined to expand their business.

Currently, Biema is applying for a Php 10,000 loan from the Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) to raise additional capital for their business. She also wants to obtain CEVI’s other services like micro-insurance and training.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farming necessities

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Esmeralda”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 27 años y es madre de 03 hijos, los 03 que aun dependen de ella.Con la seguridad y optimismo que siempre le ha caracterizado, por iniciativa propia implemento su propio negocio de venta de golosinas, ubicada en el tercer piso de la Municipalidad Provincial de Tarapoto, donde cuenta con un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes. Lleva varios años dedicándose a este tipo de negocio y esta muy contenta con lo logrado, ya que le va muy bien.En la actualidad, pese al tiempo transcurrido continúa con el mismo negocio, contando con una clientela ya fidelizada, siendo sus principales clientes los mismos trabajadores de la Municipalidad,  que a diario acuden a su puesto, donde ella los atiende con el carisma que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará golosinas como: paquetes de galletas en diferentes sabores, keres, chifles en docenas, chocolates como: cañonazos, sublimes,  para aumentar sus productos y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. Esta preparada para todo y aun se siente con muchas fuerzas para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante. Gladys, agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Gladys belongs to the Esmeralda Community Bank in the district of Tarapoto, province of San Martín, Peru. She is a 27-year-old mother of three children and lives with her partner. With the confidence and optimism that has always characterized her, she started her own business selling snacks on the the third floor of the municipal building in Tarapoto, where she has a well-conditioned place to serve her customers. She has made a living in this type of business for a number of years and is very satisfied with what she has achieved since it has gone very well. Currently, despite the passage of time, she continues working with the same business and relies on a faithful customer base. Her main clients are people who work in the building where she daily takes up her post and whom she tends to with the charisma she's known for. With the loan of 2,000, she plans to purchase snacks such as, different kinds of packaged cookies, chifles (fried banana slices covered in caramel), and various chocolates, to increase her supplies and better serve her customers. Gladys feels very prepared for everything and still has a strong desire to continue working and making headway. She is grateful for Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing snacks

loans.name: Bianita

texts.en:
Having many children in her family is a difficult thing, says Bianita. She is sending all of her seven children to school to finish at least two year courses so they can apply for better jobs someday. With the limited income from her general store business, Bianita is able to help support the education of her children and meet their daily basic needs. Bianita is using all her best strategies and effort to overcome the trials in life.

To help her in the current financial crisis, Bianita is now seeking 10,000 PHP financial assistance from Kiva as additional capital to make her business progress. This loan will be a great help to make her business grow and provide more income.

loans.use: To expand a general store

loans.name: Gnakoudalo

texts.fr: Cette dame est veuve et a 03 enfants à sa charge. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, elle vend depuis 1998 dans le marché d’Assiyéyé à Lomé des friperies. Elle livre aussi ces vêtements à des clients à domicile. Pour nenouveler son stock qui épuise, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 06 bals de vêtements de toute sorte. Elle a une clientèle qui lui est fidèle.

loans.use: Achat des bals de friperie

loans.name: Zaujat

texts.en:
Zaujat is a 24-year-old single woman and a member of the Nyamhanga borrowers' group. She lives in Ruaha, located in Tanzania’s Iringa administrative region. Zaujat opened her beauty salon two years ago where she works eight hours a day. She earns approximately 150,000 Tsh a month.

This is Zaujat’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She is requesting a loan of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more supplies for her business. With the additional profits she gains from the use of this loan, Zaujat hopes to save money and expand her business.

About BRAC Tanzania:

BRAC Tanzania is guided by the vision to aspire and work towards a just, enlightened, healthy and democratic society free from hunger, poverty, environmental degradation and all forms of exploitation based on age, sex, religion and ethnicity. The vision is explicitly reflected in the mission statement, which is to strive to bring about positive changes in the quality of life of the poor wherever it works.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for her salon

loans.name: Norlinda

texts.en:
Norlinda used to manage a village store. However, she went bankrupt and was forced to close her store. She is now asking to borrow business capital from KIVA lenders so she can re-open her store so she can help her husband in providing for the needs of their family.

She is now asking to borrow a loan of PHP 6,000 that she can use to purchase more grocery items for her store. She hopes that this time, her business will grow towards its total development.

Norlinda is married to Generoso Sr. They have eight children and they are living in the village of Burgos Ramon, Isabela. Their eldest daughter is already married. Their second child is Generoso Jr. - 22 years old, college graduate; Generoso I - 19 years old, a college student; Roselyn - 16 years old, fourth year high school; Rose Anne - 14 years old, second year high school; Rosebelle - 12 years old, grade school; Dion Anthony -10 years old, also in grade school and Genery - 8 years old. She hopes to give them all an education, hoping for them to have a better future someday.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Remelyn

texts.en: Remelyn D. is vendor of cradle in their village. She is married to John, a construction worker and blessed with two children: Jonalyn-2 years old and Jomell-10 months old. Remelyn would like to buy additional materials like threads she needed in making a cradle.  This is the reason why she is asking for a loan capital from the KIVA lenders amounting to PHP5,000.00.  This will serves a big help in their family most especially in sustaining financial needs of her children.

loans.use: Additional capital for business development

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy work supplies and equipment

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica D. sells sweet apples and fresh fish in Elmina near Bantama. She is single and has two children. Monica has completed senior high school. She has been selling sweet apples and fish since 2005. She is responsible for payments on her apartment, utility bills and the school fees of her children. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to sell. She hopes to save the profits from her business to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Eloisa Marina

texts.es: Eloisa C. es una mujer emprendedora, vive en el distrito de Calleria región de Ucayali, tiene 29 años, es madre de tres menores de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de pescado, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es motocarrista. Ella forma parte del Banco Comunal “Juntas hasta el final” desde hace tres años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que le permitió invertir en la compra de pescado fresco y seco para vender en el mercado Bellavista de Pucallpa. En la actualidad Eloísa requiere un crédito de 800 soles que utilizará para comprar pescado y seguir vendiendo en el mercado Bellavista. La meta de Eloísa es tener una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
texts.en:
Eloisa C. is an entrepreneurial woman whose business is selling fish. She lives in the Calleria district in the Ucayali region. She is 29 years old and the mother of three young children. She counts with the support of her husband who drives a three-wheeled taxi. She has been a member of the communal bank “Juntas hasta el final” for three years. Her first loan of 300 soles allowed her to buy fresh and dried fish to sell in the Bellavista market in Pucallpa. This time, Eloísa is requesting an 800 soles loan to buy fish and be able to continue to sell in the Bellavista market. Eloísa’s goal is to have a small grocery store inside her house.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish at wholesale.

loans.name: Abiola

texts.en: Abiola is 40 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a civil servant and together they support the home. To earn a living, Abiola sells bottles of wine and groceries at retail prices in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. In the future, she hopes to own a supermarket. She is requesting a loan of 80,000 NGN to purchase more wine and groceries to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more wine and groceries to sell

loans.name: Sdaeng's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sdaeng S. is the leader of a group of four people who all live in Roka village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a 0.5 hectare field of land where she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Thol Savy, is a fisherman. He wants to expand his fishing, so Mrs. Sdaeng S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishing nets. She is 34 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy more fishing nets

loans.name: Fight For Shameness Group

texts.en:
These are the members of the Fight for Shameness group in the city of Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. These small-scale entrepreneurs have applied through SMT for a loan of SLL 500,000 each in order to buy more goods for their businesses. This way they can increase their sales; earn higher profits and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group is Randa A. on the right side of the photo. Randa is 39 years old and was born in Bo city in southern Sierra Leone. She is married to a businessman and they have 3 children – one in college and two in secondary school. Randa sells gari (food made out of ground cassava roots), magi (used to sweeten sauces), onions, tomatoes, soaps and other goods. She has been in this business for two years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy soap, gari, onions and tomatoes.

loans.use: Buy soap, gari, onions and tomatoes

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La señorita Elena es socia del Banco Comunal “Brisas del Lago” desde hace 8 meses, vive en el distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 35 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Ella estudió superior completo, tienen su tienda de abarrotes.

Elena nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 600.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar arroz, azucar, fideos, aceite, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es trabajar mucho para agrandar su negocio.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la amabilidad con la que nos trata las promotoras.
texts.en:
Ms. Elena has been a member of the community bank "Brisas del Lago" for 8 months. She is 35 years old, single and does not have any children. Elena lives in the district, province and department of Puno. She completed high school and has her own grocery store. Elena tells us that with the first loan she received from Movimiento Manuela Ramos which was in the amount of 500 nuevo soles (PEN), she was able to increase her working capital. She is now requesting a loan in the amount of 600 nuevo soles (PEN) with which she will be able to buy rice, sugar, pastas, oil, etc. Elena's future dream is to work a lot so that she can expand her business. What she likes most about her community bank is the kindness with which she is treated.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, pastas and oil.

loans.name: Emmalinda

texts.en:
Emmalinda R., 41, is making sure that her family has enough for their daily needs. She is married to Joselito R., a buko (coconut) juice vendor, and they are blessed with 2 children. She helps her husband earn a living so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own buko salad and buko juice business for 10 years now.

Emmalinda has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and consistently pays her weekly dues. Due to her good repayment performance with previous loans, she has been able to borrow 4 times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She always pays her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her buko salad and buko juice business.

Now, with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 49,000 loan. This amount will be used to expand her business by buying raw materials for her salad and juice business.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can have enough money for her children’s college education. 


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her salad and juice business.

loans.name: Roman

texts.es: El Sr. Roman  es de vallegrande de profesion zapatero , hace 10 años que el radica en cañada sthroger adquirio una parcela, en la cual trabaja tambien con la agricultura justamente con su esposa hilda, siembra maiz. Arroz, yuca, sorgo, tambien tiene sus sitricos como ser naranja, mandarina, para despues comercializarlo en el mercado de la zona, es muy trabajador ya que tiene dos actividades, el destino del  credito es para la compra de herramientas de zapateria ya que las que tiene ya estan muy gastadas y no le permiten realizar un buen trabajo y por tal motivo no satisface a sus clientes, esta agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Roman is from Vallegrande and works as a shoemaker. 10 years ago he acquired a parcel of land which he farms with his wife, Hilda. He grows corn, rice, yucca, and sorghum and also has his citrus trees, oranges and mandarin oranges. He sells his products in the local market and is a hard worker. He will use the money from this loan to buy new shoe making tools because the ones he has are worn out and they no longer allow him to do quality work to satisfy his customers. He is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust they have placed in him by helping him obtain this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tools

loans.name: Gerson

texts.es:
EL SR. GERSON VIVE EN LA LOCALIDAD DE LA GUARDIA DISTANTE 20 KM. DE LA CIUDAD DE SANTA CRUZ , DONDE VIVE EN UNA CASA EN ANTICRETICO, ESTA CASADO Y TIENE DOS HIJOS PEQUEÑOS, COMO ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL EL SE DEDICA AL SERVICIO DE TRANSPORTE DE PERSONAS Y COMO SEGUNDA ACTIVIDAD A LA CONSTRUCCION; YA QUE EL NEGOCIO DEL TRANSPORTE NO ES ESTABLE.
 
SU ESPOSA LA SRA. MAGDALENA, SE DEDICA A CUIDAR DE SUS HIJOS, POR LO QUE EL TIENE QUE TRABAJAR DESDE MUY TEMPRANO HASTA LARGAS HORAS DE LA NOCHE PARA LLEVAR EL SUSTENTO DIARIO A SU FAMILIA. EL ES UNA PERSONA RESPONSABLE, DINAMICA Y MUY TRABAJADORA QUE TIENE QUE TRABAJAR DURO PARA MEJORAR LA CALIDAD DE VIDA DE TODA SU FAMILIA, EL DINERO DEL CREDITO LO UTILIZARA EN LA REPARACION Y MANTENIMIENTO DE SU VEHICULO Y ASI PODER BRINDAR MEJOR SERVICIO A SUS CLIENTES. ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.  

SI QUIERES SABER MAS DE LA PROVINCIA EL TORNO  LA GUARDIA VISITA LA PAGINA http://www.ocasha-ccs.org/Proyecto/Eltorno.htm
texts.en:
Sr. Gerson lives in the town of La Guardia, which is 20km from the city of Santa Cruz. He lives in a house through an “anticretico” arrangement (in which the property owner pawns the house to the occupant). Gerson is married and has two young children. He works in the transportation sector, but also has a second job in construction since his transport business is not stable. His wife Sra. Magdalena looks after their children so that he can work in the early hours until late into the night to support their family. Gerson is a responsible, dynamic, and hardworking person who puts in tremendous effort to improve the quality of life for his family. He will use this loan to repair and perform maintenance on his vehicle in order to offer better service to his clients. He is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for their trust by providing this loan. If you would like to learn more about the province of El Torno or La Guardia visit the website: http://www.ocasha-ccs.org/Proyecto/Eltorno.htm

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repairs

loans.name: Betsy Alexandra

texts.es:
En la parroquia Picoaza a pocos minutos de la capital manabita vistamos en banco comunal San Andrés, este en un sitio donde sus habitantes se dedican al comercio en diferentes formas, ya sea la venta de ropa, utensilio de cocina y en época de navidad es en este lugar donde se pueden encontrara los juguetes mas económicos y de todos los modelos.

La Señora Alexandra tiene 28 años con 3 hijos y desde hace 2 ciclos esta formando parte  de este banco comunal, con su actual esposo ella han formado una pequeña dulcería, su especialidad son las cocadas, la mamá de el esposo fue quien les motivo para que tenga su negocio, la señora Alexandra se encarga de la preparación de los dulces mientras que el esposo es el encargado de llevar a cabo la venta.

Para nuestra socia Alexandra el hecho de tener este negocio desde hace 6 años le ha permitido ir creciendo en ámbito personal y profesional. Ahora ella ya tiene su negocio bien establecido y por ahora piensa seguir con el mismo se siente muy a gusto trabajando en el, con este nuevo préstamo es para invertir en la materia prima que es el coco, azúcar y fundas, ahora ya tiene mas clientes y sus cocadas se venden en otras provincias.
texts.en:
In the parish of Picoaza, which is a few minutes away from the capital of Manabita, we visited the San Andrés Communal Bank. The inhabitants of this area are involved in different forms of trade such as selling clothing and cooking utensils. During the Christmas season, this is the place to find the most affordable toys of all types.

Sra. Alexandra is 28 years old and has three children. She has been part of this Communal Bank for the last two loan cycles. Alexandra and her husband opened a small candy store, with her specialty being coconut macaroons. Her mother-in-law was the person who convinced them to start this business. Alexandra is in charge of preparing the sweets while her husband is responsible for conducting the sales.

She has owned her business for six years and says that it has helped her to grow personally and professionally. Now that her business is well-established, she plans to continue working in the same manner because she enjoys the experience. With this new loan she will invest in raw materials such as coconut, sugar, and bags. Now that she has more customers, her coconut macaroons are selling in other provinces.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase coconut, sugar, and bags

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: LA SRA. SOFIA ESTA CASADA, ES ARTESANA, SE DEDICA LA ARTESANIA EN MACRAME DE CARTERAS, MANTAS Y OTROS PRODUCTOS LOS MISMOS QUE REPARTE  Y VENDE POR TODA LA ZONA SUD, LA ACTIVIDAD QUE REALIZA LA AYUDA A PODER SOSTENER SU HOGAR COMFORMADO POR 2 HIJOS UNO DE ELLOS ESTUDIA EN COLEGIO Y EL OTRO EN LA UNIVERSIDAD, TAMBIEN SE PUDO VERIFCAR QUE LA CLIENTE VIVE MODESTAMENTE YA QUE NO TIENE MUCHOS MUEBLESY ENSERES EN EL CUARTO DONDE VIVEN, EL ESPOSO SE DEDICA A LA CARPINTERIA Y HACE TRABAJOS EVENTUALES, POR TODO LO MENSIONADO SE LE DIO LA TASA PREFERENCIAL KIVA. TRABAJAN DURO PARA SALIR ADELANTE Y PODER MEJORAR LA CALIDAD DE VIDA DE TODA SU FAMILIA, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Sofia is married, and she is an artisan. She makes macramé bags, blankets, and other handicraft type products. She delivers and sells them all over the southern region. This activity helps her to be able to support her household, which is comprised of two children. One goes to school, and the other attends the university. Also, it was verified that this client lives modestly. There is not much furniture or many possessions in the room where they live. Her husband is a carpenter, and he works sporadically. For all of the things that have bee mentioned, she was given the preferred interest rate from Kiva. They work hard to get ahead and to be able to improve the quality of life for the whole family. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust they have shown in granting her loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material

loans.name: Dubai Group

texts.en:
Imanuel is 47 years old and married with three children.  His eldest child is 28 years old and married.  His other children are 19 and 8 years old and they go to school.  For five years, Imanuel has run a micro-business as a groundnut vendor.  He works from 5pm-10pm each evening, selling to commuters during the busy evening rush hour.  This is Imanuel's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, and he will use it to increase his stock of nuts.  This should allow him to increase sales and profits. 

Imanuel is one of 10 members of the Dubai group.  The members run diverse businesses including carpentry, food sales and charcoal sales.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.  In the picture, Imanuel is wearing a blue shirt.

loans.use: To buy more groundnuts

loans.name: Katongore Twetungure, Ibanda Group

texts.en:
Hardworking B. Vincent, married with four children of his own to take care of, knows the responsibilities cut out for him. This reality has looked him in the face for the past twenty-three years as he goes about his trivial-round farming business in Mukunguru, Ibanda.

With his minimal 240,000 shillings of earnings a month, Vincent has faced long odds in providing for all his family’s needs, principally his children’s education. He wants to improve on the status quo of his family with the acquisition of this loan; he wants to give his business an improved lease of life in terms of expansion through restocking his farm with more cows and plantations for increased production.

loans.use: To restock his farm wth more cows

loans.name: Juana Paquit's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Juana P., 56 years of age and married, is a resident of Catadman, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. Juana is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Juana P.’s Group.

Juana is married to Generoso P. who is a driver who earns an average income of not less than P170.00. They are blessed with eight children, five of whom are already married, one is single and two are in their teens. To help her husband, she decided to engage in micro-business particularly in snack vending and RTW (GTY products) dealing activity.  For 10 years, she has been able to maintain this business activity and she is earning an average net income of not less than P1,000.00 a month. 

This amount has been so helpful to their family income that she joined PMPC in 2007. As an active member of the PDP-LP Program of PMPC, a micro-finance program that reaches out the rural poor, she is requesting an amount of P6,000.00 as her fifth loan to be used for purchasing additional piglets for her piggery and for house repairs. The future income from this loan will be used to improve her family's living conditions, to meet their basic needs, loan repayments to PMPC and for possible business expansion.

loans.use: To purchase piglets for her piggery and for house repairs

loans.name: Teciana

texts.en:
Teciana S. is from the village of San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 55 years old, married, and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, she plants and harvests rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over thirty-seven years and earns approximately $225 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Teciana joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Teciana is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Tsogzolmaa

texts.en:
Tsogzolmaa B. is 56 years old and lives with her granddaughter in an apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Tsogzolmaa sews car seat covers and over-coating blankets and sells them at Dako Auto Trading Center in her town. She started her own business in 2002 and has gained a lot of experience. Tsogzolmaa knows what her customers want and how much they are willing to pay for her quality products. Tsogzolmaa is a friendly, generous and hard working woman who wants to enlarge her business. 

She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more fabrics and finishing materials for her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics and sewing supplies

loans.name: Hilda Luciana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA”; La socia vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en Chimpahuaylla la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Hilda; ella tiene 31 años de edad y la socia es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, La socia vende comida en la plaza de Chimpahuaylla; La socia se levanta todos los días muy temprano a las 5 a.m; La socia prepara los diferentes platos en ollas y los platos de meriendas con cubiertos respectivos, toma a sus hijos y los alista les da el desayuno y los viste, luego los abriga y se pone al menor en la espalda con una manta y sale con sus ollas envueltas en mantas gruesas, lleva con ella los baldes para dentro llevar los servicios, la socia al termino de su venta retorna a casa para atender a sus hijos y descansar un poco. La socia solicita el préstamo para incrementar su capital y mejorar sus platos.

La  socia valora y agradece el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer y tener una mejor calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Hilda, 31, is a member of the “SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA” communal bank. She lives in San Jerónimo en Chimpahuaylla district, Cusco province and department. Hilda lives with her life partner and has three children. Besides her household duties, she sells prepared food in Chimpahuaylla’s main square. She rises every day at 5am to prepare the various dishes in pots and plates with their respective cutlery. She prepares breakfast for her children and gets them ready. She bundles them up and ties the youngest one on her back with a blanket. She goes out with her meals wrapped in heavy blankets. She also carries two buckets in which she has the serving items. When she completes her sales, she returns home to tend to her children and rest a bit. She needs funding to buy ingredients to improve her dishes. Hilda values and is grateful for the loan granted because it makes it possible for her to grow and have a better quality of life. Similarly, she pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to improve the meals she prepares.

loans.name: Lizeth America

texts.es: La Señora Lizeth se dedica a la venta de comida por las noches lo cual la señora trabaja a partir de las 6 de la tarde hasta las 12 de la noche, vive en casa de su mamá que también trabaja con emprender en bancos de emprendimiento, su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la avenida Blanco Galindo kilometro 8, la señora Lizeth esta muy pero muy agradecida con la tasa preferencial kiva y con emprender por el apoyo que se le dio, el destino del crédito con tasa kiva fue para poder compra una broastera mediana para producir un rico pollo a la broaster, y así tener un mejor ingreso, y poder ayudar a su madre en los ingresos de la casa.
texts.en:
Ms. Lizeth sells food every night from 6pm until midnight. She lives with her mother, who also works with micro-financing loans. Their home is on the Avenida Blanco Galindo. Ms. Lizeth is very thankful for the support she has received from the micro-financing loans. She plans on using the money she receives to buy a medium sized fryer, so that she can make fried chicken and make more money so that she can help her mother with household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy  a fryer

loans.name: Herna

texts.en:
Herna G. is from the village of Santa Isabel Norte. She is 25 years old. Herna is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Herna owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Herna has been engaged in her business for more than four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Herna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Herna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Herna is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Herna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie B. is from the village of Larion Bajo, Tuguegarao City. She is 44 years old. Margie is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Margie owns & operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing knives (blacksmith) and selling them in the community. Margie has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Margie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Margie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from ASKI. Margie is requesting a new loan of 18000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Margie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Joar

texts.en:
Joar S. is from the village of Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 33 years old. Joar is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, he owns and operates a transportation service. Joar has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately $238 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Joar joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Joar is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be his 4th loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Ada Ruth

texts.es:
La  Sra. Ada tiene más de 13 año de laborar como enfermera en el MINSA de esta localidad.
Cuenta con su propia casa de habitación  la que piensa mejorar con el financiamiento otorgado por la institución. 
Esto le permitirá a la  clienta y su familia  tener  mejores condiciones en su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ada has spent more than 13 years working as a nurse at the local MINSA [Health Ministry].

She has her own house which she is planning on improving with the loan granted by the institution. 

This will allow the client and her family to have better living conditions in her house.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es: Rosalía, es una mujer luchadora D. 55 años. Hace 19 años que enviudo. Ella tiene 7 hijos, pero ahora solo vive con su hija Karina, quien es madre soltera y le da mucho apoyo, juntas viven en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad D. Huaricolca. En sus ojos demuestra el orgullo que tiene por su última hija; Mily, D. 24 años, que terminó su carrera D. enfermería. A pesar D. sus limitaciones pudo pagar los estudios universitarios D. sus hijos; ya que su dedicación por la siembra D. papa, olluco, cebada y avena (productos agrícolas), le proporcionaron buenas utilidades. En la actualidad su cosecha son muy cotizadas en el mercado central D. la ciudad y, como mujer luchadora, en campañas agrícolas, viaja a las ciudades D. Lima y Chanchamayo a ofrecer tubérculos al por mayor. Pero consiente que las campañas agrícolas no duran todo el año, está mujer luchadora, compra verduras, para vender en el mercado D. la ciudad D. Mazamari. En adelante está planeando ampliar su granja D. animales, como: cuyes, vacas y carneros. Es el décimo crédito con MFP y en todo este tiempo es reconocida en su banco comunal, como una persona responsable; por ello ocupa un cargo importante en su grupo D. trabajo. Con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará 25 sacos D. abono, ya que en este mes comenzará a sembrar.
texts.en: Rosalía is a 55 year-old woman who is a real fighter.  She has been widowed for 19 years.  She has 7 children but now only lives with her daughter Karina who is a single mother and gives her a lot of support.  They live together in their own home in the town of Huaricolca.  In her eyes she shows the priD. that she feels for her youngest daughter Mily who is 24 years old and has finished her nursing studies at university.  In spite of her limitations, she was able to pay for her children's university studies since her dedication to her work of sowing potato, 'olluco' (a native root crop), barley and oats (agricultural products), provided her with good profits.  Currently her harvests are in very high demand in the town's central market and, as the fighter she is, during the growing seasons she travels to the cities of Lima and Chanchamayo to offer her tuber crops wholesale.  However, since the growing seasons don't last all year, this hard-working woman buys vegetables to sell in the market in the city of Mazamari.  In the future, she is planning to expand her farm with animals such as guinea pigs, cows and rams.  This is her tenth loan with MFP and during all this time she has been recognized as a responsible person.  For this reason she holds an important position in her work group.  With this loan she will buy 25 sacks of fertilizer since she will begin to sow her crops this month.

loans.use: To buy 25 sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
The mother of three children, Rosa lives in the Hato Mayor region of the Dominican Republic, located in the east of the country. Hato Mayor is a fairly mountainous region where the principal industry is agriculture. Rosa's community, like nearly all impoverished areas in the Dominican Republic, suffers from a constant shortage of running water and electricity. Haitian immigrants make up a large proportion of Rosa's community.
  
Rosa requires a loan to buy diverse inventory (such as rice, chicken, beans, sugar and flour) for her convenience store, which she has been running for five years. Rosa has taken out a number of loans with field partner Esperanza International over the past five years, all of which have been paid back in full. She has used these loans to diversify the products that she sells. 

Rosa used to be a member of the "Solidarity Bank" (a group of borrowers) but has now applied for a loan that is larger than is usually offered to members of a group. Rosa is very excited about taking out the loan so that she can continue to grow her business. 

Rosa says that her favorite thing is studying, and she hopes that the profits from her business will make this easier to fund in the future. Her dream is to gain a degree in market research.

loans.use: To buy stock for her convenience store

loans.name: Bertha Urbelinda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MARIA ELENA MOYANO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Bertha Urbelinda; ella tiene 62 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía, ella tiene una tienda de artesanía y vende mantas, chalinas y chompas, ella atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía al por mayor.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "MARIA ELENA MOYANO". The bank is located in the Cusco district belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Bertha Urbelinda, she is 62 years old and married with 2 children. The member alternates her daily activities with the business of handicraft sales. She has a handicraft store and sells blankets, scarves, and sweaters. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. The member wants to expand her business. The member is asking for this loan to buy wholesale handicrafts.

The member thanks those who are a part of this dream by using this means, and she promises to fulfill her installment payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: The member is asking for the loan to buy wholesale handicrafts.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is 34 years old and is married with 3 children aged between 1 and 5 years old.  Jonathan is known in the business of selling art and craft. He has been in this business for about 2 years. 

Jonathan has requested a loan for the purpose of purchasing more art to sell, such as handicrafts, carvings, and other items.  If successful, Jonathan hopes to continue building a secure future for his family.

loans.use: To purchase more arts and handicrafts to sell

loans.name: Rossy

texts.es: Rossy, de 18 años, vive en casa de sus padres, al lado de ellos; esta empeñosa joven se esfuerza trabajando para ayudar a sus progenitores. Desde hace un año empezó a estudiar repostería, desde entonces, aprendió a preparar toda clase de pasteles y bocaditos, que comercializa a diferentes tiendas de por su zona, pues su escuela tiene convenio con diversos centros comerciales. Cada día prepara sus postres desde las 6 de la tarde hasta las 9 de la noche, y obtiene regulares ganancias de las ventas, por lo que esta muy satisfecha. Además tiene algunos clientes que en la actualidad le están pidiendo buffets (bocaditos de distinta variedad) que también prepara a buenos precios. Además como es una joven muy trabajadora para el futuro tiene planeado instalar un negocio de venta de pasteles y bocaditos, al por mayor, de esta manera espera seguir progresando. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Rossy tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de ingredientes (como harina, aceite, manteca) que necesita al por mayor y así espera continuar trabajando.
texts.en: Rossy, age 18, lives with her parents in their home. This hard-working youth works hard to help her parents. A year ago she started studying baking. She learned to make all kinds of cakes and pastries, which she sells to different stores in the area, as her school has agreements with various shopping centers. Every day she makes her desserts from 6 pm to 9 pm. She makes a regular income from the sales, and is thus very satisfied. She has various customers who are requesting buffets (varied snacks) that she also prepares at good prices. As she is a hard-working youth, she plans to open a cake and snack business in the future, where she will sell wholesale. This way, she hopes to continue progressing. This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to pay her quotas punctually as she does not want to disappoint those who are making this loan possible. This loan will allow her to continue working in the search of progress. Rossy plans to invest the requested loan in the wholesale purchase of ingredients (such as flour, oil and butter) which she needs. This way, she hopes to continue working.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for the making of snacks and cakes.

loans.name: Rev-Marcelline

texts.en: Marcelline owns a business selling fruits, like yellow bananas. She is 39 years old. She has two children who are about twelve and sixteen years old. She decided to request a loan to buy more yellow bananas to sell. With the profits she will pay school fees for her children. In the future, Marcelline would like to make her business grow.

loans.use: To buy more fruits, especially yellow bananas, to sell.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita R. tiene 49 años, natural del distrito de Santa Rosa departamento de Ayacucho, convive con  Ángel Valdivia de 49 años de edad padres de 05 hijos, quienes son la felicidad de su hogar y viven en su propia casa donde reina la paz y la armonía. Margarita es una señora pujante que lucha por dar una buena estabilidad económica a su familia. El negocio de Margarita  es vender insecticidas y fertilizantes que son productos netamente para el campo agrícola. El secreto de su negocio radica en ofrecer los productos químicos con pagos a mediano plazo, cuotas que un campesino puede pagar, de esa manera puede cobrar un poco más por el tiempo de espera. Esta actividad lo ejecuta desde hace más de 06 años y cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja, quien también le gusta este trabajo y siempre esta en constante comunicación con la gente campesina, así se entera de las plagas de insectos que atacan a las plantas y saber que producto adquirir para poder ofrecer a sus clientes. Por otro lado, posee una chacra, espacio donde produce cacao, café y hojas de coca. Sus planes a futuro es ampliar su terreno para poder almacenar estos productos químicos. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo cual se siente obligado a cumplir puntualmente con el cronograma de sus pagos. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles solicitados, se abastecerá comprando más productos para su tienda  y cumplir con los pedidos del cliente.
texts.en: Margarita R. is 49 years old and was born in the district of Santa Rosa in the Ayacucho department. She lives with Angel Valdivia who is 49 years old. They are the parents of five children who are the happiness of their home. They live in their own home in peace and harmony. Margarita is a strong woman who strives to prove her family a good economic stability. Margarita sells insecticides and fertilizers for agricultural use. The secret of her business is that she offers the chemical products on a payment plan, payments that a farmer can afford. This way she can charge a little more for the time she is waiting for full payment. She has been in this business for more than six years with the help of her partner who also likes this work and who is in constant communication with the farmers. He learns about the insect pests that attack the plants and knows which products to acquire to offer to their customers. She also has a farm where she grows cacao, coffee and coca leaves. Her plan for the future is to acquire more land to be able to store chemical products. This is her first loan with field partner MFP and therefore feels obligated to make her payments on time. With the 3000 nuevos soles (PEN) that she is requesting she will buy more products to stock her store and to fill her customers' orders.

loans.use: Buy more farming supplies to stock her store.

loans.name: Eric

texts.es: Eric es empleado en una empresa grafica como operador de máquina Offset, el crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de impresión (tinta, papel, etc.) para no perder un cliente que necesita este trabajo a ser realizado inmediatamente. Es su principal  fuente de ingreso para su manutención. A futuro el desea abrir una imprenta propia. Vive en casa de sus padres en la ciudad de La Paz; es soltero sin hijos. El cliente se siente satisfecho con los créditos que le otorgamos. Esta es la quinta vez que viene a IMPRO para solicitar un crédito y la segunda vez que se canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Eric is employed at a graphics company as an offset printing machine operator. He's requesting this loan to buy printing material (ink, paper, etc.) in order to maintain his necessary clientele. This job is his principal source of income for his maintenance. In the future he hopes to open his own print shop. He lives at home with his parents in the city of La Paz; he's single and has no children. He's satisfied with the loans he's been granted. This is the fifth time that he's come to IMPRO to ask for a loan and the second time he's gone through Kiva.

loans.use: Purchase of ink, paper, and other materials to finish a job he's been entrusted with

loans.name: Erick Jarling

texts.es: El señor Erick Jarling Sánchez, habita en el municipio de la Concepción, junto a su esposa la cual labora como domestica para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar ya que ellos tienen un hijos de dos años que necesita de su cuidado y apoyo , don Erick  sueña en un futuro  poder comprar un camioneta aunque sea de segunda mano para no estar pagando cada vez que sale la producción de pitahaya ; ya que esto le genera costo a él , el señor tiene doce años trabajando el cultivo y la mayor afectación que se le presenta son las plagas y robo del mismo producto , ya que cuando realizo la venta logro pagar su crédito en tiempo y forma , pero no logro comprar los fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para que la pitahaya tengan un buen tamaño , color y sabor  . Necesita que se le apoye para poder realizar la compra de estos productos para inducir la planta.
texts.en:
Mr. Erick Jarling Sánchez lives in the town of Concepción with his wife who works as a housecleaner in order to help him cover household expenses.  They have a two-year son who needs their care and support.

Erick dreams of being able to buy a second-hand truck in the future so he doesn't have to rent one every time he harvests pitahaya (cactus fruit), which generates considerable cost for him.  He has been growing his crop for over 12 years and the most significant difficulties he has run into are plagues and theft.

He has been able to pay back his loan on time but was unable to buy fertilizer and other necessary supplies to grow the pitahaya to proper size, color and flavor.  He is in need of financing in order to buy these products and begin planting.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies

loans.name: Jocylita

texts.en:
Jocylita J. is from the village of Kidahon, Malinao, Gingoog City. She is 50 years old. Jocylita is married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and beverages in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately $150 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Jocylita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Jocylita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase canned goods and snack foods to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods and snack foods to sell

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry P. is 38 years old and married with two children, aged 8 and 14. 

He is a farmer working in Surallah, South Cotabato. He grows rice and corn that he sells to people in his community. He usually earns about 3,000 PHP.

Jerry needs fertilizers and other farm inputs. He requested a loan so that he can buy these. He wishes for his business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Cleophas

texts.en:
Cleophas is a twenty-eight-year-old, hard-working woman living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. In her dreams she wants to build a house and also establish rental houses to earn income from.

For three years she has been running a bar. She started with 800,000 shillings but she currently has a working capital of 1,500,000 Uganda shillings.She has a challenge of high rental costs and in future she wants to build her own business premises.

Cleophas intends to use the loan to buy beers and sodas for sale.

loans.use: To buy beers and sodas for sale.

loans.name: Danny

texts.es:
Danny F. Q., tiene la edad de 19 años, está soltero  y vive aun con sus padres y sus hermanos. El pretende con el dinero realizar la compra de herramientas y maquinas para la facilitación de sus trabajos en construcción. El cuenta con experiencia  ya de varios años trabajando en esto y  cuenta con algunas herramientas pero le faltan unas de importancia por lo cual quiere comprarlas. El tiene como meta realizar trabajos de acabados de buena calidad y ser más competitivo en su trabajo con una mayor eficiencia. Otra de sus metas es generar ganancias para seguir invirtiendo y ayudarle a su familia con el sustento diario.
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Danny F. Q. is 19 years old, single, and he lives with his parents and siblings. He plans on purchasing tools and machines to help him carry out his construction jobs. He has various years working in the field and he has a few tools but he is missing some important ones, which is why he wants to buy them. His goal is to provide good finishes to his projects and to be more competitive in his work by increasing efficiency. Another one of his goals is to generate more income to keep investing and to help his family with the daily expenses.

It is the first loan he has received from Fudecosur (Kiva Field Partner). He has not had other previous loans with state banks, but Fudecosur has provided him with a loan with greater ease and the interest rate is much lower.

loans.use: to purchase construction tools

loans.name: Deggo Group

texts.fr:
Le  groupe Deggo est crée en début  de l’année 2010. Il  compte 09 femmes qui  habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Diaraï D. (debout à l’extrême droit de la photo) est responsable du  groupe. Elle est âgée de  46 ans et mère de quatre enfants.
 
Elle est vendeuse de tissus et divers produits vestimentaires. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d'activité pour l'avoir pratiquée pendant environs 8 ans.

Son nouveau  crédit lui permettra d’acheter des lots de tissus pour les revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires de la ville de Kolda.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins de santé et de nourriture des enfants.
texts.en:
The Deggo group was created in early 2010. It is composed of 9 women who all live in the same neighborhood. Their main activity is small trade.

Mrs Diaraï D. (standing on the far right of the picture) is the group's representative. She is 46 and a mother of 4.

She sells fabrics and various clothing items. She has been working in this field for about 8 years, which gives her a solid experience.

Thanks to this new loan, she will be able to buy lots of fabrics she will sell in the weekly markets in the city of Kolda.

With the profits from this business, she will help her husband take care of food and medical expenses for their children.

loans.use: to buy fabrics she will sell in the weekly markets in the city of Kolda

loans.name: Fadel

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 41 years old, married and has four children. Fadel has run a barber shop since 1996. He has gained good experience in this field, has a good reputation, and is well known in his area.
Fadel is requesting $2,400 to pay the annual rent for his shop and buy a new haircutting chair. He is aiming to increase his business profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop and buy a new haircutting chair.

loans.name: Gloria Cecilia

texts.en:
Sra. Gloria Cecilia is 32 years old. She is single and lives in the city of San Gabriel in the northernmost region of Ecuador. She is a single mother and household head. She lives with her four children who are aged 15, 12, 10, and 4. 

A friendly and responsible person, she is dedicated to the sale and trade of pigs in the street markets of her city. She is seeking a loan to invest in her business by improving the place where her pigs are bred and raised. She began her business to meet the needs of her family with a steady income. She usually works independently but sometimes her children help her in their free time after school. 

Gloria Cecilia enjoys being an entrepreneur because, "I  learn new things every day." With the support of this loan, Gloria Cecilia believes that she can improve her business, increase her family's income, and improve their quality of life. She says it will help her expand her business and allow her to educate her four children.

loans.use: to invest in her pig-raising business by improving the space where the pigs are bred and raised.

loans.name: Luz America

texts.es:
Luz de 49 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución). Es soltera. Se dedica a la venta de comidas.

Comenzó hace un tiempo atrás por medio de la gente de su sector que ponga un negocio de comida ya que no había por su barrio. Labora sola desde las 5H00 pm a 10H00 pm. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar materiales de construcción para adecuar su vivienda y tener un espacio para su negocio.
texts.en:
Luz is 49 years old and lives in Primavera, Duran (an area on the outskirts of the city which was originally built upon without official permission.  The area has several hills, streams and lakes which are still visible as the remains of a broken ecology).  Luz is single and her business is selling meals.

Luz started her business some time ago.  She set up the business because there was no food business in her neighborhood.  She works alone from 5.00pm to 10.00pm.  With the help of this loan, she would like to buy building supplies to fix up her home, so that she can have a space for her business.

loans.use: to buy sand and blocks to finish fixing up her home

loans.name: Lesshy

texts.en:
Lesshy was born in 1974. She is single and she  is blessed with  two children . She lives in Bamenda in the north west region of Cameroon. With the loan funds, Lesshy will buy eru,(a type of sauce), from the bush market in a distant part of the country to resell in the local market. She will also use her funds to transport her business items to the market.

Lesshy has faced health and business challenges in the past but has repaid 5 loans to GRAPE. She thinks her business is going to succeed because she had acquired some basic training on finance management and marketing strategies from GHAPE and she also has some experience in this business. The loan, if granted, will enable her to sell in her neighborhood at cheaper rates.  Lesshy has taken and repaid loans from GHAPE more than five times. 

Lesshy will plow back her profit into her business and use part to care for her family and her childrens school needs. will be taken care of. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan.

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy and sell eru, a kind of sauce, in the local market.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
La señora Nora es socia del banco comunal Las Orquídeas del Distrito D. Calleria, Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 54 años D. edad, está y tiene tres hijos mayores D. edad. Para comenzar este negocio solicitó un préstamo a Manuela Ramos, también acudió a los ahorros que tenia. 
Lleva cuatro años trabajando con los prástamos D. Manuela Ramos, tiempo que le ha permitido tener un negocio propio el cual atienD. personalmente, se dedica a la venta D. repuesto para moto. Su esposo es el que le ayuda en su negocio.

Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 caja D. bujías, 1 caja D. rodajes, 10 catalinas, 12 alambres para embriague, 6 faros intermitentes, 10 empaquetaduras,  10 llantas, 10 cámaras, 6 pares D. amortiguadores.
Recién lo está equipando, espera que en poco tiempo esté mucho más surtido para que pueda darles más variedad a sus clientes, y no tengan que ir a la competencia a comprar. Está muy agradecida por los préstamos que le ha otorgado Manuela Ramos, D. esa manera pueD. seguir con su negoico.
texts.en: Ms. Nora is a member of the "Las Orquídeas" ["The Orchids"] communal bank, located in the district of Calleria and department of Ucayali. She is 54 years old and has three adult children. In order to start her business, she requested a loan from Manuela Ramos and also used whatever savings she had. She has now been working with loans through Manuela Ramos for four years. During this time, she has been able to develop her own business, which she tends to herself. She sells spare parts for motorcycles. Her husband helps her with her business. With this new loan of 3,000 nuevos soles, she will buy: 1 box of spark plugs, 1 box of rodajes, 10 chain rings, 12 clutch wires, 6 intermittent headlights, 10 gaskets, 10 wheels, 10 innertubes, and 6 pairs of shock absorbers. With these purchases, she hopes that in a short time she will be much better stocked so that she can offer her customers more variety and they will not need to go to the competition to make purchases. She is very grateful for the loans she has been offered by Manuela Ramos, as they have allowed her to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy spare motorcycle parts

loans.name: Grupo De María Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario esta integrado por tres personas,una mujer y dos hombres, la presidenta es María.

María tiene 45 años vive en latacunga con su esposo, tiene un hijo el cualtiene 14 años y se describe como una mujer emprendedora.

Se dedican a la agricultura al cultivo de papas, hierva y zanahoria, inicio su trabajo cuando tenía 12 años; trabaja con el esposo y su hijo.

Trabaja con FODEMI desde Julio del 2009 ya van por el tercer pçestamo, el crédito que solicitan es para la compra de borregos; es provechoso la compra de borregos porque cuando crecen les reproducen y les venden, su meta es incrementar la crianza de animales (borregos).

El señor Matías no se encuentra en la foto porque estaba trabajando pero en su lugar esta su esposa Dolores M..
texts.en:
This solidarity group is formed by three people, a woman and two men.  Maria is the president.  Maria is 45 years old and lives in Latacunga with her husband.  She has one son who is 14 years old and describes herself as an entrepreneurial woman.

The group works in agriculture, cultivating potatoes, herbs, and carrots.  Maria started her work when she was 12 years old.  She works with her husband and son.

The group has worked with FODEMI since July of 2009, and is going for their third loan.  The loan they request is to buy sheep.  Buying sheep is helpful because when they grow they reproduce and can be sold.  Their goal is to increase the breeding of animals (sheep).

Matias is not in the picture because he was working but in his place is his wife Dolores M..

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Ethelyn

texts.en:
Ethelyn is a 22-year-old woman living in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and has one infant child to care for. For the past three years, she has been running a retail store at home to earn a living. At a very young age, Ethelyn gradually learned about business dealings. From her business, she normally earns a monthly income of PHP 3,700. She properly apportions this total to pay her day-to-day expenses.

Earlier this year, Ethelyn joined GDMPC to have easy access to financial services. She is applying a loan worth PHP 5,000 from the cooperative. She will spend the money to purchase daily-use merchandise to sell such as laundry soap, canned goods, toothpaste, etc. Ethelyn expects to generate more sales and additional income, made possible by this loan. She is looking forward to an expansion of her store, thereby improving the general living condition of her family.

loans.use: buy merchandise to resell

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past one year, she has operated a greengrocery business, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of owning a fully stocked greengrocery shop in the future.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of onions, bananas, ground nuts and oranges. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of onions, bananas, ground nuts and oranges

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto is a 49 year old married man.  For the past 7 years he has been working as a baker, specializing in Manakish (dough topped with thyme, cheese, or ground meat), pizza, and Saj bread, which looks like a Mexican tortilla and is used mainly in Arabic cultures.

Alberto is well known in his region, and his customers are very happy with what he provides them. That's why he is insisting on buying a new, larger Manakish oven, to fully satisfy his customers’ needs. He is requesting his first loan from Al Majmoua to buy this oven.

Alberto works hard on improving his family's social and financial situation.  He likes his bakery a lot, and hopes to keep improving it in the future so that he can achieve more of what his customers expect.

loans.use: To buy a bigger Manakish Oven

loans.name: Bineta

texts.fr: Madame Bineta  habite Sénégal. Elle est mariée et âgée  de 26 ans. Elle évolue depuis 2 ans dans le domaine du commerce. Elle s’adonne a la vente de déjeuner, de jus locaux et de glace. Elle a choisi son activité dans let le souci  de s’activer et de lutter contre la dépendance. Elle est sociétaire d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis mars 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 prévus pour l’achat d’un réfrigérateur qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de son commerce. Ce financement lui permettra d’accroitre ses bénéfices et de mieux développer son activité.
texts.en:
