Bineta lives in Senegal. She is married and is 26 years old. For two years, she has been developing a business. Her business is devoted to selling lunch, local juices and ice cream. Bineta chose her business in hopes of enabling herself and fighting dependence. She has been a member of one of the offices of UIMCEC since March 2011.

Bineta is seeking a loan of 150,000 CFA francs in order to purchase a refrigerator, which will be used to meet the needs of her business. This funding will allow her to increase her profits and better build her business.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.name: Procopia

texts.es:
Procopia cuenta con 56 años de edad ella ahora se encuentra separada de su esposo tiene un hijo el cual ya no estudia.

Ella se dedica al comercio tiene una tienda de abarrotes y maíz por litros lo cual invirtió su préstamo en 3 sacos de azúcar, 5 bolsas de maíz, frijol y refrescos. 
Doña Procopia dice que su préstamo el beneficio en poder surtir su negocio y sacar para poder tener para el gasto, a ella le gustaría ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Procopia is 56 years old and is now separated from her husband. She has a child who no longer studies. 

She has a grocery store and sells corn by volume. The purpose of her loan is to buy 3 bags of sugar, 5 bags of corn, beans, and soft drinks. 

Porcopia says the loan benefits her because she can supply her business and use the income for her expenses. She would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy 3 bags of sugar, 5 bags of corn, beans, and soft drinks for her grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan tiene 46 años, esta casado con gloria de 37 años, que fruto de esta relación tienen 7 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Teresa, Pichari. Juan siempre pensó en un negocio que le genere utilidades, es así que apostó por la agricultura. Conoce las técnicas y el seguimiento que se debe hacer hasta que llegue a su maduración. Desde entonces cultiva y cosecha cacao, producto que tiene mucha demanda en el mercado nacional e internacional y por tanto le es muy rentable este negocio. Sin embargo, para que pueda recibir dichas ganancias debe esperar meses, es por ello que también se apoya alquilando terreno de cultivo. Él esta contento con haber escogido esta labor ya que le genera buenos ingresos, generalmente trabaja solo pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de pareja y sus hijos, pero en tiempos de cosecha requiere más mano de obra para la extracción de los frutos. Normalmente sus productos los vende en su misma comunidad a precio de mercado. Este es su primer credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles realizará el mantenimiento de su campo agrícola, para ello contratará peones que lo ayuden en la poda, sacar la maleza y fertilizarla.
texts.en:
Juan is 46 years old and is married to Gloria who is 37.  The couple have seven children.  They live together in their own home which is located in the community of Teresa, Pichari.  Juan always planned to have a business which would make him profits and so decided to work in agriculture.  He knows the techniques and the work which must be done in order to bring his crops to maturity.  He grows and harvests cacao, a product which is in high demand in both the national and international market and is therefore very profitable.  However, in order to make profits, he must wait months and so, for this reason, he also supports himself by renting out farmland.  He is happy to have chosen this line of work as it makes him good income.  He generally works alone but he sometimes receives the support of his partner and children.  At harvest time, however, he needs more labor in order to pick his fruit.  He normally sells his produce in his own community at market price.

This is Juan's first loan from MFP and he pledges to make his repayments on time.  He will use his 3,000 soles to maintain his farmland.  He will hire laborers to help him prune, weed and fertilizer his land.

loans.use: to hire laborers to prune, weed and fertilize his land

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos vive con su esposa y dos hijos, es casado, es trasportista de cargas, realiza viajes a domicilio a sus clientes, transaporta maiz, concentrado, frijoles y de todo tipo de material, este trabajo lo realiza hace ya varios años.
El esta solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la reparación de su vehiculo, esta inversión le ayuda a brindar una mejor calidad de servicio a sus clientes, ya que la reparación de su vehiculo es fundamental para brindar un mejor trabajo a su clientela.
Su mayor sueño es tener mayores ingresos y esto lo ayudara a darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y esposa.
texts.en:
Carlos lives with his wife and two children.  He’s married and works hauling cargo.  He makes trips to his customers’ homes transporting corn, feed concentrate, beans and all types of material; he’s been in this business several years now.

He is asking for a loan to repair his vehicle.  This investment will help him provide better customer service because repairing his vehicle is fundamental to better customer service provision.  His greatest dream is to hear higher income which will help him give his wife and children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Otgonbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Otgonbaatar, 51, a divorced man whose children live with his former spouse, operates a taxi around the districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. A former bus driver with over 30 years of experience, he has been conducting his business since 2009.

In order to provide better service and increase his business volume, he recently replaced his old Russian car with a new Toyota Carina. Otgonbaatar is now requesting this loan to cover the cost of his new car.

loans.use: to cover the cost of his new car for his taxi business.

loans.name: Upendo Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Upendo SHG Group in Western Kenya! Irene is the facilitator of the Upendo SHG group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Irene is a mother of four children. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, she had a very good maize yield harvesting 12 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, she was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Irene and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Irene will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Upendo SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize. Irene is pictured with her group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de la Colina II”, Distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Su estado civil conviviente, de 43 años de edad y tiene 03 hijos, de los cuales uno ya formó su hogar, dos están a su cargo y están estudiando el nivel superior y secundario.
Con la finalidad de apoyar en los gastos económicos de su hogar, al ingresar al banquito con el préstamo de S/.300.00, que le dieron decidió reparar un mototaxi que fue de sus esposo,  para alquilarlo y de esa manera recibir diariamente su pago, con el tiempo ahorró y solicitó un nuevo préstamo en su banquito, de esa manera compró otra unidad móvil. Actualmente viene generando sus propios ingresos y de esa forma ayuda a su esposo que es Albañil, con los gastos de su hogar. 
Con este préstamo de S/.2,000.00,  lo utilizará para dar mantenimiento y renovación de llantas de sus vehículos motorizados, para seguir incrementando sus ganancias.
Rosa, es una mujer luchadora,  su sueño es poner un negocio de venta de ropa  y  de esta manera seguir contribuyente con la economía de su hogar, por todo ello, agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad de seguir desarrollando sus capacidades, y ayudarle a hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Rosa  belongs to the “Mujeres de la Colina II” communal bank, in La Banda de Shilcayo district, in the province of San Martín, in San Martín department.

She is 43, and lives with her partner. She has three children, one of whom has already started their own household. Two are in her care, and go to technical college and high school.

Aiming to help with household expenses, when she joined the communal bank and was given a loan of 300 soles, she decided to repair a mototaxi that belonged to her husband. This was in order to rent it out, and that way receive a daily payment. 

In time, she saved up, and applied for another loan at her communal bank. That's how she bought another motorized vehicle. 

Now she is generating her own income, and in that way helping her husband who is a construction worker, with the household expenses. 

She will use this loan of 2,000 soles, to do maintenance and replace the tires on her motorized vehicles, in order to continue increasing her earnings. 

Rosa is a very determined woman. Her dream is to set up a business selling clothing, and in this way continue contributing to the household finances. 

For all this, she is thankful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos; for giving her the opportunity to continue developing her abilities, and helping her make her dreams a reality.

loans.use: To maintain motorized vehicles.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a single, hardworking young man living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is in the motorcycle transportation business and currently has to give 80% of his daily earnings to his boss. Because of this challenge, he has a desire to buy his own motorcycle. Peter needs the loan to buy his own motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.use: to buy his own motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 21 años de edad, es una mujer joven con muchos deseos de superación, así como alegre y dinámica, es conviviente con Juan quien trabaja en construcción civil, fruto de esa unión tiene un hija de 1 años de nacida, habitando su propia casa. La actividad que realiza María es la venta de bebidas gaseosas, lo cual realiza desde su casa, en donde tiene instalado un refrigerador que compró con el apoyo de su pareja, para poder refrigerar sus bebidas y venderlas heladas al gusto  de sus clientes. También vende helados de una reconocida marca contando con una exhibidora que le fuera prestada para dicho productos, realizando ambas actividades desde hace 01 año ella sola.
Le agrada sus actividades ya que le permiten tener una ocupación en casa y tener tiempo libre para poder atender a  su pequeña hija, así como el ingreso adicional que le permite apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar de esa manera espera progresar  para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija. Por otro lado le va muy bien con su negocio, por ello tiene planes de continuar y hacerlo crecer en volumen, así como incursionar en la venta de ropa de niños desde su casa, trayendo dicho producto desde la ciudad de Lima. Este será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP.  Está muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Además comenta sentirse cómoda con su banco comunal pues los considera un grupo unido y responsable. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles tiene planes de invertir en la compra de ropa para niños a precio por mayor y venderlo entre sus amistades.
texts.en:
21-year-old María is a young woman who has a great desire to improve herself.  She is a cheerful and dynamic woman.  She lives with her partner Juan, who is in the house building business.  The couple have one daughter who is a year old and they live in their own home.  María's business is selling soda.  She carries out her business from home where she has a refrigerator that she bought with the support of her partner.  She cools her drinks in the refrigerator and sells them chilled, to her customers' taste.  She also sells iced treats from a well-known brand.  She has a display cabinet which was loaned to her for these products.  She has been carrying out these two business activities on her own for one year.

María enjoys her businesses as they allow her to work from home and have some free time in which to care for her young daughter.  They also make her additional income which allows her to support her partner with their household expenses.  She hopes to make progress so that she can provide her daughter with a better quality of life.  María's business is doing very well and she has plans to continue in it and to grow her business volume.  She also plans to start selling children's clothing from home.  She will buy these products in the city of Lima.

This will be María's second loan from MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support as she will feel able to make progress in her business.  She says that she feels comfortable with her community bank as she considers it to be a united and responsible group.  María will use the 1,000 soles she has requested to invest in buying children's clothing wholesale.  She will sell the clothing to her friends.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing

loans.name: Fofoa

texts.en:
"Fofoa is a 49-year-old woman living in the town of Pitonuu.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To make a living, Fofoa owns & operates a business venture in the food sector, making & selling food.  The main source of income for the business comes from selling baked goods in the local community.  Fofoa has been engaged in this business for over one year and earns approximately 400 WST (approximately 200USD) a month from these activities.

In 2011, Fofoa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fofoa requested her first loan of 1000 WST from SPBD, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Fofoa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Richard Antonio

texts.es: El cliente es de la ciudad de Portoviejo.  Desde que era soltero le gustó el oficio de vender lotería y por eso ha continuado realizándolo hasta ahora.  Trabaja solo desde las 8 am, almuerza y continúa con su venta a las 3 pm.  Está en estado de unión libre y su esposa es ama de casa.  Tiene hijos que son mayores de edad e independientes.  Quisiera en un futuro terminar el arreglo de su casa y ubicar su negocio en ella debido a que el sector donde habita es muy comercial.  Ahora necesita el préstamo para la compra de  billetes de lotería y artículos de plástico para su venta.

loans.use: Compra de lotería y artículos plásticos

loans.name: Verah

texts.en:
Talking with Verah, it becomes obvious that she is a very hardworking and helpful woman, and that everything she does is for her family's benefit and well-being. 

She lives in a humble home in the town of Kenyenya, along with a handsome husband and their three angelic-looking children. She has always striven to give them a decent life and a good education. 

She has been doing agriculture for 10 years now. She makes money selling produce from her farm, including milk, eggs, and crops. She enjoys plowing her farm and watering her plants. Crop diseases pose a big challenge for her, and also poor productivity. 

Verah is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. With the loan, she plans to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer, which will help increase soil fertility and productivity on her farm. Increased productivity will allow her to improve her quality of life and living standard. Through training from Juhudi Kilimo, she has learned about the culture of saving and she plans to use the increased income to improve her farming. This loan will go a long way in changing the life of Verah and her family.

Like Verah, thousands of entrepreneurs are waiting for your help. Take heart, make a loan during this festive season.

loans.use: To buy farm implements such as fertilizers and good quality seeds

loans.name: Poovi

texts.en:
Mrs. Poovi A. was born in 1950 in Glidji, in the prefecture of Lacs. Handicapped in her lower limbs, she has never taken into account this infirmity and works hard to contribute to the household expenses. Married and mother of four (4) children, she runs a shop for cold beverages and liquor. Joyful and welcoming, she knows how to attract customers through the quality of service she offers. Despite her illiteracy, she has good management sense and has succeeded in promptly repaying the credit that she has received in the past without any incidents. As the end-of-year holidays approach, Mrs. Poovi A. knows that the demand will be very high and would like to increase her stock of beverages. This is why she is requesting a credit of $950 to buy supplies in bulk and have a large stock of beverages before, during and after the Christmas and New Year holidays. The business will flourish during this period and will allow her to increase the household income.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, a Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Poovi est née en 1950 à Glidji dans la préfecture des Lacs. Handicapée de ses membres inférieurs, elle n’a jamais tenu compte de son infirmité et travaille ardemment pour contribuer aux charges du ménage. Mariée et mère de 04 enfants, elle tient une boutique de vente de boissons frais et de liqueur. Joviale et accueillante, elle sait attirer la clientèle à travers la qualité du service qu’elle offre. Malgré son analphabétisme, elle a le sens d’une bonne gestion et a su rembourser promptement et sans incident les premiers crédits qu’elle avait eus par le passé. A l’approche des fêtes de fin d’année, Mme A. Poovi sait que la demande sera très forte et voudrait augmenter son stock de boissons. Aussi, sollicite-t-elle à cet effet un crédit de $950 pour s’approvisionner en gros et disposer d’un stock important de boissons avant, pendant et après les fêtes de Noël et de Nouvel. L’activité sera florissante à cette période et permettra d’améliorer le revenu du ménage

loans.use: to buy beverages in bulk

loans.name: Evaristus

texts.en: I am a married man, father of 3. I sell cheap electronics for a living. I am the main breadwinner for my family. The loan will help me expand my business and be able to cater for my family’s needs with ease.

loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 26 years old and has 4 children. Her husband is a bricklayer's assistant. Angelina makes handcraft bracelets and she sells her products at tourist areas around the city by the dozens. She plans to buy more reels of thread with the loan, because then she'll be able to sell her products herself, without having to go through a middle-man. Angelina belongs to the group Nubes 7.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

ANGELINA TIENE 26 AÑOS CASADA TIENE 4 HIJOS, SU ESPOSO ES AYUDANTE DE ALBAÑIL. ANGELINA SE DEDICA A LA CONFECCION DE PULSERAS ARTESANALES , LAS CUALES SALE A VENDER EN LOS CENTROS TURISTICOS DE LA CIUDAD POR DOCENAS.CON EL CREDITO QUIERE COMPRAR MAS HILO PARA VENDER TAMBIEN ELLA SIN QUE TENER QUE USAR INTERMEDIARIOS. PERTENECE AL GRUPO NUBES 7.

loans.use: ARTESANA

loans.name: Zainab

texts.ru:
T. Zainab is in retail. She is a widow, has three children. In her hard life this business is the main source of income because her children are grown up and busy taking care of their own families. She sells everyday food. She began getting loans from “Microinvest” in 2004; at that time her assets were 100$. Thanks to successful business and targeted use of loan after a certain time she bought cocktail-maker and refrigerator. Now her assets grew to 500$. She is planning to expand the range of goods and buy a permanent retail spot.

Translated from Russian by Asya Lisak, Kiva Volunteer.

Турсунова Зайнаб – занимается торговлей. Вдова, имеет троих детей. В её нелегкой жизни это деятельность является основным источником дохода, так как дети взрослые, и каждый занят заботой о своей семье. Она продает продукты ежедневного питания. Начала кредитоваться с 2004года в «Mикроинвест»-е, тогда ее активы составляли 100$. Благодаря успешному бизнесу и целевому использованию займа она через определенное время кредитования приобрела коктейльницу и холодильник. Сейчас её активы возросли до 500$. В дальнейшем планирует увеличить ассортимент и приобрести постоянную торговую точку.

loans.use: increase assortment and activity plase

loans.name: Nuong

texts.en: Mrs. Nuong was born in 1976 and her husband was born 1973.  They have two children who are students in primary school.  Her husband drives a motor taxi everyday while Mrs. Nuong sells soft drinks at the gate of the local school. Their income is about $10 per person/month. They need to receive a loan of $75 to support their activity.  They will repay the loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: to sell soft drinks at the gate of the local school.

loans.name: Bakhtiyar

texts.en: Bakhtiyar was born in 1983. He is single and lives in Khachmaz town. He has been in the cattle breeding business for 4 years. Now he needs a loan of $950 to buy one cattle. By having more cattle, he can increase his business.

loans.use: To buy one cattle

loans.name: Inom

texts.en: Inom M. lives in Khujand, Tajikistan. He is married and has 3 children.  He became a client of MicroInvest this year but already has recommended himself as a serious and executive client. He trades in the bazaar where his shop selling women's and menswear is located. Inom has a good assortment of goods.. Working in this sphere, he has competitors so he requires a loan of $300 for the purchase of more winter goods  This will allow Inom to improve the business' conditions and to increase the assortment of clothing that he sells.

loans.use: To purchase winter goods

loans.name: Karla Estebana

texts.es:
Karla Rodríguez lives with her family in the town of Villa Reconciliación in Managua, in one of the most vulnerable neighborhoods with regards to infrastructure and poverty. Karla started her business with her store 6 years ago when she inherited it from her mother. With much persistence her store is now the largest in her neighborhood, and is able to support her family. Karla has 6 children, who are completely integrated in the business. It has elevated their quality of life because she has made improvements on her house and acquired her own vehicle. She needs the credit because her goal is to convert her business into a distributor and she wants to increase the sales of her basic grains and perishable products to be able to make a better offer and attract more clients.

Translated from Spanish to English by James Lombardo Volunteer

Karla R. habita con su familia en el barrio Villa Reconciliación de Managua, uno de los barrios más vulnerables de managua en cuanto a infraestructura y pobreza respecta. Karla comenzó el negocio de la pulpería hace 6 años producto de una de su mamá, le puso el mayor empeño al negocio y hoy en día es una de las pulperías más grande del barrio y con la que le ha podido dar el sustento a su familia. Karla tiene 6 hijos los cuales están completamente integrado en el negocio. este negocio ha elevado su nivel de vida porque ha mejorado su casa y también ha adquirido vehículo propio. necesita el crédito porque su meta es llegar a convertir su negocio en una distribuidora y quiere aumentra la venta de granos básicos y productos perecederos para así poder tener una mejor oferta y atraer más clientes.

loans.use: Purchase of basic grains and perishable products

loans.name: Esperanza Maria

texts.es:
Seeing the need to support her family five years ago, Esperanza decided to open a grocery store in her neighborhood. She is a hard-working woman, however, she says, without the help of EDAPROSPO she would have been unable to start her business. Little by little, she has been buying the necessary furniture for her store. And, today it is quite a store, stocked with products where she and her two children help manage it. Esperanza's dream is to have a bigger store, so that some day she could leave it to her two grandchildren, who live with her as well.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Viéndose en la necesidad de solventar a su familia, hace cinco años, Esperanza pensó abrir un puesto de abarrotes en su barrio. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, sin embargo, ella afirma, sin la ayuda de EDAPROSPO no hubiera podido iniciar su negocio. Poco a poco con el paso del tiempo, ella ha ido comprando los muebles necesarios para su bodega. Hoy luce una tienda muy surtida de productos en donde ella y sus dos menores hijos ayudan a manejarla. El sueño de Esperanza es poder tener una tienda más grande para que algún día ella pueda heredarla a sus dos nietos que viven con ella también.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store, and to grow her business. (Agrandar su actual tienda de abarrotes e inaugurar uno nuevo.)

loans.name: Lesbia Del Rosario

texts.es:
At the market in the town of Condega, Mrs. Lesbia B. sells vegetables, a business she has had for the past 10 years. Being a very cheerful person, she has earned the trust of many clients who have visited her daily to buy their products and thus she is able to support her two children as a single mother.

Since she does not have anyone else to support her, she has sought ways to improve her financial situation and for this reason she has received loans from Ceprodel that have allowed her to improve her business as well as the lives of her two children. Her greatest need now is to purchase vegetables from her suppliers, and therefore she again is relying on Ceprodel to provide her with the necessary credit to achieve this.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

En el mercado del municipio de Condega, la señora Lesbia B. se dedica al negocio de la venta de verduras teniendo su propio establecimiento desde hace 10 años en esta localidad. Por ser una persona muy alegre se ha ganado la confianza de muchos clientes que ha diario le visitan para comprar sus productos y de esta manera mantener a sus dos hijos ya que es madre soltera.

A pesar de que no cuenta con el apoyo de otra persona por ser soltera ha buscado la manera de mejorar su condición economiza y para esto ha realizado créditos en Ceprodel que le han permitido mejorar la condición de su negocio y por ende la de sus dos hijos. Su mayor necesidad hoy en día es adquirir las verduras de sus proveedores y para esto confía que una vez mas CEPRODEL le brindara el crédito oportuno para llevar a cabo su actividad.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables

loans.name: Gadoufi

texts.en: Mr. Gadoufi D. is 40 years old and the married father of 4 children, 2 of whom are in school.  He runs a small gas station in the center of Adèta, a medium-sized town located about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo.  He and his sister, who is a few years older than he, run the gas station together, as it is too busy for one person to work alone.  The motorcycles that crowd Adètas streets are always hungry for more of Gadoufi’s gas, and with this loan, he hopes to purchase more gas and clean his pumps to satisfy his customers.  As 2 of his children are too young to be in school, Gadoufi hopes to be able to save enough money through his business to enroll them in primary school when the time comes.

loans.use: To purchase more gas and clean existing gas pumps

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina is from the town of Antauta – Asillo department of Puno; 10 years ago she gathered her beloved children and moved to the city of Juliaca.

Since then with determination and diligence she has been able to open a small grocery store in a strategic location. In addition, Alejandrina knits beautiful clothing; this foray into new business is beginning to have successful.

This diligent mother’s wish is to purchase wool in order to continue designing and developing a variety of garments to be offered in greater quantities in the city of Juliaca. With your contribution Alejandrina will realize her plans.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

Alejandrina es natural de la localidad de Antauta – Asillo departamento de Puno, desde hace 10 años junto a sus amorosos hijos radica en la ciudad de Juliaca.

Desde entonces con empeño y diligencia logró abrir su tiendita de abarrotes en un local estratégico. Adicionalmente a esta labor se dedica al tejido de hermosas prendas de vestir, negocio en el que esta empezando a incursionar y tener éxito.

El deseo de esta diligente madre es adquirir lana con el fin de seguir diseñando y elaborando variedad de prendas que serán ofertados en mayor volumen en la ciudad de Juliaca.Con vuestro desinteresado aporte doña Alejandrina concretará sus planes.

loans.use: Injection of capital to increase production of clothing.

loans.name: Fuamatala

texts.en: Fuamatala P., 42, is married with 5 children.  She has 1 year of experience in the food stall business. She sells to the village people and the public 5 days per week. She has had 5 previous loans  with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be $166 USD.  SPBD loans are Fuamatala’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will be use to build a food stall shelter by the road.

loans.use: To build a shelter on the roadside to sell food

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia is 35 years old and completed primary school. She is the mother of 2 young children who are attending school. She is married to Eduardo C. Mamani, 34 years old, who works with her. She works primarily in rug embroidery in addition to raising a few pigs and sheep.

In order to increase her production of embroidered rugs, she decided to participate in the Las Kantuta Willkauta Common Bank, located in the town of Mulla Contihueco, district of Juli, Chucuito province, department of Puno, Peru.

Her first loan was for $115, with which she acquired 4 square meters of material and some rolls of colored wool yarn. With this loan of $200, which will be paid-in-full in 4 months, she will buy 2 kilograms of wool ,10 spools of colored wool yarn, and 20 meters of material.

Antonia is happy because her production is increasing daily and her income is much better than before. She has been successful in selling three to four panoramas weekly to travelers of Juli and Cusco, who pass by her home. Her greatest goal is to have enough capital to improve in embroidery, have a dairy business, and for her children to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Antonia tiene 35 años de edad, su nivel de educación es primaria completa, es madre de 2 hijos menores de edad quienes están estudiando en la escuela y es casada con don Eduardo C. Mamani de 34 años de edad quien viene trabajando junto con ella. Actualmente, se dedica especialmente al Bordado de Bayeta y un poco de crianza animales menores como chanchos y ovejas. Para incrementar la producción de Bordados de Bayeta, decidió pertenecer al Banco Comunal Las Kantuta Willkauta, ubicado en el centro poblado Mulla Contihueco, del distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito y del departamento Puno. Su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con ello adquirió cuatro metros cuadrados de Bayeta y unos cuantos ovillos de lanas de colores. Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el cual cancelará en 4 meses, comprará 2 kilos de lana, 20 metros de bayeta y 10 ovillos de lana. La señora Antonia se encuentra feliz por que su producción va incrementando cada día y sus ingresos económica esta mucho mejor que antes. Además logra vender semanalmente tres a cuatro panoramas a los intermediarios de Juli y Cusco, quienes van hasta su domicilio. Su mayor sueño es tener más capital para mejorar el Bordado, tener una empresa lechera y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: To buy wool in bulk.

loans.name: Sum

texts.en:
Sum T., 39, runs a family business with her husband, Long Seng, where they sell pickled radishes from their home. One of their five children also assists them and they typically make US$3 each day. Pickled radishes are considered a delicious treat, but require a time consuming production process.

Sum T. has asked for a loan of US$1000 to purchase more radishes for her business expansion. She believes that by increasing her inventory, she can meet the growing customer demand and increase her family’s income. She looks forward to improving her standard of living with any extra profits that the family can make through this investment.

loans.use: Purchase radishes for business

loans.name: Sergio J. Dolores

texts.es:
El Sr. Sergio está reparando su casa pero por el momento no cuanta con el dinero necesario para comprar el materia para arreglar lo losa de su casa ya que está muy maltratada el quiere tenerla lista para antes de que se llegue la temporada de lluvias.

El tiene dos hijo que están estudian teme que lo mal que está la casa les afecté en su salud a sus hijos y tengan que estar faltando a la escuela.

El SR. Sergio está solicitando un préstamo a Kiva de $300.00 dlls para la compra de material ya que el se dedica a la albañilería (Construcción y reparaciones de casas) y el realizará los acabados en la losa de su casa.
texts.en:
Sergio is repairing his house but at the moment he does not have the money necessary to buy the material to fix the home’s foundation. It already is very damaged he wants to have it ready before the rainy season arrives.

He has two children who are in school. He fears that the bad condition that his house is in will affect his children’s health and that they will have to miss school.

Sergio is requesting a loan of $300 from Kiva to purchase the material. As he already works in bricklaying (Construction and home repair) he will carry out the finishing touches of his house’s foundation.


Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish the inside of the foundation

loans.name: Tailelei

texts.en: Tailelei S., 47, is married with four children. She has 2 years of experience in the banana chips business. She sells to the village people and public 2 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~$166 USD). SPBD loans are Tailelei's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase goods for the shop, clothes and vegetable oil for the banana chips business. Her husband and children helps her with the business.

loans.use: Tailelei would like to purchase goods, clothes and vegetable oils for her banana chips shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Sean

texts.en:
Mrs. Sean K. is 48-year-old widow. She has one child, and they live together in Anlongthnot Commune in Pursat Province.

Sean is a farmer who grows vegetable such as cabbages. She also grows water lilies, which she sells 3 months after planting. Sean earns approximately $3 per day. Sean is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 ($250) to purchase farm land and one cow.

loans.use: To purchase farm land and one cow

loans.name: N’Mondambe

texts.fr:
Dans la cuisine Togolaise, il y a deux choses qui sont les plus importants : la pate et le fufu.  La pate est préparée avec la farine de maïs, et le fufu est préparé par piler les ignames.  Madame K. est une revendeuse de ces deux produits importants : le maïs et les ignames.  Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour reconstituer son stock avec 7 tubercules d’igname et 6 sacs de maïs pour bien vendre au marché d’Agoè, un quartier au nord de la capitale du Togo.  
Madame K. est âgée de 36 ans et son mari est militaire.  Avec le revenu de ce commerce qu’elle a commence depuis 2004, elle aide son mari de soutenir leurs 5 enfants.
texts.en:
In Togolese cooking, there are two essential dishes: dough and fufu. The dough is made with corn flour and the fufu is prepared by pounding yams. Mrs. K. retails both of these important products: corn and yams. She is requesting this, her first loan, in order to rebuild her stock with 7 yam tubers and 6 bags of corn so that she can resell them in the market of Agoè, a neighbourhood to the North of the Togolese capital. Mrs K. is 36 years old and her husband is in the military. With the revenues from this business, which she has had since 2004, she helps her husband support their 5 children.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn and yams

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 28  años, vive con su esposo, su hijo de 7 años y su hermano menor en su propia casa. Ella vende todo tipo de artículos; de uso personal, para el hogar, de higiene, entre otros, desde hace 5 años, junto con su esposo, cada semana, se trasladan a la tierra natal de donde proviene María, que está a 5 horas de viaje, de esta manera abastece de lo necesario a sus paisanos. Su mejor venta, sin duda es en los días de ferias de su tierra, que son todos los jueves, por ello que los lunes y martes María y su esposo salen al centro de la ciudad para comprar al por mayor su mercadería y el miércoles se enrumban por las tardes a su pueblo para que tengan tiempo de instalar su puesto. María desea seguir adelante con este negocio porque es rentable, también quiere incursionar en la venta de artefactos como radios y televisores,  ya que sus paisanos le han solicitado que traiga ese tipo de mercadería. Con este negocio María y su esposo han logrado adquirir lo que necesitaban como una familia en formación, lograron comprar un terreno en la cual  están viviendo actualmente, supieron administrar adecuadamente sus ganancias. Es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP, donde participa activamente en las reuniones de su banco comunal y aprendió el hábito del ahorro. La cantidad solicitada es para comprar más mercadería, artículos para el hogar por el valor de 1000 soles y con la otra mitad aprovechará para vender cerveza, ya que en su tierra natal estarán en festividades, para lo cual comprará aproximadamente 20 cajas de cerveza.
texts.en:
María is 28 and lives with her husband, her 7-year-old son and her younger brother in her own home. She has been selling all sorts of things, such as articles for personal use and for hygiene among others, for the past five years. She works together with her husband: every week they return to the area María is from, which is a five-hour trip, and in this way they cater to the needs of the villagers. Her best sales are without doubt on market day, which is Thursday. And so María and her husband travel to the city-centre to buy their merchandise in bulk on Mondays and Tuesdays and return to the village on Wednesday evening in order to set up their stall. María wants to continue with this business as it is profitable. She would also like to try selling items such as radios and televisions as the villagers are asking her to bring back these types of merchandise. Thanks to their business, María and her husband have managed to acquire what they need to start a family; they have managed to buy land where they are currently living and have the knowledge they need to manage their money well. This is her third loan with MFP and she participates actively in the meetings of her community bank and has learned the habit of saving money. She willuse the loan to buy more merchandise, items for the home in the amount of 1000 Soles and with the other half she will try selling beer, as there are upcoming festivities in her homeland for which she will buy roughly 20 cases of beer.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Phanny

texts.en:
Mrs. Phanny C., 43, and her husband, Mr. Sokny Un, 46, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 1986 and have four children: one son who attends school and three daughters. One of their daughters is married and lives outside the family home and two daughters are silk weavers.

Phanny has been a silk weaver for 20 years. She sells her finished products to the middleman, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a mason for seven years. Phanny is requesting her first loan of US$ 200 to purchase silk material for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for her weaving business

loans.name: Sandra Yesenia

texts.es: Sandra Yesenia T. L. vive en la Colonia Santa Maria departamento de Ahuachapán. Yesenia se dedica atender su negocio que es una tienda ubicada en su casa. Yesenia a sus 25 años de edad cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su madre, es por ello que Yesenia se animo a poner otro negocio que le generará más ingresos y puso una pupuseria que es abierta y atendida por ella todos los días al igual que la tienda. En las metas y sueños de Yesenia es ampliar sus negocios, la tienda y la pupuseria por eso,  ahora Yesenia solicita un crédito para compra de granos básicos y surtir su tienda
texts.en:
Sandra Yesenia T. L. lives in the neighborhood of Santa Maria, located in the department of Ahuachapan. Yesenia makes a living by running a business that she operates out of her house. Yesenia is 25 years old and she depends on the unconditional support of her mother. For that reason, Yesenia felt motivated to start a restaurant that specializes in "pupusas" (these are delicious, thick, hand-made corn tortillas that are stuffed with cheese, beans or meat). The restaurant is open and she works there every day. Her goals and dreams are to expand her businesses, the store she runs and the restaurant that specializes in "pupusas". Right now she is requesting a loan to be able to buy basic grains and to stock her store with a greater variety of items.

(Translated by Ashlee of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains and to stock her store with a greater variety of items

location.town: Colonia Santa Maria departamento de Ahuachapán

loans.name: Cecilna

texts.en:
Cecilna B. grows seaweed. She is 29 years old and has two children.  Cecilna dreams to send all her children to college so that when they look for a job, they will be easily hired.  She has "sales lady" work experience.  Cecilna was not happy about her salary and decided to quit and mange a seaweed farm instead.

She is requesting a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI.  She will use the loan to buy more seaweed seedlings to grow her farm.  Some of the loan will also be used to repair her boat pump and engine.

CEVI is helping seaweed farmers grow and increase the size of the farms.  CEVI provides its client not only with credit but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: Buy seedlings, boat pump and engine.

loans.name: Qıztamam

texts.en: Qıztamam R. is 50-year-old widow who has sold women's shoes in the streets of Imishli for the past three years. When her husband passed away, Qıztamam and her son were left without any means of surviving. With her son studying at the university, selling shoes is the family's only source of income. Qıztamam tries very hard to succeed, but she cannot pay rent and has to stay in the street selling her goods even if it is snowing or raining.  Luckily, the owner of the shop next to her display, which is one of the biggest stores in town, allows her to keep her goods in his shop for the night. Qıztamam would like to enlarge her business and purchase additional shoes to sell. She believes one day she could rent a good place in the central market. Qıztamam is counting on your help.

loans.use: to purchase women's shoes

loans.name: Vicky Jicela

texts.es:
la Sra. Vicky A. tiene 25 años de edad vive en union libre con el Sr. Santos Lagos, con el cual han procreado un hijo que tiene 3 años de edad, su compañero de hogar es taxista y juntos se apoyan para los gastos del hogar.
ella se dedica a la elaboracion de comidas y tambien vende pizzas caseras, tiene 6 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, ella ahorita necesita el prestamo para comprar al por mayor el producto y mantenerlo refregerado como ser las carnes ya que cada dia que pasa se ponen mas elevados los precios de estos productos.
su sueño es tener un comedor completo con todas las necesides que exijan los clientes.
texts.en:
Ms. Vicky A. is a 25-year-old woman who lives with Mr. Santos Lagos, her common-law spouse, with whom she has a 3-year-old son. Her domestic partner is a taxi cab driver, and they help each other in covering the household expenses. She prepares meals and sells homemade pizza for a living. She has been in business for 6 years. She now needs a loan in order to purchase wholesale goods, such as meat and vegetables, and keep them refrigerated because the cost of these goods is increasing everyday.

She dreams of having a full restaurant equipped with everything that her customers request.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meat, vegetables, soft drinks, and water

loans.name: Magbesseh United Group

texts.en:
This is Rugie K. and Fatmata B.. They named their group Magbesseh United after the village of the group’s leader.

This will be the fourth loan these entrepreneurs are seeking from Kiva lenders. Previous loans have had a meaningful effect on the lives of these borrowers. With the help of those loans, they were able to feed and clothe their children better, and pay for school and medical bills. Magbesseh United has repaid its last loan successfully. The members are now requesting a new loan to further strengthen their businesses.

Rugie K. (left) is the leader of the group. Rugie is 40 years old. She was born in a village called Massam, which is two miles from Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. Rugie is married to a businessman and they have five children who attend primary and secondary schools. Rugie sells market food – rice, salt, “margi,” pepper, sugar, flour, etc. She has been selling for over 20 years.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Farry Hilda

texts.es:
Farry es socia del Bancomunal Maria Elena Moyano.
Farry es casada tiene 37 años, no tiene hijos.
Farry tenia un puesto en el mercado donde trabajaba con su mamá lo dejo a su mamá y abrió una bodega en su casa.
Desde que esta en Finca aprendió a ser perseverante, ahora y hacer responsable con los prestamos . 
Farry necesita un préstamo de  3000 soles, para la cuota inicial de un terreno. 
El sueño de Farry es tener su empresa de chompas.
texts.en:
Farry is a member of the communal bank Maria Elena Moyan. She is married, is 37, and doesn't have any children. She used to have a stand in the market where she worked with her mother, but she then opened a grocery store in her home. Since she has worked with Finca, she has learned how to persevere, to save, and to be responsible with her loans. Farry needs a loan of 3,000 PEN to make a down payment on some land. Her dream is to have a sweater business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Farry needs a loan of 3,000 PEN to make a down payment on some land.

loans.name: Annonciata

texts.en: Annonciata M. runs a hardware store in Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda. She is 42 and has one 8-year-old child still at home, with the other three no longer dependents. As Annonciata is a widow, she is the only source of income for her family with monthly profits of 200,000 Rwandan francs (FRW). She has run her business for five years and employs one other person. She is requesting her first loan to grow her business. Annoniciata’s loan request is 500,000 FRW.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Yadira

texts.es: La señora Yadira, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Esmeralda”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 56 años y 01 hijo, ya independiente y con su propia familia.Yadira, es una mujer que le gusta trabajar, así que decidió poner su propio negocio de ventas de bebidas gasificadas y refrescos, en el kiosco que se encuentra ubicada en el tercer piso de la Municipalidad Provincial de la Ciudad de Tarapoto. Es ella misma quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 300.00 y empezó comprando 03 paquetes de gaseosas,  vio que le iba muy bien y que le falto sus gaseosas, poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas.En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes que son los mismos trabajadores y personas que van a ser algún tramite en la Municipalidad.Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará mas bebidas como gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas. Yadira, tiene muchas metas por delante y se siente motivada por hacer realidad  lo que se propone. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando mas lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Ms. Yadira L. is a member of the Esmeralda Microfinance Institute, located in the Tarapoto district of the province and department of San Martín. She is a 56-year-old married mother with one son who is now independent and has his own family. Yadira is a woman who likes to work, so she decided to set up her own carbonated drink and beverage business in a kiosk on the third floor of the Provincial Municipality of the City of Tarapoto. She manages the business herself, without having a fixed work schedule or a boss. She states that she started out with 300.00 PEN and bought three crates of soft drinks. She saw that business was good and that she needed more drinks, so little by little she invested in more. She currently has the same business and is well-known by her customers, the same workers and people who go to the municipality to fill out paperwork. With this 2,000.00 PEN, she will purchase more drinks, such as different flavors, brands, and sizes of soft drinks, as well as carbonated/non-carbonated mineral water. Yadira has many goals ahead of her, and she feels motivated to do what she sets out to do. She is very grateful with the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her when she most needed it. She is responsible with her payments and plans to stay that way.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more drinks like different-flavored soda

loans.name: Hidaya

texts.en:
Hidaya is a member of the Mwande borrower group in Kola, Morogoro. She is 42 years old, married, and the mother of 6 children. Her children are aged 30, 20, 22, 15, 13, and 10 years. She also cares for 3 other dependents.

Hidaya started her own food business selling rice and tomatoes 12 years ago. She works 14 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 180,000 Tanzanian shillings (about $135 US).

This is Hidaya’s second loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 250,000 shillings in order to buy more commodities. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Hidaya hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for resale

loans.name: Paul's Group

texts.en:
I. Paul is 28 years old and the leader of his lending group in Jinja. He is a married man with three children aged 6, 4, and 2 years and he helps to cater for his sister who is in school. He is a businessman dealing in the sale of clothes, maize, and beans from Namulesa; for 8 years he has been dealing in all the businesses.

The main challenge that Paul faces,especially with his clothes business, is that some customers take the goods on credit and fail to pay hence having a bad effect on his cash flow. On average, Paul makes 90,000/= as weekly profits and one of his strong points is that he is a trustworthy person with a strong drive to invest more into his businesses.

Paul hopes to construct a house for his family so that they can stop renting. He needs a loan to help buy 20 more bags of maize for resale since this will help expand his stock in that business. Paul is also a friendly and determined person.

loans.use: Buying more bags of maize for resale.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Cette dame a appris le métier de la couture. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 2007. Elle est mariée et son atelier lui permet d’aider financièrement son mari à subvenir aux besoins de leurs 04 enfants. Lorsqu’elle avait ouvert son atelier de couture, elle avait acheté une machine à coudre de deuxième main. Elle sollicite en ce moment un crédit de WAGES pour acheter une nouvelle machine ; elle veut remplacer son ancienne machine tombée en panne. Elle est dans l’urgence de recevoir ce crédit.
texts.en:
This is a lady who learned the trade of sewing. She has been in this business since 2007. She is married and her workshop allows her to help her husband financially in providing for their four children. When she opened her sewing shop, she had purchased a second-hand sewing machine. She’s now requesting a WAGES loan to buy a new machine; she wants to replace her old, malfunctioning one. She’s in a rush to receive this loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Dometilla

texts.en: Dometila S. resides in Agusan del Sur where farming is the main source of living. She is 60 years of age, married for 20 years but had no children. She is anticipating a good harvest from her rice field. This is her first time borrowing from CEVI. She applied for Php 6,000. The loan will be used for farm inputs. Dometila appreciates the monthly amortization because she feels it is designed for farmers.

loans.use: farm inputs

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en:
Felipe is a balut vendor in his village. Balut is a fertilized duck or chicken egg with a nearly-developed embryo inside that is boiled and eaten in the shell. It is commonly sold as street food in the Philippines.  He usually roams around their village at night to sell his balut eggs.  In addition to this business, he also assists his wife in managing her general store.  To further improve their small businesses, he is asking for a loan amount of 12,000 PHP.  He plans to use the loan to purchase more stock for her store and also to buy more balut to sell.

The couple is hoping to provide for the educational needs of their children through the income from their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for his wife's store and improve his egg vending business

loans.name: Mary Wanjiru

texts.en:
Mary, 29, is married and has one daughter. She is a tailor in Gitaru, Kikiyu. She has been in business for seven years with a monthly profit of about 9,000 kenya shillings. She wants to use the loan to buy more tailoring materials to meet the demand of her clients.

She has never borrowed from another MFI and she was introduced to KADET by a friend. She hopes to be able to import more clothing material so as to increase her turnover, which will improve her living standard.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Purchase additional materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth sells bags of cement to make a living. She puts in long hours trying to keep her business sustainable. She is a friendly woman and she uses this skill to attract more customers to her shop. One of her challenges is competitors that she hopes to outsmart when she purchases more bags of cement. She is happily married with six children, and she is 43 years old. She is hoping for a loan of 80,000 naira to purchase more bags of cement to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of cement to sell

loans.name: Maguette

texts.fr: Maguette C. est âgée de 37 ans, elle mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Depuis 6 ans elle milite dans le Banc Villageois de BAYOUF où elle bénéficie de prêts qui lui permettent de développer un petit commerce de fruit de saison tels que de mangues, des pastèques et des fruits d'agrumes. Avec les bénéfices réalisés à partir de son activité elle parvient à participer au payement de la scolarité des enfants et le maintient de leur santé.
texts.en:
Maguette C. is 37 years old, and she is married with 4 children. For 6 years, she has been an active member of the Village Loan Group of Bayouf, where she benefits from loans which allow her to develop a small business selling seasonal fruit such as mangoes, watermelons, and citrus fruit. With the profits realized from her business, she is able to take part in paying for her children's schooling and in maintaining their health.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her ability to finance herself

loans.name: Houmassi

texts.fr: Cette dame est mariée et mère de 03 enfants, elle a ouvert sa propre boutique dans laquelle elle fait des services de secrétariat. Elle a associé à cette activité le commerce des articles scolaires. Elle a déjà obtenu 2 fois du crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé, elle souhaiterait redynamiser son commerce, elle sollicite alors de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 2 cartons de papiers A4, 10 boîtes de trombones, 3 boîtes de stylos et divers articles scolaires.
texts.en:
This is a lady who is married and the mother of three. She opened her own shop in which she provides secretarial services. She has included with this business the sale of school supplies. She has twice had a loan already that she has repaid. She would like to re-energize her business. She's therefore requesting a loan from WAGES to buy two boxes of A4 paper, ten boxes of paper clips, three boxes of ink pens, and a variety of school items.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: A4 paper, boxes of paper clips, boxes of pens, etc.

loans.name: Remember Group

texts.en:
These are members of the 'Remember' group in the town of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. They are small-scale businesswomen who have applied for a loan of SLL 500,000 each from Kiva lenders through SMT. With such a loan, they can improve their businesses by adding more goods. Consequently, they can earn enough profit to repay the loan and better support themselves and their families.

Fatmata S. who is on the left in the photo is the leader of this group of enterpreneurs. Fatmata who was born in Songo, near Freetown is twenty-six years of age, married to a driver and they have two children – one in class II. and the other is not yet of school-going age.

For six years now, Fatmata has been selling palm-oil, the country’s main cooking oil. With her share of the loan, she will buy gallons of palm-oil from makeshift-business-center and sell it in Makeni or Freetown. Five gallons of palm-oil at the Luma center costs her something between SLL 45,000 and SLL 60,000.

loans.use: buying gallons of palm-oil

loans.name: Khaïry

texts.fr: Khaïry N. est une jeune femme mariée de 36 ans, mère de 5 enfants. Elle s’active dans le commerce de tissu et aimerait augmenter ses revenus. Ce prêt lui permettra d’augmenter son épargne et de prendre en charge sa famille.
texts.en:
Khairy N. is a young married woman who is 36 years old and has five children. She is active in the sale of cloth and would like to increase her income. This loan would allow her to increase her savings and support her family.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of cloth and incense

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena tiene 36 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia.
Desde hace 20 años se dedica a los bordados. Ella trabaja en la comodidad de su hogar, este tipo de labor requiere de mucha concentración para combinar los colores y realizar puntadas exactas que definan un buen diseño y la durabilidad del bordado.
Para este negocio cuenta con la ayuda algunos familiares y de una vecina con quien comparte las ganancias.
Para el futuro, Elena quiere producir en cantidades mayores sus bordados para tener más clientes.

Esta es la sexta oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, además está muy contenta de ser  parte de un banco comunal porque es un espacio de amistad y aprendizaje. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en la compra de los materiales necesarios para el bordado; tales como hilos, telas y agujas.
texts.en:
Elena is 36 years old and lives with her husband and her 3 children in her own house. For 20 years she has been dedicated to embroidery. She works in the comfort of her own home. This type of work requires much concentration to combine the colors and realize exact stitches that define a good design and the durability of the embroidery. For the business, she can count on the help of some family members and a neighbor, with whom she shares the earnings. For the future, Elena wishes to produce her embroidery in larger quantities in order to have more customers. This is her sixth opportunity for a loan with MFP. Moreover, she is very content to be part of a communal bank because it provides a space for friendship and learning. The money which she is soliciting will be utilized to buy materials necessary for embroidery, such as thread, cloth and needles.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY MATERIALS FOR EMBROIDERY

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean R., 27, is making sure that her family has enough for their daily needs. She is married to Alvin Allan R., a machine fabricator, and they are blessed with one child. She helps her husband by earning a living so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own variety store for 5 years.

Jean has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. As a result of her good repayment performance with previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She always pays her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her variety store.     

Now, with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP11,000 loan. This amount will be used as to expand her business by buying additional stock to replenish and expand her product inventory.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can have a peaceful and good life with her family.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy stock to replenish and expand her product inventory

loans.name: Silvio Benito

texts.es:
El señor Silvio se dedica a las labores de electricista, en donde un dia de trabajo para él es bien agitado y de riesgo.  Es su primero crédito con Ceprodel.

El crédito que ha solicitado es para la mejora de su casa en donde les brindara mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.

Cabe señalar que el señor M. también ofrece servicios de alquiler de cuartos a estudiantes lo que le permitara obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Silvio is an electrician; a typical work day for him is very agitated and risky. This is his first loan with Ceprodel. He will use the funds for home improvements in order to provide his family with better living conditions. It is worth noting that Mr. M. also rents rooms to students to earn additional income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: Doña Cristina  de 54 años de edad es soltera, tiene 3  hijos todos mayores de edad los cuales son profesionales y que ya han formado su propio hogar. Cristina trabaja para la escuela Cesar Augusto Salinas Pinell de Nueva Guinea como maestra desde hace 25 años,  esta solicitando su 8vo credito para utilizarlo en compra de materiales de construcciòn y asì poder hecharle el piso a la cocina ya que es de suelo, se caracteriza por responsable, honesta y de buenas costumbres, su sueño es terminar de construir su vivienda con mayores comodidades para su familia, tener salud y que sus hijos permanezcan unidos y sirviendole a Dios.
texts.en:
Doña Cristina is 54 years old, single, has three adult children who are professional and have formed their own home. Cristina has been a teacher at the "Cesar Augusto Salinas Pinell de Nueve Guinea" school for 25 years. She is requesting her 8th loan to use it in buying construction materials and be able to install floor in the kitchen because there is currently none. She is responsible, honest and polite; her dreams are to finish the construction of her house and make it more comfortable for her family, have health and that her children are united and serving God.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install floor in her kitchen

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.fr: D. Bernadette est née le 20 Mai 1961 à Athiémé et vit depuis près de 20 ans au quartier Hlacomey à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à ADJAGBONI Jean Charles, Bernadette est mère de quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Bernadette vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari à Hlacomey. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Bernadette n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Depuis une dizaine d'année, en vue d'assurer les différents besoins de ses enfants, Bernadette vend des tenues et des chaussures, par le système de distribution. C'est à Lomé au Togo, Etat voisin du Bénin, que Bernadette s'approvisionne. Bernadette est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant bénéficié de cinq crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Face à la demande importante de sa clientèle en ses produits, Bernadette sollicite un autre prêt en vue d'augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
D. Bernadette was born on May 20, 1961 in Athiémé and has been living for nearly twenty years in the Hlacomey district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  Married to GBONI Jean Charles, she is the mother of four children, who have attended school. She lives together with her children and husband in Hlacomey.  The couple jointly ensure that their various family expenses are covered.  Bernadette did not attend school. For ten years ago, with the aim of meeting the various needs of her children, she has been selling outfits and shoes by the distribution system.  She gets her supplies from Lomé, in Togo, a country neighboring Benin.  She is a previous ALIDé client having benefited from five loans, which have all been prepaid.  Facing the significant demand for products from her customers, Bernadette is requesting another loan to increase her stock of goods and to respond better to the requirements of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying shoes and clothing

loans.name: Ajayi

texts.en:
Ajayi has a shop where she sells foodstuffs (amala), yam flour, plantain flour, and firewood. Amala in Yoruba land is a special delicacy and a common foodstuff in every home. This business is her livelihood and she has been in the business for over 15 years. She is very happy with the way her business is growing.

Ajayi is 46 years old and married with 5 children. Her husband is a civil servant, and they live in Lagos.

She hopes for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and firewood to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and fire wood to sell

loans.name: Crecelia

texts.es:
Crecelia es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasum que significa trajeamos en quechua.
Crecelia tiene 30 años y 4 hijos, Crecelia viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra animales, la carne lo vende al por mayor.
Crecelia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de animales.
Los sueños de Crecelia son tener un puesto estable para su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Crecelia is a memember of the Llamkasum Community Bank. Llamkasum means 'We Clothe' in Quechua. Crecelia is 30 years old and has 4 children. Crecelia travels to different markets in the area to buy livestock and sell meat in bulk. Crecelia needs a loan of 1,000 soles to invest in the purchase of animals. Crecelia dreams of having a fixed place of business and for her children to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animals

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with four children, two girls and two boys who all attend school. She sells chapati (flatbread), beans and half cakes to passersby and her neighbors.

Fatuma has been in business for one year and previously was a hairdresser. With the KES 20,000 loan, she hopes to look for a shop where she can work from and also to buy more flour, beans and cooking oil. Her business challenges are seasonality and customers defaulting on goods taken on credit.
		
Fatuma rents a home with electricity but no water. Her great expenses are school fees, medication and rent. She joined the organization so that she can access loans and improve her business. She hopes to buy a piece of land where she can construct a shop and carry out her business there.

loans.use: To rent a shop and buy flour, beans and cooking oil

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane N. is from the village of  Opol Misamis Oriental. She is 40 years old. Mary Jane is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Mary Jane owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. Mary Jane has been in business for more than five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Mary Jane joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Mary Jane from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester A. is a 42-year-old woman from the village of Migpange Bonifacio. Ester is married and has 4 school-age children. To earn a living, Ester owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. More specifically, her main source of income is derived from selling everyday products such as biscuits, candies, milo, juice packs, milk, shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in her local community. Ester has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2008, Ester joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. As a result, she was able to engage in business activities and in turn to improve her standard of living. Ester has successfully repaid a previous loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Ester is now requesting a new loan, again in the amount of 7,000 PHP ($175), which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. Notably, this loan would be the third loan taken out by Ester through GDMPC. She plans to use any additional revenue generated from the business on account of the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is comprised of mostly farmers, fishermen/women, and entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional products

loans.name: Chhon

texts.en: Mrs. S., 40, sells a variety of vegetables in Psa Takhmao Market,  earning approximately $5 profit a day.  The vegetables that she sells are either bought in bulk from suppliers or grown on her own farmland next to her house. S. and her husband Moeun Pov, 41, who shares responsibility for his family by working as a local farmer, help each other  to earn money so they can meet the needs of their three young children, all of whom attend school.  Due to insufficient capital, S.'s income is relatively low, so she is requesting a Kiva loan to accrue the capital necessary to expand her vegetable trade.

loans.use: To accrue the capital necessary to expand her vegetable trade.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella B. is from the village of Brgy.Vista Alegre,Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 53 years old. Bella is widowed and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Bella owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Bella has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 25,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Bella joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bella has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Bella is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Bella from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 42 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos, vive en el caserío Guaraguaos del distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito agrícola caracterizado por dedicarse casi exclusivamente al cultivo de frutas, las cuales son tratadas para ser exportadas a otros países, la zona se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Piura, perteneciente a la región del mismo nombre, situada a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores, el suele criar ovejas en un corral situado cerca a su domicilio, cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre frecuentan la zona en donde vive, eventualmente también la vende a sus vecinos. Adicionalmente se dedica a labores agrícolas con las que complementa los ingresos que necesita para sacar adelante a su familia.

Francisco desea mejorar la crianza de sus ovejas para poder captar mayores ingresos al momento de venderlas, para ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soes que piensa invertir en la compra de alimento balanceado.

Francisco es un hombre trabajador y bastante entregado a su familia. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran alguien honrado y confiable.
texts.en:
Francisco is 42 years old, married and has three children. He lives in the hamblt of Guaraguaos in Tambogrande district. This is an agricultural district devoted almost exclusively to cultivating fruit which is processed and exported to other countries. The zone is located in Piura province, in the region with the same name, located more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. He raises and sells small livestock, generally raising sheep in a pen near his house. When they have reached a good level of development he offers them for sale to dealers who frequent the area where he lives and sometimes also sells to his neighbors. In addition, he does agricultural work to supplement the income he needs to support his family. Francisco would like to improve his sheep-raising so he can get more income when he sells them. For this reason he has requested, for the first time, a loan for 1200 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa, which he will invest in the purchase of balanced food. Francisco is a hard worker and very dedicated to his family. In his zone his neighbors and acquaintances see him as someone honest and reliable.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy feed for raising sheep.

loans.name: Yungueñitas Group

texts.es:
“Yungueñitas” es una asociación comunal que está iniciando su segundo ciclo, es parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra la señora presidenta y su mesa directiva compuesta por Tesorera y Secretaria de Actas, de acuerdo a la norma de la institución.  

La  presidenta, doña Deysi, luego de haber trabajado como costurera en Argentina, decidió abrir su propio taller de costura en Bolivia, cerca de su familia.  Su primer crédito fue de Bs.1000.- y le sirvió para comprar un motor para máquina de coser, en este segundo ciclo su crédito también es por Bs.1000.- pero ahora está destinado a la compra de tela.  Doña Deysi es madre de cuatro niños por los que se esfuerza mucho.
