La A.C. “Yungueñitas” tiene ocho integrantes que desarrollan sus propios negocios, entre ellos tenemos: tejido de chalecos, venta de camas y edredones, confección de deportivos, técnico electricista, venta de comida, venta de CD´s y llaveros, venta de papas fritas y chicharrones.
texts.en:
“Yungueñitas” is a communal association, which is beginning its second loan cycle. It is part of the Centro Focal de Santiago II, which is headed by a president and has a treasurer and chief secretary. The president, Mrs Deysi, decided to open her own sewing shop, close to her family, after having worked as a seamstress in Argentina. Her first loan was for 1000 Bolivian bolivianos and helped her buy a motor for her sewing machine. With her second loan of 1000 bolivianos, she intends to buy fabric. Mrs Deysi is the mother of four children, which she works hard to provide for. The "Yungueñitas” communal association has eight members, who each have their own business. These include: a jacket-making business; a bed and mattress sales business; a sports shoe making business; an electricians; a food sales business; a CD and keyring sales business; and a potato chips and chicharrones (fried meat) sales business.

Translated from Spanish by Cameron Graham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Nagina's Group

texts.en:
Nagina lives in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. She is 52 years old, married, and has four children: three sons and one daughter. Her oldest son is involved in a business selling jewelry. The second son has an embroidery business. The youngest son drives a rickshaw. Her daughter is 24 years old and stays at home to operate her sewing business. All of the children make financial contributions to their family from their work.
  
Her husband is M. A., and he is a mason. Nagina owns and operates a business selling clothes in order to support her family financially. She purchases clothes from different cities (such as Multan and Faisalabad) and sells them in her native city to earn a good profit. She has been doing this work for the past ten years. Nagina has applied for a loan from Asasah for her own business. With the loan amount she will purchase clothes in bulk to increase her sales. This is her third loan cycle. In previous loan years she has been a responsible loan user of Asasah by paying her installments on time and never missing any meetings.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Touch Arn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of sixteen people who live in Sdau Aem village in Takeo province. Mrs. A. Touch, 59, is the village bank president selected by the other members who will each use their portion of the loan in varied ways. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice on to sell to support her family and she is a basket maker. Her problem is that her field has infertile soil. So, to improve production, Mrs. A. Touch is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and hire a plow and farming laborers, With any remainder of the loan she will buy some piglets to raise to start a new business. She is a widow with a child who is a weaver. 

Mrs. Sothea Hoeun is a group guarantor so she is also in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire a plow and farming laborers

loans.name: Maria Gaby

texts.es:
María tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres en el caserío Insculas del distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola situada a una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
Se dedica a la crianza de animales ya la venta de carnes en su vivienda. Ella ofrece tanto carnes rojas como carne de aves a sus vecinos y clientes. Ella se encarga de criar los animales que luego sacrifica para ofrecer su carne en venta, como la zona en donde vive se encuentra alejada del pueblo central, su negocio es de mucha ayuda en la zona por lo que siempre cuenta con acogida.
María ya ha tenido un préstamo financiado con el fondo Kiva. En su primer préstamo pudo ampliar su negocio, especialmente con la compra de animales menores, lo que le permitió ampliar la variedad de carne que ofrece con carnes rojas. Ella se encuentra muy agradecida con las personas que le ayudaron a sacar adelante su negocio.
Ahora que su negocio se ha hecho más conocido desea adquirir más animales para seguir creciendo como empresaria y así poder ayudar a su familia a salir adelante. Por ello ha vuelto a solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr sus metas
texts.en:
María is 27 years old and single.  She lives with her parents in the Insculas settlement in the Olmos district.  It is an agricultural zone located in the Lambayeque province, which is over an hour and 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She raises animals and sells their meat at her home.  She sells red meat as well as poultry to her customers and neighbors.  She takes charge of raising the animals and later butchering them in order to sell the meat.  As the area where she lives is far from the central town, her business is very helpful to the area.  That is why her business is always well-received.

María has had a Kiva loan.  With her first loan she was able to expand her business, especially by purchasing more small animals.  This allowed her to increase the variety of meat that she sells along with red meat. She is very grateful to the people who helped her get ahead in her business.

Now that her business is more well-known, she wishes to get more animals to keep growing as a businesswoman.  That way she will be able to help her family get ahead.  That is why she has returned to Edpyme Alternativa to request a loan for 1,500 soles, which will help her reach her goals.

loans.use: To buy animals to raise in order to sell their meat at home.

loans.name: Gabriela Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra. Gabriela C. es originaria del municipio de Telica, actualmente se desempeña como profesora de secundaria en el colegio José de la Cruz Mena del municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón donde tiene 8 años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel para la compra de cerámica y pago de mano de obra con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en: Gabriela C. is from the municipality of Telica. She works as a high school teacher at the high school José de la Cruz Mena in the town of Santa Rose del Peñón.  She has worked there for 8 years.  This is her first loan with Ceprodel and she will use the money to buy ceramics and pay for labor to improve her home.

loans.use: Buying clay, cement, and paying labor expenses

loans.name: Anthony Steven

texts.es: Común mente vemos historias de personas emprendedoras y con mucho positivismo para los negocios, pero en este caso esta historia es de un joven estudiante con muchos deseos se surgir con estudios que el futuro le aseguren un puesto de trabajo y así desempeñarse en un ámbito laboral estable. Este es el caso de Anthony M. muchacho de 19 años de edad que cursa el 4 ciclo  de la carrera técnica de Computación e Informática, obteniendo buenas calificación es optimista con respecto a sus estudios por tanto terminando de estudiar Computación e informática piensa estudiar Ingles e Ingeniería de sistemas. En sus tiempo libre trabaja ayudando a su padre el cual tiene un taller de repuestos de autos. Con el reciente préstamo otorgado a Anthony M. lo invertirá en el pago de sus estudios. Un muchacho con mucha creatividad y empeñoso en los estudios con una meta a futuro el cual es la culminación exitosa de los estudios que realiza.
texts.en:
We commonly see stories of enterprising people with a lot of enthusiasm for their businesses but in this case the story is that of a young student who has a great desire to get ahead through his studies.  This will assure him a job in the future and enable him to work in a stable work environment.

This is the story of Anthony M., a 19 year-old boy who is in the 4th year of his vocational course in Computing and Information Technology.  Obtaining a good qualification, he is optimistic with respect to his studies.  When he finishes studying Computing and Information Technology he would like to study English and Systems Engineering.  In his spare time he works helping his father who has a car repair workshop.  Anthony will use this loan to pay for his studies.  He is a boy with a lot of creativity and he is determined in his studies.  His future goal is the successful culmination of his studies.

loans.use: To pay for his studies

loans.name: Arvin

texts.en:
Arvin A. is a single man who lives in Bagumbayan Street, Brgy. 7, Isabela, Negros Occidental. He earns his living by operating a used clothing sales business. 

Arvin joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because he aspired for something better for his family. With the help of his past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Arvin has been incrementally lifting his family out of poverty by the sweat of his brow. His previous loan of PHP 17,000 helped him earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, increasing the family's standard of living.  

This time, for his 13th loan, he is borrowing PHP 20,000, which he intends to use to purchase stocks of clothes to sell so that he can continue to save up for the future expansion of his business. 

Arvin A. is a Dungganon man who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of his dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon -- a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more clothing to sell to customers

loans.name: Fresas Group

texts.es:
La señora Teresa de Jesús, vive en  Coapilla Estado de Chiapas México, es casada con el señor Juvenal Sánchez Sánchez, en donde procreo cuatro hojas y son: Fabiola de Jesús de nueve años, la otra es Fátima Selene, Sandi Gabriela y Sindi Daniela  ambas de cuatro años.
           Ella se dedica a su hogar y a la elaboración de tamales desde hace dos años y comenta que le va bien ya que con eso ha estado obteniendo ingresos en su hogar y familia.
         Se inspiro en esta actividad para sacar adelante a sus familia tenía que tener una actividad  donde le diera resultados, así apoyar a su esposo con los gastos que se dan del diario en el hogar.
       Con las ganancia que va obteniendo compra ingredientes para que, con ello trabaje más días a la semana y con ello  su negocio se baya incrementado día a día.
      Su sueño es que logre obtener ahorros para que apoye a sus hijas en su educación y pueda darle lo mas necesario a cada una de ellas, así sean personas de futuro y logren sostenerse cuando ya tenga una profesión.
      Se integro al grupo ya que la señora Vitalina la invito a ser parte del programa, así con ello apoyarse y comprar ingredientes para su actividad, se animo y solicitaron el  préstamo. El grupo se llama las fresas la razón del nombre es porque en la región se cosechan fresas.
      Las personas que conforman el grupo son tres y son las siguientes:
         Vitalina Pérez P.: ella se dedica a vender productos agrícolas que sedan en la región como son: calabaza, aguacate, frijol, pinol, entre otros.
     Isabel M. García: ella invertirá el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de tamales.
   Teresa de Jesús Pérez Pérez: invierte el  préstamo en la compra de ingredientes como son: carne, chile ancho, tomate, entre otros para la elaboración de tamales.
texts.en:
Teresa de Jesús lives in Coapilla, Chiapas, México.  She is married to Mr. Juvenal Sánchez Sánchez which whom she had four children: Fabiola de Jesús, 9, Fátima Selene, Sandi Gabriela and Sindi Daniela , both four.

She is a housewife and for the last two years has been making tamales.  She comments that she’s done well in that it has produced income for her home and family.

She was inspired to go into this activity to move her family ahead; she needed to have an activity that would produce results in order to help her husband meet daily household expenses.

With profits obtained she buys ingredients so that she can work more days of the week so that her business can grow day by day.

Her dream is to have savings available to pay for her daughters’ education so that she can provide each one of them with everything they need so that they will have a future and be able to support themselves when they have a profession.

She joined the group when Vitalina invited her to be part of the program so that she could help herself and buy ingredients for her activity.  She decided to join and they asked for the loan.  The group is called Strawberries because strawberries are grown in the region.

The three members of the group are:

Vitalina Pérez P.: she sells agricultural products common to the region like squash, avocado, beans, and corn flour, among others.

Isabel M. García: will use the loan to buy ingredients to make tamales.

Teresa de Jesús Pérez Pérez: will use the loan to buy ingredients like meat, chile ancho, tomatoes, among others to make tamales.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make tamales.

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es:
Jhonny   solicito 1000 $us, se dedica a la  crianza de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche la vende a Pil Andina, planta procesadora de leche.
El credito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca y así aumentar su producción de leche y a la vez incrementar sus ingresos.
Vive en la comunidad Nina Chiri, a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz. 
Es el primer  crédito en impro y el primero vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Jhonny is requesting a loan for $1,000 USD.  His business is raising cattle whose milk he sells to Pil Andina, a milk processing plant.

Jhonny will use his loan to buy a cow to increase his milk production and, at the same time, increase his income.  He lives in Nina Chiri community, three hours from the city of La Paz.  This is his first loan with Impro and his first Kiva loan.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to increase his milk production

loans.name: Maria Irma

texts.es:
Doña María, D. 58 años D. edad, resiD. en San Miguel, departamento D. San Miguel, vive con su hijo, tienen casa propia, ella es V., posee un comedor que en un inicio era pupuseria, pero poco a poco creció ofreciendo comida  para desayuno, almuerzo cena, desD. hace 16 años en un horario D.  6:00am a 7:00pm.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. mercadería para el comedor, también utensilios D. cocina, con esta compra espera tener lo necesario para la preparación D. los alimentos tanto en productos como verduras, carnes y condimentos como también es utensilios más eficientes.
Su mayor sueño es mantener el comedor estable sin recurrir a préstamo, además D. generar ingresos para su hogar e ir mejorando las condiciones del comedor.
texts.en:
María is 58 years old and lives in San Miguel, in San Miguel department, with her son.  She is a widow and has her own home.  María owns an eatery.  It was originally a pupuseria but she gradually grew her business and started offering breakfasts, lunches and dinners.  She has had her business for 16 years and works from 6.00am to 7.00pm.

María is requesting a loan to buy merchandise and cooking utensils for her eatery.  With this purchase, she hopes to have all she needs to make her meals both in terms of products such as vegetables, meat and condiments as well as more efficient utensils.

María's greatest dream is to keep her business stable without having to take out loans.  She would also like to make income for her household and continue improving the conditions of her eatery.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her eatery as well as cooking utensils

loans.name: Rosalía

texts.es:
Rosalía es socia del Banco Comunal San Jose de Viñaca, tiene 27 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Rosalía se dedica la siembra y venta de verduras. Rosalía cuenta con terrenos donde siembra sus verduras, pero en las épocas donde sus verduras está en crecimiento se dedica a comprar de sus vecinas y los lleva al mercado Nery García Zarate y los reparte entre sus caseras. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de semillas y remedios. A Rosalía le gusta Finca porque le dan créditos y puede ahorrar.
Su sueño es que su negocio crezca y poder educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosalía is a member of the San José de Viñaca communal bank. She is 27 years old, married, and has two children. She works planting and selling vegetables and has land where she plants them. However, during the seasons when her vegetables are growing, she buys from her neighbors and sells them at the Nery García Zarate market and distributes them among her regular customers. She will invest the loan requested in the purchase of seeds and medicines. Rosalía likes Finca because they give her loans and she can save.

Her dream is for her business to grow and to be able to educate her children.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and medicines

loans.name: Sanjaa

texts.en:
Sanjaa is 27, single and lives with her five year old son in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. She has lived in her current apartment, which was given to her by her parents, for 15 years. 

Sanjaa sells cosmetics at a rented kiosk in a trading center. She started her business in July 2010 after gaining experience working as a store salesperson from 2005 to 2010. Sanjaa is able to run her business successfully due to her previous experience. She started her business with the working capital of 1,500,000 MNT and her current working capital exceeds 2,000,000 MNT. Sanjaa is a hardworking and calm person who wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase more cosmetics.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es:
Carlos , es un joven de 25 años de edad ,originario de Esteli, soltero quien vive con su madre ,y que se dedica a ayudarle en la contabilidad a su mama en el negocio de frutas .Empezo a los 14 años cuando su familia empezo a vender en el diamante de las Segovia municipio de Esteli,esta cursando la universidad estudiando la carrera de Contaduria Publica  en Esteli,pues no pierde la fe de sacar adelante a  su familia dandoles una mejor calidad de vida. 
El solicita el prestamo para capital de trabajo , pues de esta manera podra comprar mas frutas y venderlas por cantidad y surtir mejor su negocio,  mejorar sus ventas, considera que es una buena temporada para vender sus productos. Dentro de sus planes esta lograr culminar su carrera , desarrollarse profesionalmente y seguir ayudando a su madre .
Su meta proxima es comprar un vehiculo para trasladar frutas desde Managua a Esteli.
texts.en:
Carlos is 25 years old and from Esteli.  He is single and lives with his mother.  He helps his mom with the book keeping for her fruit business.  He started at the age of 14 when his family started selling in Diamante de las Segovia, in the town of Esteli.  Carlos is at university, studying for a degree in certified public accounting, in Esteli.  He does not lose faith in being able to get his family ahead in life, providing them with a better quality of life.

Carlos is requesting this loan as working capital as it will enable him to buy more fruit, sell in bulk, better stock his business and improve his sales.  He says that this is a good season to sell his products.  Amongst his plans is managing to finish his degree, making progress professionally and continuing to help his mother.  His short-term goal is to buy a vehicle so that he can transport fruit from Managua to Esteli.

loans.use: To buy fruit

loans.name: Ma. Editha

texts.en:
Ma. Editha is a married woman who lives in Danao City, Cebu. She earns her living by selling charcoal and operating a general store. Her husband Diocelindo, who is 48 years old, works as a construction worker to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have two children who are between 18 and 24 years old. Ma. Editha joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ma. Editha has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fourth loan, she is borrowing PHP 11,000 to buy a stock of charcoal and goods for the store so that she can continue to save up for future expansion of her business. Ma. Editha is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Sumber Tanjung Group

texts.en:
Sumber Tanjung Group is located in Singaraja, North Bali. This group has a total membership of 10 people, and all members of the group are women who are married and have children. This group wants to borrow funds in the amount of Rp. 10,000,000. The person who is responsible for the group is Ni Ketut S.. Ni Ketut S. has three children. 

This group has long been managing the business of pigs, and they want to expand their business. For this reason, the members of Sumber Tanjung group chose to take out a loan at MUK to multiply their capital, in order to buy more piglets and also to buy feed for the pigs, so their profit will increase. The result will be additional income for their children's education, and also they can help their husbands in buying the daily necessities in the kitchen.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and also to buy feed for them.

loans.name: Zaida's Group

texts.en:
Zaida U. is the leader of this group. She is 24 and married to a teacher. Together with her husband she is bringing up a two-year-old son. Zaida works as a teacher at school as does her husband. She is also engaged in retail trade. Three years ago she saved money from her salary, added some additional savings and with the initial investment of 18,000 soms she started her business. 

At the moment she earns 10,000 soms per month. She hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to purchase convenience goods in order to increase the turnover of her business. In the future she wants to expand her business, a purchase a piece of land, build a big house, and purchase a vehicle for the family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase convenience goods.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy L. is from the village of Mayana, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 30 years old. Mercy is separated from her spouse and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Mercy sells fish like sardines, milk fish and mackerel in the local community. Mercy has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month. 

In 2011, Mercy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell like mackerel & sardines. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mercy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue  to improve her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish like mackerel & sardines to sell

loans.name: Guimer

texts.es:
El Señor Guimer V. A. tiene 23 años vive en concubinato y es padre de una hija; él desde muy temprana edad empezó a trabajar como albañil, actualmente el trabaja como moto taxista  en el sindicato “CARRASCO”  el trabaja hace mas de 2 años como socio activo, el servicio que brinda es rentable por la alta cantidad de personas que solicitan este servicio por la facilidad,  rapidez y eficiencia. El sindicato cuenta con paradas y turnos para cada afiliado, en diferentes puntos de la localidad de Ivirgarzama donde las personas acuden para solicitar dicho servicio, su esposa cuenta con una pequeña tienda de barrio, para así poder ayudar con los gastos familiares que no abastece con la actividad laboral de su pareja, para en un futuro poder brindarle lo mejor a su hija. 
 	Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de mercadería para abastecer y surtir más su venta y de esta forma poder brindar una mejor calidad en sus productos a sus clientes lo que le permitirá también mejorar sus ingresos, consecuente mente mejorar su calidad de vida.
 	Cabe señalar que el señor Guimer V. A. se apersono a solicitar su préstamo luego de que sus compañeros de su sindicato le comentaron de las buenas condiciones crediticias con las que trabaja nuestra institución
texts.en:
Guimer V. A. is 23 years old, is in a live-in relationship, and has one daughter.  From a very young age he began working as a mason.  Now he drives a moto-taxi as part of the CARRASCO union and has been an active member for two years.  This service is profitable because many people use it.  It’s fast and efficient.

The union has shifts and stops in different parts of town for each member.  They are located in places where people gather for said service.  His wife runs a small neighborhood store so that she can help with the family expenses that [Guimer’s] current salary will not cover.  They want to give a better life to their daughter in the future.

This will be his first loan through our institution, which he will use to buy merchandise to stock the store and have a better assortment and be able to provide a better quality of products to his customers.  This will allow him to increase his income and quality of life.

Guimer came to request a loan after his fellow members from the union told him about the way our institution works.

loans.use: to stock his store

loans.name: Jacqueline Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Jacqueline, tiene la edad de 22 años, habita el barrio San Ignacio, junto a su esposo el cual labora como chofer para apoyarla con los gastos del hogar  , ellos tiene dos hijos a su cargo , los sueños de doña Jacqueline es poder apoyar siempre en sus estudios a sus hijos para que no pasen por las grandes dificultades económicas como ellas las ha pasado , ella tiene   dos años laborando como comerciante de queso , verduras y frutas , la mayor afectación que se le presenta son las alza en los productos  y las ventas están malas por la situación económica que enfrenta al país ; con el primer crédito logro incrementar su negocio ya que antes solo se dedicaba a la venta de queso y ahora tiene un puesto de frutas y verduras .
texts.en: Jacqueline is 22 years old. She lives in the neighborhood of San Ignacio in the municipality of Concepción with her husband, who works as a chauffeur to help her with household expenses. They have two children. Jacqueline's dream is to be able to always support her children's education so they do not go through the great financial difficulties that she has experienced. She has been working for two years selling cheese, fruit, and vegetables. The greatest problem she faces are the increase in products and sales are bad due to the economic situation the country faces. With her first loan she succeeded in increasing her business, because before she only sold cheese, and now she has a fruit and vegetable stand.

loans.use: buy fruits, vegetables, and dairy products.

loans.name: Kahtan

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, single and lives with four family members, of whom one of them works.
Kahtan has run a bakery since 2006, where he makes the Alsamun type of traditional Iraqi bread. This bread is made in traditional stone ovens that are fired with oil or gas. He has 25 years' experience in this field, gained since he was a child. He has a good reputation and is well known in his area.
Kahtan is requesting a $3,000 loan to pay the annual rent on his bakery. He is aiming to earn more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent on his bakery.

loans.name: Rosmeli

texts.es:
Rosmeli es socia del Banco Comunal Santa Rita, tiene 22 años, es conviviente, tiene una hija de 2 meses. Se dedica a la venta de ropa. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería. 
Rosmeli tiene un puesto de ropa en el mercado 12 de Abril. Le gusta FINCA Perú, por la facilidad de los créditos y las capacitaciones que reciben pues aprenden mucho y lo pone en práctica en su vida diaria. Tuvo algunas dificultades en el pago por el nacimiento de su hija no había quien se quede en su puesto, pero ya se recupero. Su sueño es que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
Rosmeli is a member of the Santa Rita communal bank.  She is 22 years old, has a spouse and a two-month-old daughter.  She sells clothes.  The loan she requested will be used to buy merchandise.

Rosmeli has a clothing stand in the 12 de Abril market.  She likes FINCA Perú because of the ease of loans and the training they receive because they learn a lot that they can put into practice in their daily lives.

She had a few payment problems due to the birth of her daughter because there wasn’t anyone to tend to the stand but she’s recovered now.  Her dream is that the business continues to grow.

loans.use: to buy assorted clothes.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty  is a single mother of six, and only three of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. Betty has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for over ten years. Betty works seven days a week and sells her products by retail. She works from home and works seven days out of every week. Her business challenges include transportation, the rainy season, which makes roads impassable, and also increases in the price of charcoal. Betty aspires to owning a delivery van. She resides in a two-room house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío tiene 20 años, vive en el caserío de Cayan. Desde muy joven comenzó a independizarse y apoyar constantemente a sus padres; con quienes vive en compañía de sus 2 hermanos: Robert y Jessenia. Sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra, desde niña acostumbraba a acompañarlos durante largas jornadas de trabajo en el campo. Ya cuando terminó la educación secundaria, viajó a la ciudad de Tarma para estudiar Farmacia en un instituto privado, y ahora le falta poco para terminar la carrera técnica. Pero por el momento se está dedicando a apoyar a su padre, ya que su madre sufrió un accidente, quedando postrada en cama e incapacitada para poder trabajar. Es así que hace un año comenzó a asumir las riendas de su familia y aunque le duele dejar de estudiar, se siente feliz de volver a trabajar en el campo y ayudar en la economía de su familia. Su principal actividad económica es sembrar grandes cantidades de papa sobre los 3 terrenos de cultivo que posee, logrando producir 2 veces al año. Según cuenta cada periodo de siembra llega a producir 200 sacos promedio, es por eso que desea trabajar con muchas fuerzas para salir adelante con su familia y concluir con sus estudios. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Corazón de Jesús” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de la colaboración de todos ustedes para salir adelante. Asimismo se compromete a pagar de manera puntual con sus cuotas. Rocío de recibir sus apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para su próximo siembra de papa.
texts.en: Rocio, 20, lives in the rural Cayan settlement. From the time that she was very young she started to become independent and provide constant support to her parents.  She lives with her parents along with her two siblings Robert and Jessenia.  Her parents taught her to farm, and when she was a child she used to work with them during long days in the fields.  When she finished her secondary education she traveled to the city of Tarma to study in a private institution to become a pharmacist.  Now she is lacking only a little coursework to finish that degree.  But at the moment she is devoting her time to helping her father, since her mother was in an accident that left her bedridden and unable to work.  It was because of this that a year ago, she took on added family responsibilities. Even though it pained her to leave her studies, she feels happy to be once again working in the fields and helping her family economically.  She mainly cultivates large quantities of potatoes on 3 plots of land that she has, and she manages to produce 2 harvests a year.  Since with each cultivation cycle she can produce up to 200 sacks of potatoes on average, she wants to work very hard so that she can provide for her family and return to finish her education.  She belongs to the communal bank “Corazón de Jesús," and this is her first loan with MFP, where she awaits your assistance so that she can get ahead.  Furthermore, she is committed to making her payments on time.  Once Rocio receives your support she will invest the money in the purchase of a number of sacks of manure that she will use in her next cycle of cultivating potatoes.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Con Esperanza.

Aquí conocimos a la señora María tiene 63 años  de edad, es madre soltera de  seis hijos los mismos que ya son mayor de edad, pero dos de ellos aun viven en su casa, uno de ellos está comprometido y tiene dos hijos pequeños que son la felicidad de nuestra amiga. Lleva en el Grupo De Crédito algunos años y le gusta porque con los créditos ella ha salido de muchos inconvenientes económicos.

Ella tiene un negocio en su casa en el cual vende hielo en fundas y tarjetas telefónicas, también se dedica a la cría de gallinas criollas, nos cuenta que estas últimas se venden a muy buen precio ya que son muy apetecidas tanto para persona de la localidad como para los turistas, ella entrega las gallinas a un restaurante de la ciudad que le paga muy bien, en cuanto sus otras ventas las realiza todos los días en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes.

Este crédito es para comprar alimentos para las gallinas y tarjetas telefónicas para la venta.
 
Sus sueños son tener una granja bien construida y poder dedicarse a criar estos animalitos en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Con Esperanza” (Women with Hope) meet every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí. Portoviejo has been known for many years as the city of “Los Reales Tamarindos” because of the large quantities of tamarind fruit that are produced this time of year.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. María. She is 63 years old and a single mother with six grown children. Two of them still live at home. One child is engaged and has two small children who bring her happiness. María has been with the Communal Bank for a few years and enjoys being a member because the loans have helped her get out of many difficult financial situations.

She has a business in her home selling bags of ice and phone cards. María also raises chickens. She says that lately the chickens have been selling at very good prices because people from the area, as well as tourists, find them very appetizing. María delivers the chickens to a restaurant in the city that pays her well. Her other sales are made every day to customers who come to her house.

This loan will be used to buy feed for her chickens and phone cards to sell. Her dreams are to have a well-built chicken farm and to spend more time raising these small animals in large quantities.

loans.use: to buy feed for her chickens and phone cards to sell.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “Vamos Juntas” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco.  Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las nuevas siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. 

En el lugar conocimos la señora Marleny, tiene 38 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos y nos cuenta:

“Nací en la ciudad del Quillabamba, ahora vivo en la ciudad del Cusco y donde desarrollo mi actividad económica que es brindar servicios, Yo hago mantenimiento de computadoras y oficinas”. 

Ya son 25 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va  muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Este crédito es para pagar la matrícula de su hijo que está estudiando música.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Vamos Juntas", meaning "Let's Go Together", meets every thirty days in the city of Cusco. It is a place known for being highly touristic and commercial and for the traditional feast of Inti Raymi. It is also here that we find "Machupicchu", one of the Seven Wonders of the World.

Here we meet Marleny. She is 38 years old and she is married common-law. She has three children, and she tells us: 

"I was born in Quillabamba, but today I live in the city of Cusco and it is where I have my business. I am a service provider, and do maintenance services to computers and offices.

She has already been in business for 25 years and it has gone very well thanks to the dedication she invests in her work. This loan is to pay for her son's tuition fees. He is studying music.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition fees.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is 57 years old and married. She is blessed with 7 grown children who have helped her with cultivating the land. The family lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Farming is the family's main source of income, as it is for most of their community. She has been irrigating, plowing and planting on farm fields for 2 years. Green surroundings create a healthy and lovely environment around the farm fields. Cirila normally receives PHP 5,280 from her farm production.

Cirila joined Kiva's partner, GDMPC, earlier this year to have easier access to financial services. She is applying for a loan of PHP 7,000 from the organization to purchase fertilizers and pay for irrigation costs. The rice variant has just been planted and hopefully will produce the expected amount of produce. Cirila is planning to buy a farm sprayer soon to facilitate fertilizer application more easily.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pay for irrigation costs.

loans.name: Yasin

texts.en:
Yasin, 30, lives in the town of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. For three years, Yasin has had a small retail shop business.

To help expand his business, Yasin has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to purchase essential commodities, like sugar and soap, for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, he hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, Yasin hopes to expand his business. He is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Rawad

texts.en:
Rawad is 26 years old, married and is father of one child. He has been working in the construction industry for the past eight years and has acquired rich experience. Rawad is a hard working man and seeks perfection in his work and takes on responsibilities of his family.

Rawad is specialized in pasting rocks to walls and ceilings, and his customers recommend him to others because of his good work. This is his first cycle as a Al Majmoua borrower and is requesting a loan to buy necessary tools for improving his business. Rawad works hard to satisfy his customers and hopes to improve his family's social and financial situations.

loans.use: To buy necessary tools for his business

loans.name: C2389 Dukundumurimo Group

texts.en:
Edith is 42 years old and is a widow, the mother of three children aged between 15 and 29. Edith is the leader of the group called "Dukundumurimo". Her business is well-known. She sells bananas and has been in operation for two years, working from 6 a.m. until 5 p.m. every day except on Saturday. She currently employs one person to help her. In the photo, Edith is the second person from the right.

Edith and her team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase their banana businesses by purchasing more good bananas for sale. They will reinvest additional profits into their businesses and save money to pay their children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.en:
Salvador is 59 years old and married with five children. He manages an agricultural business which is planting corn as well as a hog raising business. His wife is his partner in managing their businesses.

Salvador’s hog raising business operation is not steady because of the lack of finances. He only operates this hog raising business if he gets high yields from his crops and gains a higher income. Because of the typhoon occurrence, his income from the crop business was low. This decided Salvador to borrow a loan of P29,000 to buy piglets to raise and also feed for their maintenance.
 
He hopes to manage this business well so it will become one of his stable sources of income. The loan will be a big help for him to continue operating his hog raising business.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and also feed for their maintenance.

loans.name: Ida

texts.en: Ida is 48 years old and lives in Mauswagon, Calamba. She is married with four children. Ida has a shop that sells grocery items and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of 14,999 to purchase ten cases of beverages and five boxes of groceries. Ida has been a member of PMPC for 8 years.

loans.use: To purchase ten cases of beverages and five boxes of groceries

loans.name: Las Rosas Group

texts.es:
El grupo de credito es lo que se le llama una  Familia Emprendedora, ya que todos son familiares, este grupo se llama "Las Rosas” esta conformado por tres hombre y dos mujeres que son muy trabajadores y sobretodo personas emprendedoras en la vida, el nombre lo eligió doña Patricia quien es la representante del grupo el mimbre lo eligió porque no llegaba nadie de los integrantes del grupo y se le ocurrió cuando vio sus rosas que estaban muy bonitas en sus jardín que por cierto a la coordinadora le llamo mucho la atención.
La señora Patricia tiene 35 años de edad es soltera sin hijos aun vive con sus papas por el momento.
Ella se dedica a vender fantasía ranchando (caminando de pueblo en pueblo), también en las plazas esto lo realiza cada tres veces a la semana en dicha actividad lleva ya 8 años de experiencia en todo este tiempo su única dificultad ha sido cuando llueve y no puede venderá asi porque se moja o cuando las ventas están muy bajas pero comenta que es algo muy normal porque como pueden estar flojas las ventas como pueden elevar.
Esta vez ha solicitado el crédito para invertir en sus negocio comprar aretes, bolitas, agujetas, platillas, ligas para nudos, estambre de acriton para hacer bolitas para el cabello, broches pasadores, limas para uñas, cepillos, peines y otras novedades.
Su meta llegar a tener una casa propia para ella ya que vive con sus papas y sobre todo que crezca y mejore su negocio.
Los integrantes del grupo invertirán en otras cosas don Modesto comprara estiércol para el cultivo de nopales, Magdaleno comprara artículos de fantasía, Eleuteria comprara arete de chapa y plata, y Pascual comprar novedades y fantasía.
“Estamos muy agradecidos por el crédito que nos otorgan sobre todo por la facilidad que nos dan para pagar”
texts.en:
This group is what is called a Familia Emprendedora (Enterprising Family) as all the members are related to each other. They call themselves Las Rosas (the Roses). In the group are three men and two women. They are hardworking and, above all, enterprising. The name was chosen by Sra. Patricia who is the group’s representative. It happened when she saw the beautiful roses growing in her garden and they caught her attention. Patricia is 35 years old and single; she doesn’t have any children and lives with her parents at the moment.

Patricia sells Ranchando novelty items. She walks from town to town and sells in the plazas three times a week. She’s been doing this for eight years. The only problem she has is when it rains, she gets wet and cannot sell her wares. On occasion sales are low, but she says that it’s normal: sometimes they’re low, sometimes they’re high.

She is seeking a loan to buy ear-rings, hair bobbles, shoe laces, plates, hair elastics, yarn to make hair accessories, bobby pins, nail files, brushes, combs etc. Her goal is to have her own house one day as at the moment she lives with her parents.Another goal is to see her business thrive.

The other members of the group plan to do different things with their share of the loan. Sr. Modesto will buy manure for his nopal (prickly pear) crop. Magdaleno will buy novelty items. Eleuteria will buy pins and ear-rings. Pascual will buy novelty items.

They are very grateful for the loan and the simple repayment conditions.

loans.use: to buy ear-rings, hair bobbles, shoe laces, hair elastics, elastics etc.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan vive con su esposa y un hijo, es agricultor y ganadero, los negocios los aprendio por su papá quien siempre se a dedicado a la agricultura y la ganadería, tiene experiencia en los negocios y no cuenta con un horario establecido de trabajo ya que trabaja solo y en lo propio.
El esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de cerdos para engordar, esta compra le ayudara a incrementar la granja y las ventas y a mejorar los ingresos económicos en su hogar.
El proposito de Juan es tener un negocio grande y darle el estudio a su hijo hasta sacar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Juan lives with his wife and son.  He is a farmer and also raises livestock.  He learned these businesses from his dad who has always worked in farming and livestock raising.  Juan has experience in his businesses.  He does not work regular hours as he works alone and is self employed.

Juan is requesting a loan to buy pigs to fatten.  This purchase will help him to increase the size of his farm and his sales.  He will also improve his household income.

Juan's goal is to have a big business and to provide his son with an education until he gains his university degree.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Riolita

texts.en:
At the age of 35, Riolita has four children, all of whom are in elementary school. She needs to work hard because she wishes to give them the opportunity to attend high school and college. She wants them to have a better future, and education is the only treasure she can give them.

Riolita runs a rice farming business. She and her husband manage their business, and they work together to achieve better results. Riolita always prays that she will get better yields from her crops. If she can maintain her farming business, she believes that it will be enough to continue sending her children to school. 

Riolita is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her rice farming business. She looks forward to the success of her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for rice farming.

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter is a married man of thirty-one years. He has three children, and they live in Ruaka in Kiambu. He operates a video show business in Kiambu and has been in this business for eight years now. Walter gets a monthly income of about fifteen thousand shillings.

This will be Walter's first loan with KADET LTD. He plans to buy more dvds for his video show, and will use part of the money to renovate the video showroom. In future he wants to own two other showrooms in different centers in Kiambu.

loans.use: To renovate his video showroom and buy more dvds.

loans.name: Artemio

texts.en:
Artemio is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with six children. 

Artemio has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Artemio has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 26-year-old young man living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His business, which he started two years ago, is selling secondhand shoes. He started the business with capital of only three hundred shillings, but now it is worth one million five hundred thousand shillings. In spite of this, he faces challenges including price fluctuations, inflation, and high transportation costs. His desire is to buy land to grow crops and diversify his business into a boutique. Stephen needs this loan to buy used shoes to resell this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy used shoes to resell this Christmas season.

loans.name: Mario Enrique

texts.es:
Mario tiene 23 años de edad y vive con su familia en la comunidad de Santa Teresita, en la provincia de Cartago. La Ciudad de Cartago fue fundada en 1563 por el conquistador español Juan Vázquez de Coronado, fungió como capital de Costa Rica hasta 1823 y fue sede de la primera corte internacional permanente de la historia mundial, la Corte de Cartago. Su relieve montañoso está formado por dos cordilleras: la Central y la cordillera de Talamanca.
Desde hace unos años Mario se dedica a la ganadería, específicamente en producción de leche. Logra vender sus productos a los vecinos de su comunidad quienes se muestran muy satisfechos con la calidad de los productos que ofrece. En su caso en particular, la demanda es mayor de lo que puede ofrecer actualmente. Mario considera que gracias al progreso de este proyecto, él y su familia han mejorado poco a poco sus condiciones de vida y ha logrado ser actores en el desarrollo de la comunidad. 
Actualmente Mario desea obtener un microcrédito por ¢600.000 (seiscientos mil colones), para comprar una vaca y así poder incrementar la producción. El sabe que contar con mayor número de vacas más es un mayor sacrificio y demandará más trabajo. Sin embargo, el deseo de ser un microempresario exitoso y sacar adelante a su familia mejorando las condiciones de vida, lo motiva a esforzarse con gran esmero. 
Mario forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de El Sauce de Santa Teresita Turrialba, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer crédito y dice que con el espera poder seguir creciendo como microempresario y sacar su negocio adelante. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Mario is 23 years old and lives with his family in the community of Santa Teresita in the province of Cartago.  The city of Cartago was founded in 1563 by the Spanish conquistador Juan Vázquez de Coronado.  It acted as the capital of Costa Rica until 1823 and was the seat of the first permanent international court in world history, the Corte de Cartago [Court of Cartago].  Its mountainous relief is formed by two mountain ranges, the Central range and the Talamanca range.

For a few years Mario has worked in cattle farming, specifically in milk production.  He sells his products to his neighbors in the community, who are very satisfied with the quality of the products he offers.  In his case in particular, currently the demand is greater that what he is able to offer.  Mario considers that thanks to the progress of this project he and his family have improved their living conditions little by little and have managed to be players in the development of the community.

Currently Mario wants to get a micro-loan of 600,000 CRC (six hundred thousand colones) to buy a cow and so be able to increase production.  He knows that having a greater number of cows is a greater sacrifice and will demand more work.  Nevertheless the desire to be a successful micro-entrepreneur and getting his family ahead by improving their living conditions motivates him to make an effort with great care.

Mario is part of the El Sauce de Santa Teresita Turrialba communal bank, one of the 150 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.  This will be his first loan and he says that with it he hopes to be able to continue growing as a micro-entrepreneur and to get his business ahead.  He also stresses that thanks to this type of organization and means of facilitating credit he is able to dedicate more time to productive activities.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Merlani

texts.en:
Merlani is 49 years old. She has four children of school age. They live in the small village of Sibugun, Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental. Merlan'si family is doing well. Her husband is a government employee. Merlani established a small business to help her husband augment his income. 

She is in the retail business running what is known as a 'sari-sari' store that sells soft drinks and other items. She has been in this business for two years and has a proven track record of being able to generate revenue. She has a monthly return of 1,500 php.

She joined GDMPC to gain financial access to engage in business activities to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 4000 php to purchase grocery goods to sell in the store. She is hoping that, through her income, she can further support the education of her children until college.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks to sell in the store

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en: Edgardo is 47 years old and married. He lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. For the past twenty years, Edgardo has been a farmer. He earns 20,000 PHP each month and is a new member of PMPC. Edgardo is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. In the future, he hopes to expand and improve his business.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations

loans.name: Rocío

texts.en:
Rocío is a very hard-working woman who is married and has a son that lives with her and her husband. Her husband is a merchant at the flea markets, and for that reason he gets unstable incomes. That is why they decided to start their own fixed business and they attend to it personally, since they don\\\'t have employees.

Her clients have been increasing lately, so she needs a work capital to be able to provide more of her products and get better prices. She needs your support of $475 USD to have more supplies for her business and offer a better service to her clients. She plans to repay the loan within 5-10 months.

**

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva Volunteer.

Rocío es una mujer muy trabajadora que está casada y tiene un hijo que vive con ella y su esposo. Su esposo es comerciante en los mercados rodantes y por lo mismo sus ingresos son muy variables, es por eso que decidieron iniciar este negocio fijo , el cual ellos atienden personalmente, ya que no cuentan con empleados.

Sus clientes se han venido incrementando últimamente y por eso que necesita de capital de trabajo para poder surtir en mayor volumen sus mercancías y conseguir mejores precios. Es por eso que requiere de un apoyo de $ 475 USD para poder surtir su negocio y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, el plazo que requiere para pagar su préstamo será de 5-10 meses.

loans.use: Provide her business and offer a better service

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is married with two children. She lives in the Pugu area of Dar es Salaam. She keeps cows for milk production. She has employed two assistants to help with the cows. She supplies milk to various restaurants and nursery schools in the Ilala district of Dar es Salaam.

The place where she keeps the cows is very far from where she supplies the milk. She wants to buy two new bicycles and vessels that will facilitate the supply of milk.

Together with this business she grows vegetables which she sells to small retailers. Her businesses are symbiotic; the droppings from animals are used as manure for the vegetables. She wants to stock enough medicines to treat vegetables against micro organisms during the rainy season, which lasts up to June. Cows are also very vulnerable to diseases during the rainy season, so she needs to stock enough medicines. The two businesses need USD1000 as working capital.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Chat

texts.en: Mrs. Chat Ang is 61 years old and lives with her husband and 4 children in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She makes her living by planting a variety of crops and selling them to the local market. Chat Ang can typically make around $3/day in revenue, while her husband makes very little money from working in construction. One of Ant’s children has been working at a nearby hotel partly  to help in financing the family and pay fees for the three who attend school. Eventually, Chat Ang hopes the loan will assist her to purchase some seeds and a motorcycle to transport their crops to the market. In the future, she would like to save enough money to build a house and send her children to university.

loans.use: To  purchase seeds and a motor-bike to transport her crops to sell at the market

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia C. X., 52, can be found just outside the entrance of the school every  day selling fruits in bag, juices, empanadas and crackers to the school kids.. At the beginning of every day, she puts aside the coin from her first sale of the day to give to the church. She believes it brings her good luck to think of others in need. She also owns 4 little plots of lands and rents 10 more plots of land where she grows vegetables. A plot of land is known in this part of Guatemala as a cuerda and is about one sixth of a football field. She sells the vegetables she grows  in the large market in Quetzaltenango. Cornelia is an ambitious woman. With the next loan she hopes to buy 100 chicks and 3 bulls. She and her husband work hard because they want to be able to leave some land for a house to all of their 5 grown children. Unlike most women of her age in this community, Cornelia actually went to school and finished the third grade, so she can read and write. All of her children also spent at least a few years in school. Cornelia's village is nestled right against the side of the Santa Maria volcano, part of a complex of volcanoes that regularly rumbles tand that completely destroyed the village in the early 20th century. It's a place of beautiful green hillsides and lush plots of corn and vegetables, all divided into little sections called cuerdas. The poorer women often rent just one cuerda and try to grow their own corn for the family and sell some vegetables from it. Those who have more sometimes own two or more cuerdas, and sometimes rent even more. It's hard work, and they always refer to their life as a "battle" or "struggle", but they continue with the battle to feed their families and keep the kids in school.
Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: 100 chicks and 3 calves

loans.name: Jamshid

texts.en: Jamshid is 40 years old and lives in Khachmaz town in northeastern Azerbaijan with his wife and two children. He rents a booth in the local market where he sells clothes and shoes that he buys in Baku's famous airport market. He has been in this business for nine years, and in that time has successfully repaid two prior loans from Normicro Khachmaz that allowed him to expand his business. Now he has applied for a loan of $1,500 to buy new goods to sell in his shop. Our goal is to secure $1,200 of that amount from Kiva; the balance of $300 will be funded by Normicro Khachmaz.

loans.use: To increase the size of his shop's inventory

loans.name: Fipe

texts.en: Fipe is married with two children and shares a house with her extended family. Her husband was the only person in their home who was employed until Fipe decided to help support her family by opening her own small business selling cold desserts such as shaved ice and ice cakes. She opened her business with the help of a $300 loan, which she paid back by selling her products daily in her village and at the local school. Now she has applied for a new loan of $300 to buy a big freezer, to use along with the small one she has had since opening her business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her business selling cold desserts

loans.name: Mokhy

texts.en: Mokhy A. lives in B.Gafurov, Tajikistan. She is married and has 3 children. She has been a very active client of MicroInvest since 2003.. She has recommended herself as a  serious and strongly motivated client. She implements commercial services and trade. She has a business in  child wear selling. Mokhy A. works in the Kistakuz bazaar where her shop is located. She has a large assortment and follows the new models and fashion. Now she requests a loan for business support to import new products and to enlarge her inventory.

loans.use: For business support

loans.name: Aura Elena

texts.es:
Mrs. G. sells clothing, shoes, phone cards, cosmetics, and Nicaraguan tamales on weekends. Her husband is a street vendor who sells phone cards. They have 4 daughters who are 19, 16, and twin 4-year-olds. In the future, Mrs. G. would like to open a store in her home, which is why she is requesting this loan that would enable her to buy school clothing and shoes, taking advantage of the coming school year. The loan will boost her sales and profits, helping her save enough money to set up her store.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Aura Elena se dedica a la comercialización de productos dentro de los cuales está la venta de ropa y zapatos, tarjetas telefónicas, cosméticos y venta de nacatamales los fines de semana. Su esposo se dedica a la venta ambulante de tarjetas telefónicas tiene 4 hijas, de 19 años, 16 años y unas gemelitas de 4 años. Doña Aura en un futuro quiere llegar a poner una tienda en su casa de habitación es por eso que pide el crédito para comprar ropa y zapatos escolares, para aprovechar la temporada escolar que se acerca y así vender un poco más e ir mejorando su capital de trabajo para ahorrar y poner su tienda.

loans.use: Purchase of shoes and apparel for the back-to-school season

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Driven by her love of cooking and the need to look after her five young children, two still of school age, Gloria opened a market food stall. There she makes ‘caldos’ (the name given to soups typical of her country) in the morning and also at lunch time. Gloria’s love of working doesn’t falter throughout the day, which is why she decided to also sell food at night from her home with the aim of generating more income, and thus being able to educate her children. With funding, she hopes to buy the necessary property to open a restaurant in her home and also buy a large stove. This way, she can improve service and generate more custom.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

El gusto por la cocina y la necesidad de poder mantener a sus pequeños cinco hijos, dos aún en edad escolar. Gloria abrió un puesto de comida en el mercado. Ahí prepara “caldos” (denominación de una sopa típica en su país) en la mañana y también en la hora de almuerzo. Las ganas de trabajar de Gloria no merman al pasar del día, es por eso que ella, por otro lado, decidió también vender comida de noche en su casa con la idea de obtener más ingresos y poder educar a sus hijos. Lo que ella espera, de obtener un financiamiento, es comprar los inmuebles necesarios para abrir un restaurante en su casa y una estufa grande. De este modo, podría mejorar la atención y recibir más clientela.

loans.use: To complete improvements within her restaurant at home

loans.name: Ni Putu Situ

texts.id:
Coconut leaves is one of the material for religious articles required by people of Bali. Ni Putu Situ saw a business opportunity in this area where she can buys coconut leaves from farmers and re-sells them to customers. She buys the coconut leaves from one coconut tree for IDR 5 thousand (around USD 0.55) and resells them in smaller packages to her customers. She can earns a profit of USD 0.55 from one coconut tree.

She has regular customers who come to her from Denpasar, the capital city of Bali once every 3 days. She can earn a profit up to IDR 300 thousand (around USD 33) per 3 days period. She uses the profit as working capital and also to finance her family daily needs.

With the loan money she wants to expand her business. She wants to bring her coconut leaves directly to Denpasar by herself so she can get a better profit margin.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Janur ( daun kelapa muda ) adalah kebutuhan pokok warga dipulau Bali karena janur sebagai bahan dasar membuat sarana persembahyangan umat Hindu. Ni Putu Situ melihat ada peluang bisnis yang bagus yaitu membeli janur pada para petani kemudian menjualnya kembali. Kebetulan didaerah tempat tinggal Ni Putu Situ banyak pohon kelapa sehingga Ni Putu Situ langsung membeli kepada petani secara berkeliling. Satu pohon kelapa yang diambil janurnya dibeli dengan harga Rp.5.000.- Janur ini kemudian dipotong dan diikat kecil-kecil dengan harga Rp.1.000.- Biasanya dari satu pohon kelapa Ni Putu Situ mendapat keuntungan Rp.5.000.- Ni Putu Situ sudah memiliki pelanggan dari Denpasar yang mengambil janur yang sudah siap untuk dipasarkan kembali. Setiap 3 hari sekali pelanggan datang langsung membawa mobil kecil kerumah Ni Putu Situ. Keuntungan yang didapat dalam 3 hari Rp.300.000.- Ni Putu Situ dibantu suaminya dan juga seorang anak laki –lakinya berkeliling mencari janur kedesa-desa. Mereka saling mendukung dalam menjalankan usaha ini. Keuntungan yang diperoleh digunakan untuk biaya rumah tangga dan untuk modal usaha. Dengan dana pinjaman yang didapatnya, Ni Putu Situ akan pergunakan untuk membeli lebih banyak lagi janur untuk meningkatkan usahanya. Untuk rencana kedepan, Ni Putu Situ ingin langsung membawa barang dagangannya ke Denpasar agar lebih banyak mendapat keuntungan.

loans.use: To add working capital (Menambah modal usaha agar dapat membeli janur lebih banyak lagi)

loans.name: Adzo

texts.en: Ms. Adzo K. is 33 years old and the married mother of 2 children, one boy and one girl, who are both enrolled in school.  In order to provide for her family, Adzo buys and resells plastic containers such as trash cans, jugs and other such items which are widely used.  Adzo’s shop is located in the central market Adéta, a medium-sized town about 150 kilometers away from Lomé, the capital of Togo.  With this loan, Adzo would like to buy more plastic containers to increase the size of her business. The profits that this growth will bring will enable Adzo to continue to send her children to school and to provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy more plastic containers

loans.name: Minh

texts.en:
Mrs. Minh S. is 44 years old and earns about $3.50 per day sewing from her house. Her husband, Mr. Nob Vanchhean, is a 45-year-old construction worker who makes about $4 per day. They have five children, one of whom is married.

She seeks a loan of $700 to purchase a new sewing machine and more cloth to sew and sell. This loan can help to expand and develop her business.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine and more cloth

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama D. sells fish. She is married, but her husband's income from fishing is insufficient to support their daily living expenses.

Nevertheless, there is high demand for Ama's goods, so she is looking to capitalize on such high demand by expanding her business in order to generate greater profits. Therefore, she is requesting additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To capitalize on the high demand for the fish she sells by expanding her business.

loans.name: Kurbongul

texts.en:
K. Kurbongul is a 60-year-old woman. She is married. She has two adult children and several wonderful grandchildren. Despite her ripe old age, her energy shines in her activities. Together with her husband, they have been involved in spare parts sales for household needs since 1999, at which time her entrepreneur son provided Kurbongul with startup funding. Gradually the business of Kurbongul expanded. Being hard working and polite by nature, she managed to build a clientele that is happy with the goods and services she provides. The income she derives allows her to provide for her personal needs as well as those of her family.

Today Kurbongul requests $900US for the term of 4 months. She is planning to spend the loan for purchasing spare parts to increase the range of goods. Kurbongul and her husband are counting on your help. She expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her and promises to repay the loan in time.

loans.use: Purchasing of spare parts to increase the range of goods

loans.name: Amin

texts.en:
This 45-year-old married man, Amin U., resides in the Ningarhar province. He is the father of two daughters and three sons. They are students, and they help their parents in their spare time.

Amin and his family have been living in a rental house for about 5 years. He says that it's very difficult to provide the necessities for his family besides 4,000 Afghanis ($80) house rent per month.

Amin U. has a small retail shop near his house. When he opened the shop, he had 40,000 Afghanis ($800) of his own capital. He purchased thread, milk, baskets, cookies, baby clothes, and other goods that are in demand with this money. In the beginning he was able to find many customers just in a few months; he was able to enroll his daughter and a son in a private computer learning course. Their life was going well and they were very happy. But recently Amin U. has been faced with some financial problems, because a few weeks ago, his father died and Amin had to outfit his tomb and shroud. So he lost much of his capital and then his customers went elsewhere.

Now Amin wants to stand on his own feet once again, and he thought deeply to find a better solution for these problems. Finally, one of his relatives advised him to take a loan from AFSG and purchase enough goods for his shop. He accepted this idea and requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 Afghanis. Amin U. wants to purchase sugar, oil, and rice and make some new shelves for his shop with this money. He seems a serious guy and will expand his business soon. Amin dreams of the day when he will find himself a successful businessman, and then he will help poor people, like the lenders who are helping him. He says that he will never forget their boon.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, and oil, etc. for his shop

loans.name: Macario

texts.es:
Macario tiene 43 años, vive con su esposa y sus 4 jóvenes hijos.
Desde hace un par de años notó la necesidad de establecer una tienda en su comunidad, ya que eran escasas y mucho más aquellas que brinden productos que satisfagan todas las necesidades de los pobladores, por tal motivo, empezó su dedicación a su negocio, trata en lo posible de ofrecer variedad de productos y buena atención, y cuando hay festividades en su pueblo, vende cerveza.Esta actividad le agrada mucho, porque le da tiempo para trabajar como agricultor en las mañanas, mientras su esposa atiende su tienda y por las tardes, él se hace cargo del negocio, para que su esposa vele por sus hijos. Lo dificultoso, es el transporte de la mercadería desde la ciudad hasta su comunidad. 
Macario tiene su motor de vida en sus cuatro hijos, por quienes se esfuerza en ser mejor.
Para poder incrementar y ambientar su tienda, para que pueda atender a sus clientes adecuadamente y ofreciéndole un ambiente tranquilo, es que solicita este préstamo.
texts.en:
Macario is 43 years of age and lives with his wife and four young children. Several years ago, he noticed the need to establish a general store in his community, being that they were scarce; especially those that offer products that satisfy all the necessities of the residents. For this reason, he began his dedication toward his business. He tries as best as possible to offer variety in his products and good customer service, and when there are festivities in his town, he sells beer. He really enjoys this activity because it allows him to work as a farmer in the mornings while his wife works in the store. In the afternoons, he takes over so that his wife can look after their children. The most difficult thing is the transportation of his merchandise from the city to his community. Macario’s reason for living are his four children, for whom he tries to become a better person. He is requesting this loan to expand and stock his store so that he can tend to his clients adequately, offering them a comfortable environment.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the variety of the products he offers and arrange his store in a pleasant and comfortable manner for his clients.

loans.name: Viole

texts.en:
Viole S., 40 years old, is married with five children.  She has many year of experience in the groceries business. She sells to the villagers and public seven days per week. She has had seven previous loans with SPBD.  

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (about 250 USD). SPBD loans are Viole's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. She works hard to support her kids attend school and church.

loans.use: To purchase a sack of rice, flour, sugar, salt, baking powder, onions, Lollioes, a box of herring, a box of chicken ,sausage,mutton flaps,ice cream ,ice pop box of noodles, twisties candles, insects spray, mosquito coils, gel, laundry powder, laundry soap and shampoo.

loans.name: Hakimjon

texts.en: Hakimjon is married and lives with his parents. He supports his family by running his own business of selling men’s shoes. His wife also would like to help him sell shoes. He needs to expand his business to increase his output. By doing so, he would like to borrow money with the help of a loan to increase his goods.

loans.use: Expanding his business

loans.name: Sopharin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopharin Y., who lives in Svay Kraom village in Kampong Chhnang Province, owns a small grocery store in the local market while her husband, Mr. Ly Vancy, is a construction worker. Even with two incomes, however, they still lack sufficient funds to allow their household to enjoy good living conditions. Therefore, Sopharin is requesting a loan to add her savings to build a new house for her family.

Sopharin is 25 years old and the mother of two children, one attending the local school while the other is yet too young to study. Her husband is on the left in the picture.

loans.use: To add to her savings to build a new house for her family.

loans.name: Kafui

texts.fr: Kafui T. est âgée de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de fruits et légumes à Lavie, un village situé à environ 135 kilomètres de la capitale togolaise. Son activité consiste à acheter ses marchandises auprès des cultivateurs et de les revendre sur le marché. Kafui espère avec ce crédit augmenter la taille de son activité. Cette chance lui permettra de gagner plus et de mieux subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Kafui T. is 42 years old, married, and the mother of four. She is a retailer of fruit and vegetables in Lavie, a village located about 135 km from the Togolese capital. Her work consists in buying merchandise from growers and reselling it in the marketplace. Kafui hopes to use this loan to expand her business. This chance will enable her to earn more and to do better in providing for the needs of her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruit for retail sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en: Twelve people who all live in Boeng Tras village, in Kampong Cham province formed this village bank loan group. They will use the loan for a variety of purposes and Mrs. Saveth M. is the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to hire labors to work in the field. She has decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Um Bory, is a fisherman. Mrs. Saveth M. is 32 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are attending the local school while the others are still too young to work or study.

loans.use: To hire laborers to work in the field.

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
