Toutes mariées, les femmes du groupe Djiguiya  vivant  dans de familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec les sœurs, frères, enfants et époux dans le village de Sirimou sous préfecture de Kenekou relevant de la préfecture de Koulikoro (région de Koulikoro république du Mali) ont en moyenne  24 ans et 3 enfants.
 Ces femmes unies par des liens de parenté exercent le commerce de  légumes et des condiments alimentaires.
Dans l’objectif de développer leur activité commerciale elles ont intégré l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe. Tous les prêts précédents ont été remboursés sans problème. 
Les membres du groupe Djiguiya comptent acheter,  400kg de feuilles de baobab séchées (qui est très appréciés dans les sauces africaines), une grande quantité de légumes. Elles s’approvisionnent sur place dans le village Sirimou auprès des maraîchers. Elles revendent sur le marché du dit village et  environs au comptant ou à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
 Elles envisagent obtenir un bénéfice de 12000 FCFA  chacune qui sera utilisé pour la prise en charge des frais de scolarité et santé des enfants.
texts.en:
All married, the women of the group Djiguiya live in traditional extended conjugal families with sisters, brothers, children, and spouses in the village of Sirimou (Kenekou sub-prefecture, part of Koulikoro prefecture) in the Koulikoro region of the Republic of Mali. The women average 24 years of age and three children. They are united by family ties and do commerce in vegetables and condiments.

With the goal of developing their business, they joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fifth group loan. All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. The group members plan to buy: 400 kg of dried baobab leaves (which are highly valued for making African sauces) and a large quantity of vegetables. Their goods are gotten locally in the village of Sirimou from market gardeners and are re-sold in the marketplace of the previously mentioned village and surrounding areas, cash or credit accepted, to customers composed of essentially women.

They each envision obtaining a profit of 12,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover the schooling and health care costs of the children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables and condiments

loans.name: May Flor

texts.en:
“In everything you do, put God first” Mayflor P. said.  The line also became her guiding principle in life.  Her family lives in the village of Calamagui, 1st in Ilagan, Isabela.  She is now 32 years old and married to June, 37 years of age, who works as a driver.  They, fortunately, are blessed with a son named Abilino who is only 2 years old.  Despite the difficulties of life, Mayflor and her husband are not losing hope in striving for a better future of their family.

Her husband operates a motorcycle transport business in their village.  With the loan she is requesting (PHP6, 000), Mayflor will able to help her husband purchase the needed spare parts for their motorcycle for its daily operation.  

Their tricycle transport helps them to earn money and provide for the basic needs of the family.  Without it they would be having a hard time supporting their daily needs since it is their only source of income in the village.  

Looking forward to the future of her son, Mayflor is hoping to save money little by little for her son’s education.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Edith Emelda

texts.es: Edith Emelda M., vive en la Colonia  San Felipe departamento de Ilopango; Edith tiene 50 años de edad vive con su esposo y tres hijos. Edith se dedica a su negocio que es una tortillera ubicada dentro de su misma casa; con los ingresos de esta tortillería Edith es un gran apoyo económico para la familia ya que asumen múltiples gastos,  ya que sus tres hijos asisten a la escuela. Edith es una mujer trabajadora y muy querida por los vecinos de la zona quiénes son sus fieles clientes, cabe mencionar que  Edith ya ha tenido créditos anteriormente y ha sido muy responsable en sus pagos. Ahora nuevamente  Edith solicita crédito para comprar materia prima para sus tortillas.
texts.en:
Edith Emelda M. lives in the suburb of San Felipe, in the department of Ilopango. Edith is 50 years old and lives with her husband and her three children. Edith has a tortilla-making business which she operates from her own house. With the income from the tortilla-making Edith is able to be a great economic help to her family, who have numerous expenses as her three children attend school. Edith is a hard-working mother, well-loved by her neighbours who are her loyal customers. It's worth mentioning that Edith has had previous loans and has been very responsible with the repayment. Now Edith is asking for a new loan in order to buy the raw ingredients for her tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw ingredients to make tortillas

location.town: Colonia  San Felipe, departamento de Ilopango

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr: Massan a pour activité  la vente de céréales (sorgho, mil, maïs, etc.), un commerce qu’elle a commencé en 1993.  Voulant agrandir son stock pour mieux vendre et pour mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, elle sollicite son premier crédit pour acheter plus de céréales.elle est mariée à un maçon, et ils ont un enfant.  La famille habite à Agoe, une banlieue au nord de Lomé, la capitale du Togo.
texts.en:
Massan sells cereal grains (sorghum, millet and corn, etc.), a business that she began in 1993. Wanting to increase her inventory to improve sales and satisfy the customer demand, she has asked for her first loan in order to purchase more grain. Massan is married to a bricklayer, and they have one child. The family lives in Agoe, a suburb to the north of Lomé, the capital of Togo.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of maize, millet, sorghum and beans

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina N. is a 32-year-old married mother of six children – three sons and three daughters. Some of her children are in junior high school while the others are in primary school. Georgina lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Takorase, a farming/commercial town near Akim Oda, in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Georgina works to support her husband in providing for the family and, in particular, to provide for the children's schooling. Her husband deals in diamond minerals.

Georgina is a trader in foodstuffs and has been in business for two years. She buys plantain from nearby smaller communities and sells it to food vendors and retailers. Georgina wants a loan to purchase goods in bulk so that she can expand her business and give her children the best education.

loans.use: To purchase plantain

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty A. sells maize, beans, pepper and other food supplies in Yamoransa in Cape Coast. Gifty has received a junior high school education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a policeman. Gifty has been selling maize, beans and pepper since 1998. She is responsible for paying the light and water bills. Her loan will be used to buy food supplies to increase the business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house for her children.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy food supplies to increase the business

loans.name: Yawo

texts.fr: Monsieur D. yawo mawuli est un jeune homme célibataire qui a très tôt abandonné les études pour se lancer dans la boulangerie, il fabrique des pains qu’il vend, ses clients viennent passer leur commande tard le soir et vont se faire livrer tôt le matin car souvent la demande est plus grande que l’offre. Afin de répondre d’une manière plus convenable à la demande de ses clients il veut se réapprovisionner en matières nécessaires à la fabrication de pain, il sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 03 sacs de farine de blé, 03 sacs de sucre, 10 boîtes de levures et du bois de chauffe.
texts.en:
Mr. D. Yawo Mawuli is a young unmarried man who soon dropped out of school in order to start up a bakery. He makes bread that he sells. His customers come by to place their orders late in the day. He goes to make deliveries early in the morning because the demand is often greater than what he offers. In order to respond to the demand in a more suitable manner, he wants to stock up on the necessary supplies to make bread. He’s requesting his first loan from WAGES to buy three sacks of flour, three sacks of sugar, ten containers of leavening, and some firewood.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, leavening, and firewood

loans.name: Margaret Auma

texts.en:
Margaret Auma O. is married with five children. She runs a tailoring shop in Kong'ou Market next to Kendubay which is about 200 km from Kisumu City. She manages the business herself and has has been able to create jobs for two other ladies in her dress-making shop.

She learned about KADET through other existing KADET clients. She is now borrowing her third loan from KADET having fully serviced her second loan of Kshs 49,000 (about $635). Margaret plans to use the current loan to increase and diversify her business by acquiring plastic seats for hire.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing materials, and to acquire plastic seats for hire

loans.name: Zumrud

texts.en: Zumrud A. is 45 years old. She is married and has 2 children. Zumrud's husband does not earn much money. To help her husband and to support her family, Zumrud has been running her business for 7 years. She sells household appliances. All the equipment is imported from Turkey and other countries. The business generates a significant income for the family, allowing them to improve their living conditions. Today, Zumrud is requesting $2000 USD. She is going to purchase new household appliances to expand the variety of goods that she sells.

loans.use: To purchase new household appliances

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie T.'s main source of income comes from selling seafood products, including a variety of dried fish, in her community. She is 39 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Lantay, Valencia City, Bukidnon. Jessie has been in this business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jessie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Jessie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the income of her family and support the education of her children.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ana Maribel

texts.es:
La señora ANA MARIBEL V. T., tiene 24 años, vive en el distrito de La Esperanza , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Jerusalén.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º de secundaria, tiene 1 hijo de 3 años de edad,  quien depende económicamente de ella.
ANA  se dedica a la venta de útiles escolares en  ferias , como: borradores, cuadernos, reglas, lapiceros, papelería en general, regalos, etc.
En su casa ha colocado 3 telefonos publicos para locutorio.
El crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de mas útiles escolares para la tienda de su casa.
 ANA sueña con ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana Maribel V. T. is 24 years old and lives in the District of La Esperanza, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Jerusalén”.

This entrepreneur completed her education through the 5th year of secondary school. She has a 3 year old son who is financially dependent on her.

Ana sells school supplies at the markets such as erasers, notebooks, rulers, pens, stationery, as well as gifts. In her home, she has installed three public telephones for her call center.

Her loan of 300 soles will be used to buy more school supplies to sell from her home. Ana hopes to continue expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school supplies to sell from her home business

loans.name: Oluwafumisho

texts.en:
Oluwafumisho is 50 years old and married with three children. She sells medicines and has been in this business for the past ten years.

Oluwafumisho hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. Will this, she can meet the demands of her customers. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a member of the mtivila borrower group in Kihesa, Iringa. She is 30 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 3 children. Her children are 18, 12,  and 4 years old.

Veronica has owned a clothing business for 2 years, she works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 170,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Veronica`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more used clothes for sale.

With the additional profits she gains from the use of this loan,Veronica hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes for sale

loans.name: Mrs. Norm Chhoem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Norm C. is a village bank president who has been selected by eight members in Prech village in Takeo province. All the members will use the loan which they obtained in different purposes. Mrs. Norm C. is a fruit seller in the local market. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fruit to re-sell in the market. Mrs. Norm C. is 51 years old and a widow with two children one of whom is a recycling collector and the other is a student. 

Six members in this village loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more fruit to re-sell in the market.

loans.name: Mujeres De Progreso 1, 2, & 3 Group

texts.en:
MarieL., 20, lives near San PedR. D. Macorís, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Mujeres D. Progreso (Women of Progress), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in her group.

MarieL. is a very amiable young woman with a knack for business. She lives on her own and is already supporting herself at a young age. MarieL. runs a small “colmado y fantasia”, or food and general store. MarieL. will use this loan to purchase Dominican cuisine, such as rice, beans, oil, milk, and some pastries. She will also sell perfumes, jewelry, wristwatches, and other trinkets. 

MarieL. lives in Andres Boca Chica, a town between San PedR. D. Macorís and Santo Domingo, the capital of the Dominican Republic. It is a town known for tourism, and MarieL. sells many of her trinkets to local tourists. She hopes that someday, she can run a mini-market with many more products. MarieL. speaks English well, and, with her hard work, she clearly has earned the respect of her elders by being named group coordinator. She is very thankful for Esperanza, and said that it has “provided the best opportunity to look forward to the future”. Thank you for lending to MarieL. and the Mujeres D. Progreso group!

loans.use: Food, perfumes, and jewelry

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy C. is from the city of Ozamiz. She is 25 years old, is married, and has one infant child.

Nancy owns and operates a business providing transport to local community members. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Nancy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from PMPC.

Nancy is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in her business. This will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: To repair her motorcycle

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Doña Martina tiene 60 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada y tiene 01 hijo, ella solo ha estudiado hasta 2do. grado D. primaria, vive en el Distrito D. Pilcuyo, Provincia D. El Collao, Departamento D. Puno.

Es una D. las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Ciudad Nueva”, ella se dedica a la compra y venta D. ganado vacuno conjuntamente con su esposo y desD. hace 03 años se dedica a la crianza D. cuyes.  Con su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles incrementó a su capital y compró 01 ganado vacuno.

Nos manifiesta muy contenta que para obtener un crédito no tiene que esperar mucho tiempo y le prestan con facilidad.

Con este crédito D. 3,000.00 nuevos soles comprará 02 toretes (toros).

Su mayor anhelo es aumentar más ganado vacuno mejorado y a su vez criar ovinos mejorados.
texts.en:
Martina, 60, is married and has one son. She only finished second graD. and lives in the Pilcuyo district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is one of the founding members of the "Ciudad Nueva" (New City) communal bank. She and her husband are cattle ranchers and for the past three years she has also raised guinea pigs. With her first, 300 sol loan, she bought a head of cattle. She tells us that she is very happy that she doesn't have to wait very long to get credit and the loans are granted easily. With this new, 3,000 new sol loan, she will buy two small bulls. Her greatest wish is to increase her herd of improved cattle and also to raise improved sheep.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of fish in bulk.

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantha T. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow vegetables. She is also a chicken breeder. Since her poultry business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more chickens. Her husband, Mr. Loem Bun Nak, is a teacher in the local school. Mrs. Chantha T. is 39 years old and the mother of four children: one is employed in a garment factory, while another is a driver and the others are attending the local school. 
Mrs. Chantha T. is the leader of a group with five members who all live in Sdao Kanlaeng village in Kandal province. 0004

loans.use: To purchase more chickens

loans.name: Amina

texts.fr: Amina F. est une femme mariée de 54 ans et mère de 3 enfants. Elle commercialise des produits halieutiques. Son objectif est de renforcer son capital afin de mieux subvenir aux dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille.
texts.en:
Amina F. is a 54-year-old woman, married with three children. She markets fish products. Her objective is to reinforce her working capital so that she can better meet the daily expenses of her family.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Marketing fish products

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia B. is from the village of Bato in Plaridel, Mismis Occidental. She is 42 years old. Anastacia is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Anastacia makes and sells hot cake snacks in the community. Anastacia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Anastacia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anastacia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. She used her previous loan to purchase additional products to sell. Anastacia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Anastacia's third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Chantha Nao Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantha N. was selected as village bank president by the members applying for this loan. The village bank loan group consists of seventeen people located in Preak Svay village in Kandal province. The borrowers all plan to use the loan for different purposes.  All the members are shown in the photo, but some of them are blocked.            

Mrs. Chantha N. is a house worker.  Her husband, Mr. Oroeung Oroun, is a rickshaw driver who earns some money to support his family. This family's house is old and in need of repairs, but they do not have enough money to fix it.  Thus, Mrs. Chantha N. decided to ask for a loan to repair their house. This couple has six children.  Two of the children are mechanics; one is a construction laborer, while the others are attending local public school.

loans.use: To repair their house.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
Rosmery, de 28 años, es una joven madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Alex de 28 años, quien trabaja como chofer y sus dos hijos; Jefferson de 8 y Grisell de 4 años, a quienes desea brindar una buena educación.

Con mucho esfuerzo ella ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, cultiva espinacas, zanahorias y lechugas, las cuales lleva a vender hasta la ciudad de Lima, donde las vende al por mayor. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio.
Por otro lado, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta la ciudad de Lima, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Para más adelante, espera mejorar su producción y poder así tener mejores ingresos.

Este es el noveno préstamo de Rosmery con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre está al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita comprará abono e insecticidas, con lo cual espera mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Rosmery is 28 years old and a very happy and hardworking young mother of a family. She lives in her own house together with her husband, Alex, who is 28 years old and works as a chofer, and their two children: Jefferson who is 8 and Grisell who is 4. They would like to provide their children with a good education.

With much effort, she has been able to work her lands and make them productive again. She grows spinach, carrots, and lettuce, which she brings to sell in Lima, where she sells them wholesale. Her crops have provided her with the necessary income to support her family, which is why she would like to put all of her effort into moving the business forward.

On the other hand, what she likes most about her job is caring for the crops. She has been doing this for 5 years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting her products to the city of Lima, since the sacks that she brings are very heavy and are very tiring. In the future, she hopes to improve her production and as a result, have better earnings.

This is Rosmery’s ninth loan with MFP. She has been very punctual with her previous loan repayments and hopes to be punctual now as well. At her communal bank, she is a very active member and is always on top of the agreements reached by the group. With the 3,000 PEN that she is requesting, she will purchase fertilizer and insecticides, with which she hopes to improve her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Los Jazmines Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “LOS JAZMINES”, está conformada por 10 miembros luchadores, quienes tienen por afinidad dedicarse al comercio minorista, trabajan con EDAPROSPO – prosperidad desde hace 8 meses.
Inés  Julia es una socia del grupo comunal y a su vez asume el cargo de presidenta, tiene 31 años, es conviviente, tiene 3 hijos de 5, 11 y 13 años, se dedica a la renovación de calzado de segunda y la venta de los mismos desde hace 5 años, y además realiza otras labores como es: cobradora de ómnibus por las noches, se inicio trabajando con su hermano y luego se independizo, con el esfuerzo de su trabajo ha logrado implementar un nuevo negocio (crianza de aves de corral), el gran sueño de Inés Julia es tener una granja para poder vender al por mayor. El reciente préstamo otorgado será invertido en la compra de pollos bebes. Todos nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo brindado y se comprometen a cumplir con los pagos respectivos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Los Jazmines” (The Jasmines) consists of ten determined members who have an affinity for managing their small businesses. They have been working with EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad for eight months.

Inés Julia is a member of this communal group and is serving her term in the office of President. She is 31 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children (ages 5, 11, and 13). Inés has been restoring secondhand shoes and selling them for five years. She also works other jobs, such as a bus fare collector at night. She started working for her brother and then later became independent. Through the effort of her work, she was able to start a new business raising poultry. The greatest dream for Inés Julia is to have a farm where she can sell wholesale. This latest loan will be used to buy baby chicks.

All of the members are grateful for this loan and commit to completing their respective payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase baby chicks

loans.name: Patricia Maria Ruth

texts.es:
Patricia C. de 54 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, su esposo es chofer en una empresa, todos sus hijos están casados. 

Patricia aprendió desde pequeña a cocinar con la ayuda de su madre. Cuando creció y tuvo su familia no tenía mucho dinero como mantenerla y decidió vender almuerzos en su casa a sus vecinos.

Ahora diario vende 30 almuerzos a empleados del sector, pero todavía los vende en su casa. También ha implementado poner cabinas telefónicas para tener otro ingreso adicional. Con el préstamo quiere  comprar cemento, piedra, bloques para construir un local. 

En el futuro quiere tener un local solo para las cabinas y en otro local un restaurante que cumpla con todas las exigencias de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Patricia C. is 54 years old and lives in the urban area of El Surburbio in Guayaquil. Her house is made of cement and receives all of the basic services. Her husband is employed by a business as a chauffeur. All of her children are married.

Patricia learned to cook at a young age with the help of her mother. When she grew up and had her own family, she did not have much money to support them, so she decided to prepare lunches at home and sell them to her neighbors. She now sells 30 lunches each day to employees who work in the area, but she still sells them from home. Patricia also installed telephone booths in order to generate additional income. With this loan she plans to buy cement, stone, and blocks so that she can build her own shop.

In the future, she wants to have a separate location for her telephone booths and another location for a restaurant so that she can satisfy all of her customers’ demands.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials so that she can build a shop for her food business

loans.name: Georges

texts.en: Georges is a 43-year-old married man and father of 2 school-aged children. He has more than 22 years of experience as a home electrician. He works for individuals and also does some projects for businesses.  Today, Georges is requesting to borrow $1,000 because he's planning to expand his business and needs to buy new electric tools. He hopes that with the help of the loan, his business productivity and income will increase and that this will improve life for his family.  He feels positive about the future of his business and certain that he will be able to take on more and bigger projects.

loans.use: To buy new electric tools.

loans.name: Teofano Rene

texts.es:
Rene forma parte del banco comunal “MI PERU”,  tiene 30 años y es soltero. 

Su principal actividad económica es la fabricación de muebles de madera, el tiene un pequeño taller de carpintería que funciona en la casa de su abuelo. El socio aprendió el oficio en el Centro Educativo Ocupacional de Garcilaso. Ya son 7 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Rene es un joven responsable y emprendedor que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su familia, él requiere el préstamo para comprar el motor de la maquina cierra circular que cuesta 450 soles y el disco que cuesta 30 soles. El sueño del socio es tener su propia casa.    

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente.
texts.en:
Rene is a member of “MI PERU” communal bank; he is single and 30 years old. His main commercial activity is furniture manufacturing. He has a small carpentry workshop in his grandfather’s house; he learned his trade at the Garcilaso Occupational Education Center. He has been in this line of work for 7 years now and does quite well. Rene is a responsible and enterprising young man who is always looking for ways to get ahead and to help his family through his daily efforts. He needs funds to buy the motor for his circular saw that costs 450 soles; the blade costs 30. His dream is to have his own house. He is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion. .

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motor and blade for his circular saw.

loans.name: Mardonali

texts.en:
Mardonali is 32 years old, married, and lives with his wife and four children. He has been a farmer for the past five years. He began farming with the goal of supporting his household, and above all, satisfying the needs of his children. For Mardonali, agriculture is an activity that he likes to do. Within it, vegetable production is what he likes most as it is easier to cultivate these plants and the product is profitable in season, which is annually. But the earnings are greater and beneficial for every farmer, especially when buyers purchase the production in great quantities and the expense of transporting the products is avoided as the buyers come to harvest and take them away themselves. Now Mardonali wishes to borrow money that he wants to invest in seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants. Be an important part of the growth of Mardonali’s business. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen M. is from the village of Libona, Bukidnon. She is 45 years old and married. Helen owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily-use products to the local community. Helen has been involved in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month.

In 2010, Helen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Helen's 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to poor households in Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Concerned Mothers, Kampala Group

texts.en:
Halima K. has made it a routine to take painstaking stock of her business plans at the end of every passing operating month. This has, to a great degree, lent her that survival countenance in her seven-year-old hardware business in Zana, Kampala.

The reason why most businesses around her locality have unraveled is because most people who embark on doing business don’t have solid blueprint plans drawn up to help their businesses succeed, not only in the short run, but also in the long term. Most are just out to make quick profits. K. is an exception to this rule as she comes up with daily and end of month plans and objectives aimed at elevating her business.

This mother of three has showed her worth in a business sector dominated by men. To get where she is today, she had to start off small. She recalls with nostalgia her first business: clothes sales. With savings from this and with the support of her husband, she made her plans of owning and running a hardware shop come to fruition.

In a week, K. makes sufficient profits to the tune of 500,000 shillings. Her sense of optimism is sky high, knowing that, with this loan, she is going to make strides in terms of improving her business. She is anticipating purchasing items like paint and cement in bulk.

loans.use: To purchase items like paint and cement in bulk

loans.name: Lidiya

texts.en:
Lidiya is married with two children. She sells clothing at one of small markets in Kherson town. Lidiya has been in this business for 10 years. Her profit is about 5,000 UAH per month.

Lidiya is a disciplined and honest person. She has used micro-loans before and has always paid them back on time. Her polite attitude attracts many customers. Many of them come back to her again. Lidiya has a good family where all the members respect one another. Lidiya is also respected by her colleagues at the market. She encourages them with her enthusiasm when the sales drop.

Lidiya is requesting a loan of 9,800 UAH to purchase more inventory. She hopes to increase sales and make additional income.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella C. is from the village of Deboloc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old, married, and has eight adult-aged children. To make a living, Estrella owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising chickens for sale. Estrella has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Estrella joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from GDMPC. This loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Estrella is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Santisima Trinidad Group

texts.es:
Alcancía Comunal "SANTISIMA TRINIDAD"

La alcancía comunal "SANTISIMA TRINIDAD" tiene trabajando con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD por mas D. 2 años y está formada por 8 socias, que viven en un mismo barrio, que con el pasar D. los años han formado una muy buena amistad entre ellas, entre una D. ellas se encuentra la señora Celinda, quien es madre D. un hijo ya independiente, por lo que se dedica a trabajar en un fábrica, y a su vez a vender productos D. belleza que ofrece a todos sus conocidos, amigos y compañeros D. trabajo.
En el futuro ella planea comprar ropa para venderla, y así tener un ingreso mas D. dinero en casa, por lo que tambien tiene miras D. alquilar o comprar un stand o puesto donD. ella pueda vender aquellas prendas D. vestir.
Sueña con terminar D. construir su casa, y comprar un auto el cual lo alquilaría.
Celinda usará el prétamos para comprar productos D. belleza y ofrecerlos a su clientela mas selecta.
texts.en:
"SANTISIMA TRINIDAD" (HOLY TRINITY) Communal Bank. The "SANTISIMA TRINIDAD" (HOLY TRINITY) Communal Bank has been working with EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD for over two years. It has 8 members who live in the same neighborhood and who have formed a strong friendship bond over the years. Among them is Celinda who is the mother of a son who is now independent. She is a factory employee and also sells beauty products to her acquaintances, friends and coworkers. In the future she’d like to buy clothing to sell so that her income will be higher. She also is looking to buy or rent a stand where she can sell those clothing items. She dreams with finishing her house and buy a car to lease out. Celinda will use the loan to buy beauty products to offer to her best customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted beauty products.

loans.name: Pauteñitas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Pauteñitas esta formado por un grupo de hombres y mujeres trabajadores, quienes luchan día a día para mejorar sus negocios y así mejorar sus ingresos para sus hogares, viven por el cantón Paute, allí está construida la hidroeléctrica mas grande el país, es de clima cálido,  la mayor parte de su población se dedica a la floricultura y al cultivo de varias frutas como manzanas, peras etc.

La Señora Jessica Eva Rodríguez vive en la comunidad de Uchupud que pertenece al cantón Paute; este es el primer crédito que realiza en la fundación y fue invitada por todos sus amigos que pertenecen a este banco comunal. Se dedica a la venta de comida en el mercado de Paute, se inicio en este negocio hace 3 meses, trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 8 a.m. hasta las 4 p.m., también cuida una hacienda hace 2 años en donde le dan una casa para vivir. 
Doña Jessica tiene 33 años, vive en unión libre y tiene 2 hijas de 16 y 14 años de edad que   estudian en un colegio de la localidad, su esposo trabaja como ayudante de la construcción, no tienen casa propia. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para su negocio para seguir creciendo ya que esta su meta principal.

La Señora Rosa Martha C. vive en la comunidad de La Virginia que  pertenece al cantón Paute, tiene 45 años, es soltera pero tiene un hijo de 19 años de edad que  estudia en un colegio a  distancia y trabaja en la agricultura, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres.
La Señora Rosa se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y cría animales como: cuyes, chanchos y pollos, también trabaja en la agricultura. Tiene un negocio de venta de verduras en el mercado de paute, ha este negocio se dedica solo los días Domingos.Este en el tercer crédito que realiza en la fundación, el  mismo que lo va a invertir  en su negocio de venta de verduras. Su sueño es el llegar a tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
The Pauteñitas Communal Bank is composed of a group of working men and women who struggle daily to improve their businesses and thus, increase their incomes for their households. They live in Paute canton, where the largest hydroelectric facility in the country is located. The climate is hot and the majority of the population engages in flower-raising and cultivating various fruits, including apples, pears, etc. Jessica lives in the community of Uchupud, located in Paute canton. This is her 1st loan with the Foundation and she was invited by all her friends who belong to this communal bank. Jessica sells food in the Paute market. She began 3 months ago, working Sunday through Sunday, from 8:00am until 4:00pm. She has also cared for a farm for 2 years, where she is given a house to live in. Jessica is 33 years old, lives with a partner, and has 2 daughters, aged 16 and 14, who study in a local school. Her husband is a construction assistant. They don't have their own house. Her loan will be invested in purchasing foodstuff for her business to continue growing, and this is her principal goal. Rosa lives in the community of La Virginia in Paute canton. She is 45 years old, single, and has a 19 year old son who studies in a rural 'school by satellite' and works in agriculture. She too lacks her own home and lives in her parents' house. Rosa takes care of the house and raises animals, including guinea pigs, pigs, and chickens, and also works in agriculture. She has a business selling vegetables in the Paute market but only on Sundays. This is her 3rd loan with the Foundation, and she will invest it in her vegetable business. Her dream is to finally have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MEAT, FISH, RICE, COOKING OIL, PRODUCE AND VEGETABLES TO SELL

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine W. is a 48-year-old widowed lady who has singlehandedly taken care of her two children who are now in the secondary level of education. She has been able to achieve this by running two businesses: a retail shop and a poultry farm. Her retail shop is next to the road so she gets to serve a number of customers who travel the road.

Josephine joined KADET after an introduction by staff on an awareness campaign and she has requested her first loan. She plans to use the funds to add more stock to her shop like cooking fats, detergents, biscuits, and other items and she also wants to use part of the loan to buy poultry feeds.

Josephine hopes to use the profits that she will earn, to invest in a hotel (restaurant) business. Her future plan is to open a wholesale shop and she believes that her hard work will definitely get her there.

loans.use: To buiy more stock for her retail shop and also poultry feed

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a 45 year old woman, married with seven children. Three of her children are below 18 years of age. She lives in her own house located in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a farmer and has been farming for ten years. This has enabled her to buy more land. However, she is constrained by the current climate change with uncertain seasons and prolonged dry seasons leading to low yields. Her family dream is to increase income levels for her household and her business dream is to become the leading farmer in the area. For this ambition to become a reality, she needs a loan to help her buy manure to boost the fertility of the soil so as to have increased production.

loans.use: To buy manure for her farm

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is a hardworking businessman. He is married and blessed with three children who go to school. He owns and runs Genesis Butchery, which is located within the Mukuru kwa Njenga slums. He has been running the business for three years. Apart from that, he runs a retail shop.  He hopes to own a wholesale business as well as a popular hotel in the future.  

He has requested 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy meat and to add stock of sugar, cooking fat, maize flour and salt.

loans.use: To buy meat and add stock of sugar, cooking fat, maize flour and salt

loans.name: Seferino Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Seferino R. es originario del municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, actualmente se desempeña como recolector de impuestos en la Alcaldía de dicho municipio donde tiene 6 años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel para la compra de puertas con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en: Seferino R. is originally from the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón and currently works as a tax collector for the city hall.  He has worked there for six years.  This will be his first loan through Ceprodel and he will use the money to buy doors so that he can make improvements to his home.

loans.use: Doors

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria G. is from the village of Katipunan,Sinacaban,Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old. Maria is widowed and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Maria owns and operates a business selling dried fish in the local community. Maria has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Maria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Maria is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional dried fish to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Maria from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase dried fish to sell

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta L. is from Capatan, Tuguegarao City. She is 56 years old, widowed and has 3 adult-aged children. Benedicta owns and operates a tailoring business, providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Benedicta has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Benedicta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Benedicta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. Benedicta is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase sewing materials. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Benedicta from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase sewing materials

loans.name: Aida Luz

texts.es: Aida Luz tiene 34 años, su actividad es una abarrotería desde hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio. Es una mujer muy responsable ya que es siempre le ha gustado trabajar. Sus inicios empiezan por su familia pues fueron ellos quienes empezaron este medio de vida a pesar de las dificultades que enfrento como son problemas de salud, ya que tiene que levantarse muy temprano para atender a sus diferentes clientes que siempre asisten a su negocio. El motivo de financiamiento es para la compra de granos básicos, detergentes, entre otros.
texts.en:
Aida Luz, 34, has been a grocer for over 10 years.  She is a very responsible woman who has always enjoyed working.

She started out thanks to her family because it was they who began the business despite difficulties faced like her health problems.  She has to get up very early to start attending to her customers who visit the store.

The reason for the loan request is to buy basic grains and detergents among others.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Pedro Raul

texts.es: Pedro Raúl tiene 48 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de sastrería desde hace más de 26 años que inicio este negocio con el fin de sufragar los gastos de su hogar, el es una persona muy responsable y disfruta de su actividad ya que la mayoría de sus clientes siempre le solicitan diferentes prendas de vestir y el siempre esta preocupándose por ofrecer prendas de muy buena calidad. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de hilos, tijeras, telas, zipper entre otros productos necesarios para la elaboración de sus productos.
texts.en: Pedro Raúl is 48 years old and has been a tailor for more than 26 years.  He started this business to cover his household expenses.  He is a very responsible person and  works diligently to offer high quality clothing. He enjoys his job since the majority of his customers request different types of clothing. With the loan that he is requesting he will buy thread, scissors, fabric, zippers and other items that are necessary to make his clothing.

loans.use: To purchase thread, scissors, fabric, zippers and other items

loans.name: Benjamin Daniel

texts.es:
Benjamín se dedica a la venta de pan. Tiene mucho tiempo de tener este negocio. Benjamín ha trabajado fuertemente todos los días por proporcionar el pan de cada día actualmente tiene ciertos pedidos que sus clientes le realizan.  
El desea adquirir más mercadería para ampliar su negocio y de esa manera poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar un crédito que será utilizado en la compra de materia prima. Benjamín es un joven bastante trabajador y que gusta mucho de colaborar con los demás, los ingresos que percibe de su negocio los utiliza para ayudar a su familia a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Benjamín's business is selling bread.  He has been in this business for a long time.  Benjamín works hard every day making his bread.  He currently has a number of orders that his customers make.  He would like to acquire more merchandise so that he can expand his business and thereby be able to meet his customers' demands.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan that he will use to buy raw materials.

Benjamín is quite a hard-working young man who very much likes to work with other people.  He uses the profits that he makes in his business to help his family get ahead.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Paula Marina

texts.es:
Paula es socia del Banco Comunal Color Esperanza, tiene 35 años, es  conviviente y tiene 3 hijos.
Paula es feriante. Paula compra papa al por mayor en el Mercado de las Americas y Santa Elena y lo lleva por flete a Lima al Mercado de la Parada ahí lo vende, ahora que es temporada de papa, realiza ésta operación casi diario y las épocas que no hay papa se dedica a la venta de cereales. Solciita un préstamo para invertir en la compra de papas. A Paula le gusta Finca porque le dan créditos y puede ahorrar.
Su sueño es poder juntar un capital y poder abrir un restaurante para poder estar mas tiempo con su hijos y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Paula is a member of the communal bank named "The color of hope". She is 35 years old, she lives with her common-law partner and she has 3 children. 

Paula is a merchant. She purchases potatoes in wholesale in the market named Mercado de la Americans and in the market of Santa Elena. She transports the products to Lima's market "Mercado la Parada" where she makes her sales. Right now potatoes are in season and she makes these trips almost daily. When potatoes are not in season she sells cereal grains. She requests a loan to invest in the purchase of potatoes. Paula appreciates Finca (Kiva Field Partner) because they grant her loans and she is able to save money. 

Her dream is to save enough funds to set up a restaurant. She will be able to spend more time with her children and to see them grow up to have careers.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes.

loans.name: Esmael

texts.en: Esmael A. is from the village of Collambutan Settlement, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He is 36 years old, married and has 3 young children. To make a living, Esmael owns and operates a tricycle-transport service (a motorcycle with a passenger cab attached to the side). Esmael has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Esmael joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esmael has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Esmael is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Esmael from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Azul X Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama AZUL X, en honor a la nieta de la Tesorera en base a la admiración que le tienen por salir adelante, ya que tiene sindorme de dawn. El grupo esta ubicado en el Estado de Puebla, México. Esta formado por 10 integrantes. La Presidenta del grupo es Doña MARIA GUADALUPE C. J., quien  tiene 39 años,es casada y tiene dos hijos, estudió hasta la primaria. Se dedica a la venta de joyeria. La Tesorera del grupo es MARIA ENGRACIA A. C., quien tiene 44 años, es casada y estudió hasta la secundaria, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, ella solicito el crédito para realizar pedidos por adelantado y obtener mayores ganancias, ella ha salido adelante gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación; sus compañeras la conocen desde hace tiempo y comentan que es  una persona trabajadora y honesta, ella solicita el crédito para apoyar a su familia y tener una vida de calidad.
texts.en:
This group is called “Azul X” in honor of the treasurer’s granddaughter who is greatly admired for the drive to succeed she demonstrates each day beginning at dawn. The group is located in the State of Puebla in Mexico and consists of ten members. Doña Maria Guadalupe C. J. is the group president. She is 39 years old, married, and has two children. Maria Guadalupe has an elementary school education and sells jewelry.

The group treasurer is Maria Engracia A. C. She is 44 years old, married, and has a high school education. Maria Engracia sells clothing. She is requesting a loan so that she can place orders in advance and generate more revenue. Maria Engracia has been able to get ahead because of her effort and dedication. Her fellow group members have known her for a long time and comment that she is a hardworking and honest individual. She is requesting a loan to help support her family and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: Operating capital to use as business investment

loans.name: Loun

texts.en:
Mrs. Loun C., 46, is single. She lives with her sister along National Road Number One, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  

Loun is a farmer. She grows vegetables on her farmland in the village where she lives. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to build a shelter to shade her vegetables from sunlight.

loans.use: To build shade shelter for vegetables

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan P., aged 62, is from Phnom Penh city, Cambodia. She is an elderly woman who is the mother of nine children, six of whom are married and live independently, while the other three are single and work in a variety of jobs. Chan P. says that most of her income comes from her three children because she and her husband stay at home without earning any money; they just manage household duties for the whole family. Chan P. has decided to seek a loan on Kiva to buy a window and door in order to replace broken ones.

loans.use: to buy a window and door in order to replace broken ones

loans.name: Natalina

texts.en: Natalina is currently in a business of selling beer and soda. She is 50 years old and married to a policeman. They have five children, three of whom go to school. Natalina requested a loan to stock more beer and soda to sell. She hopes to build a house in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with three school-going children. They live in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and food for the family.
For the past five years, Saumu has operated a food vending business, selling at the market, door to door and from home. Saumu faces the major challenges of high transport costs and theft due to the insecurity of her area of operation. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.
With her 35,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase sacks of beans, wheat flour and potatoes. She decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, to access loans to raise her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, wheat flour and potatoes

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
For five years now, Ama N. has been selling charcoal and pepper in the village of Efuago, which is near the fishing town of Elmina. She is married to a farmer.  

Ama is keen to grow her charcoal business and needs a loan from Kiva to buy more bags of charcoal for resale. She plans to save the extra income to purchase a piece of land some day.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to resell

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en:
Dalal is a 60-year-old housewife married to Omar. They have four married children. She worked in the retail business for 15 years and then started a small home business three years ago, selling household supplies such as pans, cups, glasses, trays, etc. During these three years, she was able to open her own store to sell household supplies and add more items and brands to the products she sells. Then she taught her son the business so he can continue running their successful business. She gave the store to her son so he can have an income source to support his family, and she has applied for a loan to buy new products and items to get more variety in the store.

Dalal is a conservative person so she recommended that her son appear in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more household products to sell

loans.name: Por

texts.en:
Por is a chief villager who grows rice and some fruit trees on his farm. He currently lives in the Baray district. He is married and blessed with seven children. Four of his children are employed. 

Por’s wife is a recycling seller. She buys used goods to sell to a wholesaler, who then sells the goods in bulk to other countries. The used goods she deals in are mostly leftover electricity wires. 

The family typically generates a revenue of US $5 each day to cover the family expense. Por is requesting a loan of $800 from Kiva through HKL to be used to grow fruit.

loans.use: to grow fruit.

loans.name: Jose Emilio

texts.es: Emilio tiene su sastrería en la aldea donde vive se llamada NUEVO PEREN,  alquila el local para poder trabajar  y hacer  pantalones, camisas, sacos, corbatas, etc. Ya que es muy conocido en el pueblo COMO UN BUEN SASTRE. Solicita el crédito para comprar telas sincatex, y como en su casa que se ubica en la aldea santa Anita patzaj tiene crianza de marranos también solicita para la compra de concentrado, su anhelo es tener un local propio para ya no alquilar.  Ya que necesita de mucha inversión porque tiene hijos en edad escolar.
texts.en:
Emilio has a tailor shop, called Nuevo Peren, in the village where he lives.  He rents a locale to be able to work making pants, shirts, coats, ties, etc.  He is very well known in town as a good tailor.

He is asking for the loan to buy Sincatex (brand of polyester) fabric and, because his house is located in the Santa Anita Patzaj village, he raises pigs so is also asking for the loan to buy pig feed.  

His dream is to own a locale so as not to rent anymore but he needs quite a large investment because he has three school aged children.

loans.use: to buy fabric and animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy meat and chicken

loans.name: Sandra Lizeth

texts.es: Sandra Lizeth tiene 32 años de edad, reside en la Comunidad de Telica Abajo a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Juticalpa, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos. Tiene un pequeña venta de abarroteria en su casa de habitacion, la cual atiende ella sola de Lunes a Domingo desde las 6:00 am hasta las 9:00 pm. Sandra comenzo este negocio dado a que frecuentemente tenia que viajar hasta Juticalpa a comprar en una bodega la provision de alimentos para su hogar y como siempre mantenia un buen inventario de productos sus vecinos le iban a quitar prestado alguno de estos y luego de un tiempo se los devolvian, asi que se le ocurrio que en vez de prestarselos se los podia vender. Con el prestamo solicitado comprará abarroteria en general (arroz, cafe, azucar, frijoles, manteca, pastas, condimentos, etc) y su pulperia estará surtida de mas y variados productos. Una dificultad con su negocio es que algunos de sus clientes le piden fiado y se tardan bastante tiempo en pagarle y eso hace que en ocasiones no tenga dinero para invertirlo en la pulperia. Su meta es sacar a sus hijos adelante en sus estudios y tener un negocio mas grande. Desde que FAMA la apoya con prestamos siente que ha podido realizar muchas cosas para ella y su familia. Tienes varios ciclos en FAMA y ha sido una cliente puntual en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Sandra Lizeth is 32 years old and lives in Telica Abajo community, 40 minutes from the city of Juticalpa.  She is a single mother and has three children. Sandra has a small grocery store in her home which she works in on her own from Monday to Sunday, from 6.00am to 9.00pm.  Sandra started this business because she frequently had to travel to Juticalpa to buy food for her household in a grocery store there.  As she kept a good stock of products in her house, her neighbors always came round to borrow stuff.  After a while they would return what they had borrowed.  It occurred to Sandra that instead of lending products, she could sell them instead.

Sandra will use the loan that she has requested to buy general groceries (rice, coffee, sugar, beans, butter, pasta, herbs and spices etc.), so that her grocery store will be better stocked with a wider range or products.  One difficulty she has with her business is that some of her customers ask to buy on account and then take quite a long time to pay.  This means that sometimes she doesn't have the money she needs to invest in her store.

Sandra's goals are to get her children ahead in their studies and to have a bigger business.  Since FAMA have been supporting her with loans, she feels that she has been able to do many things for herself and her family.  She has been working with FAMA for several loan cycles and has been punctual in making her loan repayments.

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 48 years old and has a fish selling business. She buys fresh fish and makes dried and salted fish. Nilda sells her products to the people in her community.

Nilda has 5 children and the oldest is 21 years old. Nilda works hard to support her family and to send her children to school.

Nilda has requested this loan to buy more fish to sell. In the future, she hopes to have a stable business that will help sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 51 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Delia has a food production business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Delia has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, Delia would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Jonadel

texts.en:
Jonadel is 36 years old and married with 4 children.  She earns her living by raising pigs in the Philippines.  Jonadel has been raising pigs for 2 years and also earns an additional income from her motorcycle transport business.

Jonadel is borrowing PHP 21,500 through NWTF, to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is 42 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has two children; both of her children are currently in school. Rachael has a business of selling poultry and animal feeds, which she has had for over 10 years. She also has a tailoring business.  

To help expand her business, Rachael has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase poultry and animal feeds for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rachael hopes to generate greater profits and improve her standards of living.  In the future, Rachael hopes to expand her business.    

Rachael is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her standards of living.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and animal feeds for resale.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en: Evaline is a business lady who is age 37. She is single and blessed with four children. For the last three years, she has been selling charcoal and fish to bring up her children. Her desire is to own rental houses in five years so as to generate more income. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy fish and charcoal.

loans.use: To buy fish and charcoal.

loans.name: Margarita Trinidad

texts.es: Margarita Trinidad tiene 25 años, hace más de 1 año que se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora por lo que disfruta de realizar su negocio con el entusiasmo que lo realiza todos los días. Ella ofrece productos como lápiz labial, pintura de uñas, pintura de labios, polvos, cremas, tratamientos, ropa interior. Ella se levanta temprano desde las siete de la mañana hasta las nueve de la noche que regresa a su hogar. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en: Margarita Trinidad is 25 years old, and has been selling cosmetics for more than a year.  She is a very enterprising woman who enjoys conducting her business, and has an enthusiasm that she brings to bear on a daily basis.  She sells products such as lip pencils, nail polish, lip sticks, powders, creams, treatments, and lingerie.  She gets up early in the morning, at 6 a.m., and works till nine p.m. which is when she returns home.  Her reason for the loan is to buy products for sale.

loans.use: to buy lip pencils, nail polish, lipsticks, powders, creams, treatments, and lingerie.

loans.name: Georges

texts.en:
Georges is a 59-year-old widowed man from Lebanon living with his two children. In 1987, he opened a car repair shop. His job consists in painting and repainting the cars. He has one full-time employee helping him with the work. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new improved tools and supplies. In the future, he plans to enlarge his shop and start a car spare parts sales business.

loans.use: to purchase new improved tools and supplies.

loans.name: Samol

texts.en: Samol, 42, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Samol is a nurse, earning around $11 per day. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $50 on food and $30 on other necessary expenses. Samol is requesting a loan of $800 to pay for her children’s school fees. In the future, she would like to repair her house. This will be her first loan from Kredit, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to pay for school fees

loans.name: Judy Antonieta

texts.es:
Judy es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”, ubicado en el distrito J., provincia de Chucuito y departamento de Puno, tiene 26 años de edad, es soltera y cuenta con grado de instrucción superior.
Trabaja desde hace siete años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles dinero que incrementó a su negocio de venta de combustible, paralelamente se dedica al servicio de alquiler de  escenarios para eventos.
Solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 1500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar tolderas, maderas y repintar los tubos, éstos los alquila a S/. 200.00 – 250.00 nuevo soles por día.  En el negocio le ayudan sus padres y hermanos.
Su sueño es tener un equipo de sonido, una casa, un carro y mejorar su negocio de venta de combustible.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Judy is a member of the communal bank “Santa Rosa de Lima,” located in the J. district of Chucuito province in the department of Puno.  She is 26 years old, single, and has completed some college studies.

She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for 7 years.  Her first loan was for the sum of 300 Peruvian soles, which she used to expand her business selling fuel.  She also has a business renting stages for events.   

She is requesting a new loan in the sum of 1,500 Peruvian soles to buy awnings and lumber, and to repaint the metal tubes used to support the stage.  She rents her stages for 200 to 250 Peruvian soles per day.  Her parents and brothers help with the business.

Her dream is to have sound equipment, a house, a car, and to improve her business selling fuel.

What she likes about her communal bank are the easy payment terms on the loans and the punctuality of her fellow group members.

loans.use: to buy awnings, wood and to repaint the metal tubes

loans.name: Nora Yamilee

texts.es: Nora trabaja fuertemente todos los días en su negocio como es su pulpería, desde hace más de 7 años que tiene esta actividad, el esfuerzo de ella para mantener a sus 2 hijos ha sido muy admirable. Ella vende sus productos a precios accesibles lo que ofrece a sus clientes son granos básicos, fideos, crema, refrescos, pan, golosinas, huevos y leche. Siempre le están solicitando variedad en lo que ofrece pues se siente muy contenta de tener un medio de vida. este es el motivo por el cual está solicitando el crédito.
texts.en: Nora works hard every day in her grocery store.  She’s been in business more than seven years.  Her effort to support her two children has been very admirable.  She sells her products at affordable prices.  What she offers her customers is basic grains, noodles, cream, soft-drinks, bread, snacks, eggs and milk.  They are always asking for variety in her offers and she feels very happy to have a way of earning a living and this is why she’s asking for a loan.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Zinabou

texts.fr:
Zinabou est une femme âgée de 42 ans. Elle est veuve. Elle a trois enfants.  
Zinabou travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2000. Elle  vend des céréales pour tous clients dans une boutique. Elle achète les produits à l’intérieur du pays. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté est la mévente.
Zinabou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Zinabou voudrait augmenter la taille de l’activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de financer les études de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Zinabou is a 42-year-old woman. She is a widow and has three children.
Zinabou has worked as a retailer since 2000. She sells cereals at a store to all types of customers. She buys her products in the interior of the country. She works alone. Currently, her biggest difficulty is a slump in sales.
Zinabou has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy cereals. She wants to reinvest in her business.
In the coming years, Zinabou would like to increase the size of her business. She says that with the profits, she intends to finance her children's education.

loans.use: To buy cereals.

loans.name: Turwanyubukene Group

texts.fr:
Azina  est une commerçante âgée de 27 ans qui habite dans le quartier Nyamugari de la Commune urbaine de Gitega de la Province de Gitega au centre du pays. Elle vend des arachides depuis 11 ans, un métier qu’elle a commencé alors qu’elle était commerçante de farine de manioc. Elle n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Elle est mariée à Yusufu , lui aussi commerçant de pommes de terre et ont ensemble 5 enfants dont 2 sont à l’école primaire et 3 autres sont encore à la maison.Sa famille héberge 2 enfants de la parenté proche.
Son crédit  Kiva de 200,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient va lui permettre d’augmenter son capital pour acheter une grande quantité d’arachides à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices et accroitre ses économies 
Elle est membre du groupe communautaire TURWANYUBUKENE
texts.en:
Azina is a trader who is 27 years old and lives in the Nyamugari district of the urban municipalitiy of Gitega, which lies in Gitega province in the centre of the country. She has been selling groundnuts for 11 years, a business she began when she was trading cassava flour. She did not attend school. She is married to Yusufu, who is also a trader selling potatoes; together they have five children, two of whom are at primary school and the other three still at home. Her family also has two children of close relatives living with them. 

The Kiva loan of 200,000 burundi francs which she is being granted will allow her to increase her capital in order to buy a large quantity of groundnuts for resale, so that she can make a large profit and increase her savings.

She is a member of the Turwanyubukene community group.

loans.use: to increase her capital in order to buy a large quantity of groundnuts for resale so that she can make a large profit and increase her savings

loans.name: Lambertus

texts.en:
